original: yang na phung po lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na phung po lnga ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or, the five aggregates are form, etc.

original: de bas na lus 'di ni phung pa lnga la sogs pa bsdus pa'i phyir phung po 'di 'bru'i phung po bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na lus 'di ni phung pa lnga la sogs pa bsdus pa'i phyir phung po 'di 'bru'i phung po bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, this body is a heap of the aggregates because it is a collection of the five aggregates, etc. It is like a heap of grain.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe dgod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe dgod pa'o //
translated: For example, is the statement of the example.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The other is easy to understand.

original: de nyid gang las shes she na bzang skyong gis zhus pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gang las shes she na bzang skyong gis zhus pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: From what is this known? The passage beginning with “in the Bhadramāyākāravyākaraṇa” explains this.

original: lus 'di la rnam par shes pa gang na yang mi gnas zhes pa ni mig nas yid la thug pa la lus 'di ma grub po //
analyzed: lus 'di la rnam par shes pa gang na yang mi gnas zhes pa ni mig nas yid la thug pa la lus 'di ma grub po //
translated: As for the statement that consciousness does not abide anywhere in this body, from the eyes to the mind, it is because this body is not established.

original: 'on te grub na ni sems gzugs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te grub na ni sems gzugs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were established, then mind would be physical.

original: ma grub na ni rnam par shes pa med na lus skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma grub na ni rnam par shes pa med na lus skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is not established, then without consciousness, the body would not arise.

original: nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: It would be like space.

original: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: de'i phyir nyon cig ces bya ba ni gong dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon cig ces bya ba ni gong dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: Therefore, “listen” is connected with what precedes it.

original: bden pa ma mthong bas ni rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ste zhes pa ni sems mthong ba'i dus bstan te /
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong bas ni rnam par shes pa mi shes mi mthong ste zhes pa ni sems mthong ba'i dus bstan te /
translated: “One who has not seen the truth does not know or see consciousness” teaches the time of seeing the mind.

original: gang tshe don dam pa'i bden pa mthong ba de'i tshe //
analyzed: gang tshe don dam pa'i bden pa mthong ba de'i tshe //
translated: When one sees ultimate truth, at that time

original: rnam par shes pa mthong zhe'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mthong zhe'o //
translated: one sees consciousness.

original: ji ltar mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong zhe na /
translated: How is it seen?

original: lag mthil zhes pa'i dpes bstan te /
analyzed: lag mthil zhes pa'i dpes bstan te /
translated: It is taught by the example of the palm of the hand.

original: bden pa mthong ba'i dus su dngos po thams cad sems kyi snang ba la sems nyid gang du yang mi snang ngo zhes pa dang / sems nyid gang du yang mi mthong ba'o zhe'o //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i dus su dngos po thams cad sems kyi snang ba la sems nyid gang du yang mi snang ngo zhes pa dang / sems nyid gang du yang mi mthong ba'o zhe'o //
translated: And: The mind itself is not seen anywhere.

original: don dam par gang du yang ma grub na kun rdzob tu ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: don dam par gang du yang ma grub na kun rdzob tu ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: If ultimately nothing is established, how can it be established conventionally?

original: de'i phyir phung bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir phung bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the aggregates, etc.”

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched ni phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de thog ma med pa nas tha mal pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched ni phung po dang khams dang / skye mched de thog ma med pa nas tha mal pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, elements, and sense bases are the aggregates, elements, and sense bases. Abiding in the nature of the ordinary since beginningless time is abiding in the nature of afflictions.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i phung po spangs nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i phung po spangs nas zhes pa'o //
translated: “Thus” means having abandoned the aggregates of afflictions.

original: cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdul phra rab las bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ste zhes pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdul phra rab las bsgrub pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ste zhes pa /
translated: The nature of being established from subtle particles appears to all tathāgatas.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i zhen pa bzlog nas phyag rgya chen po'i sku'i tshogs su byed do //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i zhen pa bzlog nas phyag rgya chen po'i sku'i tshogs su byed do //
translated: Having turned away from the clinging to the aggregates and so forth, one makes them into the collection of the body of the Great Seal.

original: de nyid gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de nyid gang las shes she na /
translated: From what is that known?

original: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @246a * //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya ba rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos @246a * //
translated: It is stated in the tantra of the great yoga called the Guhyasamaja, and so forth.

original: ta ; de nyid 'og nas rgyas par 'chad do //
analyzed: ta ; de nyid 'og nas rgyas par 'chad do //
translated: That will be explained in detail below.

original: de yang dang po nyid du rigs brgya'i dbye ba bstan pa ni thog ma nyid du phung po gcig tu 'dzin pa dang / rigs gcig dang lngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por rigs brgya'i dbye ba bstan par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de yang dang po nyid du rigs brgya'i dbye ba bstan pa ni thog ma nyid du phung po gcig tu 'dzin pa dang / rigs gcig dang lngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i gnyen por rigs brgya'i dbye ba bstan par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Moreover, first of all, the teaching of the division into one hundred families is for the purpose of teaching the division into one hundred families as the antidote to the clinging to the one aggregate, the one family, the five families, and so forth.

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i tshogs ni rnam par snang mdzad ces pa la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po'i tshogs ni rnam par snang mdzad ces pa la sogs pa la /
translated: Therein, the collection of the form aggregate is Vairochana, and so forth.

original: gzugs dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs dang 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is because of being similar to form.

original: gang gis mtshan dang dpe byang la sogs par 'dzin pa dang de dag pas der 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis mtshan dang dpe byang la sogs par 'dzin pa dang de dag pas der 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is because of the clinging to the major and minor marks, and so forth, and because of becoming that through them.

original: de yang rnam par dbye ba zhes pa ni gzugs la dbye ba yod pas rigs la yang dbye ba bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par dbye ba zhes pa ni gzugs la dbye ba yod pas rigs la yang dbye ba bshad par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, “distinction” means that since there is a distinction in form, there is also a distinction in type.

original: gzhan ni gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs pa dang / go sla ba nyid kyi phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhung rgyas pas 'jigs pa dang / go sla ba nyid kyi phyir ma bshad do //
translated: The others are not explained because of fear of prolixity and because of the ease of understanding.

original: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di skad du ston te /
translated: The meaning of these is taught as follows:

original: dang por bskyed pa'i rim pa sngon du 'gro ba dang bcas pa bsgoms nas de'i grogs su 'gyur ba bzlas brjod dang / tshogs dang gtor ma dang sbyin sreg dang // dam tshig nyams pa bshags pa dang / 'byung po bzlog pa'i cho ga dang /
analyzed: dang por bskyed pa'i rim pa sngon du 'gro ba dang bcas pa bsgoms nas de'i grogs su 'gyur ba bzlas brjod dang / tshogs dang gtor ma dang sbyin sreg dang // dam tshig nyams pa bshags pa dang / 'byung po bzlog pa'i cho ga dang /
translated: First, having cultivated the creation stage with its preliminaries, as an aid to that, one should complete the recitation, the assembly, the bali offering, the burnt offering, the confession of transgressions of the sacred pledge, the rite of averting the bhūta,

original: bgegs brtag pa la sogs pa rdzogs par byas nas gsal zhing yun thung ba dang sku gcig tu bya'o //
analyzed: bgegs brtag pa la sogs pa rdzogs par byas nas gsal zhing yun thung ba dang sku gcig tu bya'o //
translated: and the examination of obstacles, and so on. Then, one should make the form clear and short, and make it into a single body.

original: de la ni gsum dang / lnga dang / brgyar 'gyur te lugs su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la ni gsum dang / lnga dang / brgyar 'gyur te lugs su 'byung ba'o //
translated: In that, there are three, five, and one hundred, in forward order.

original: de la legs pa'i goms pa dang / sku lnga dang / gsum dang / gcig tu 'gyur te sku la bslab ba'o //
analyzed: de la legs pa'i goms pa dang / sku lnga dang / gsum dang / gcig tu 'gyur te sku la bslab ba'o //
translated: In that, there is the training in the five, three, and one form, which is the training in the form.

original: de nas bdag nyid thugs ka'i rtags la bsdus te /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid thugs ka'i rtags la bsdus te /
translated: Then, one should gather into the sign of the mind.

original: de las 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang padma la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'khor lo dang / rdo rje dang padma la bslab par bya'o //
translated: From that, one should train in the wheel, the vajra, and the lotus.

original: de las ni lnga dang brgyad la bslabs te /
analyzed: de las ni lnga dang brgyad la bslabs te /
translated: From that, one should train in the five and the eight.

original: lugs su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lugs su 'byung ba'o //
translated: That is the forward order.

original: de las lnga dang gsum dang gcig tu bya ste /
analyzed: de las lnga dang gsum dang gcig tu bya ste /
translated: From that, one should make the five, three, and one.

original: lugs las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: lugs las bzlog pa'o //
translated: That is the reverse order.

original: de ltar thugs kyi rtags la bslabs nas yi ge la bsdus te /
analyzed: de ltar thugs kyi rtags la bslabs nas yi ge la bsdus te /
translated: Having trained in that way in the sign of the mind, one should gather into the syllable.🔽First, one should train in one, and then in up to one hundred, and then in the reverse order.

original: dang po gcig dang de nas brgya'i bar dang / de las bzlog pa ni bslab pa la yang gong bzhin te /
analyzed: dang po gcig dang de nas brgya'i bar dang / de las bzlog pa ni bslab pa la yang gong bzhin te /
translated: The training is as before.

original: 'dis ni tha mal pa'i rtog pa ldog par byed do //
analyzed: 'dis ni tha mal pa'i rtog pa ldog par byed do //
translated: This causes the ordinary concepts to cease.

original: de bas na dang por kha dog la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dang por kha dog la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first one should train in the color.

original: de nas dbyibs la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dbyibs la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Then one should train in the shape.

original: de nas rtags la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rtags la bslab par bya'o //
translated: Then one should train in the sign.

original: des thogs pa med pa'i rnal 'byor thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: des thogs pa med pa'i rnal 'byor thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: By that, one attains the yoga of unobstructedness.

original: rdzogs pa la gnas pa rnams kyis ni de la skur byas te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa la gnas pa rnams kyis ni de la skur byas te /
translated: Those who abide in perfection should disparage that.

original: rten dang brten pa'i tshul du bdag @246b nyid kyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i tshul du bdag @246b nyid kyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on oneself in the manner of the support and the supported.

original: rigs brgya'i dbye ba bshad zin kyang rigs lngar 'gyur ba mi shes nas dris pa /
analyzed: rigs brgya'i dbye ba bshad zin kyang rigs lngar 'gyur ba mi shes nas dris pa /
translated: Although the division into one hundred families has been explained, it is not known how they become five families.

original: ji ltar na mdor bsdus na rnam pa lngar 'gyur ba gang lags zhes pa ni rgyal rigs dag dang rten gyi ngos nas 'gyur na ji ltar lngar 'gyur zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: ji ltar na mdor bsdus na rnam pa lngar 'gyur ba gang lags zhes pa ni rgyal rigs dag dang rten gyi ngos nas 'gyur na ji ltar lngar 'gyur zhes dgongs so //
translated: Having asked, How is it that in brief they become five? he thinks, If they become five from the perspective of the family and the support, how do they become five?

original: de'i lan du khams bzhi po bdag las gzugs kyi phung po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i lan du khams bzhi po bdag las gzugs kyi phung po mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: In response to that, the four elements manifest the aggregate of form from the self.🔽Moreover, that is the fleshly form of the aggregate, and that which is based on it is made of earth.

original: de yang phung po 'di sha'i gzugs can dang / de la brten pa ni sas byas te rdzas thams cad gcig tu sdud pa ni chus byas so //
analyzed: de yang phung po 'di sha'i gzugs can dang / de la brten pa ni sas byas te rdzas thams cad gcig tu sdud pa ni chus byas so //
translated: The gathering of all substances into one is made of water.

original: smin par byed pa ni mes byas so //
analyzed: smin par byed pa ni mes byas so //
translated: Ripening is made of fire.

original: yang zhing zo bdo ga bde ba ni rlung gis byas so //
analyzed: yang zhing zo bdo ga bde ba ni rlung gis byas so //
translated: Light and easy to move and to handle are the functions of air.

original: ji srid 'phel ba ni nam mkhas byas so //
analyzed: ji srid 'phel ba ni nam mkhas byas so //
translated: Expansion is the function of space.

original: de bas na de nyid rigs lnga'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid rigs lnga'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Therefore, they are the nature of the five buddha families.

original: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa 'byung ba lnga las gyur pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po lnga po'i 'di ni 'byung ba bzhi rgyur gyur pa dang / kha cig  ni dngos su rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa 'byung ba lnga las gyur pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po lnga po'i 'di ni 'byung ba bzhi rgyur gyur pa dang / kha cig  ni dngos su rgyu'o //
translated: The five aggregates of form, etc., which are derived from the five elements, are the five aggregates of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness. These are the four elements as causes and some are direct causes.

original: kha cig  ni rgyud nas so //
analyzed: kha cig  ni rgyud nas so //
translated: Some are indirect causes.

original: de dag rnam par dag pa ni sangs rgyas lnga ste /
analyzed: de dag rnam par dag pa ni sangs rgyas lnga ste /
translated: Their purities are the five buddhas.

original: go sla'o // de yang gang la shes she na /
analyzed: go sla'o // de yang gang la shes she na /
translated: This is easy to understand.🔽If it is asked from whom this was learned,

original: de'i phyir gsang ba 'dus pa las shes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsang ba 'dus pa las shes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it was learned from the Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas par //
analyzed: nam mkha' dbyings kyi dbus gnas par //
translated: In the center of the space realm

original: zhes pa ni gru gsum chos kyi 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gru gsum chos kyi 'byung gnas so //
translated: is the triangular source of phenomena.

original: dkyil 'khor rdo rje kun las skyes pa ni h'um la sogs pa las skyes pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rdo rje kun las skyes pa ni h'um la sogs pa las skyes pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The mandala born from all vajras is the Tathagatas born from the seed syllables hum and so forth.

original: zhi ba rdo rje 'dzin 'dod na //
analyzed: zhi ba rdo rje 'dzin 'dod na //
translated: If one wishes for the peaceful vajra holder,

original: zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgom par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa sgom par 'dod pa'o //
translated: one who wishes to cultivate the stage of completion.

original: bsdu ba dag kyang rab tu bya //
analyzed: bsdu ba dag kyang rab tu bya //
translated: One should also perform the gathering,

original: zhes pa ni rigs gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rigs gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: one who has become of a single lineage.

original: lung gzhan gyi dbye ba ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: lung gzhan gyi dbye ba ni go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: The classification of other scriptures is easy to understand, so it is not explained.

original: lus rnam par dben pa bsdus pa'i the tshom gcod pa ni gcig tu 'dzin pa dang / gsum du 'dzin pa dang / lngar 'dzin pa dang / brgyar 'dzin pa dang / de nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / phung po lhar mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: lus rnam par dben pa bsdus pa'i the tshom gcod pa ni gcig tu 'dzin pa dang / gsum du 'dzin pa dang / lngar 'dzin pa dang / brgyar 'dzin pa dang / de nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / phung po lhar mi shes pa dang /
translated: The resolution of doubts concerning the body's emptiness is the grasping of one, the grasping of three, the grasping of five, the grasping of one hundred, the grasping of that as the self, and the non-understanding of the aggregates as deities.

original: lha yang rigs brgya dang gcig dang lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa dang / de dag sngon du 'gro ba dang / lung dang rigs pa la the tshom za ba sel ba ste /
analyzed: lha yang rigs brgya dang gcig dang lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs las bzlog pa dang / de dag sngon du 'gro ba dang / lung dang rigs pa la the tshom za ba sel ba ste /
translated: The deities are also the hundred lineages, the one, the forward order, the reverse order, their preliminaries, and the resolution of doubts concerning the scriptures and reasoning.

original: gang gis gang gi the tshom za ba yongs su gcod pa'i le'u de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma zhes bya @247a * //
analyzed: gang gis gang gi the tshom za ba yongs su gcod pa'i le'u de la de skad ces bya'o // spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma zhes bya @247a * //
translated: The chapter is called what it is because it completely resolves whatever doubts there may be about whatever [topic].

original: ba'i 'gel pa las le'u gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: ba'i 'gel pa las le'u gnyis pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: The second chapter of the commentary on the Lamp for the Path to Enlightenment, called “The Collection of Deeds,” is finished.

original: // / da ni le'u gsum pa rdo rje bzlas pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni le'u gsum pa rdo rje bzlas pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the third chapter, the vajra recitation, will be explained.

original: de yang ji lta bu yin pa mi shes nas /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bu yin pa mi shes nas /
translated: If one does not know what that is,🔽it is asked, “Bhagavān, how should one train in the isolation of speech?”

original: dris pa / bcom ldan 'das ngag rnam par dben pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi zhes pa ni ngag rnam par dben pa thabs gang gi sgo nas shes par bya zhes dris pa dang / lan du dang po'i go rims bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dris pa / bcom ldan 'das ngag rnam par dben pa la ji ltar bslab par bgyi zhes pa ni ngag rnam par dben pa thabs gang gi sgo nas shes par bya zhes dris pa dang / lan du dang po'i go rims bstan par bya ste /
translated: The question is, “Through what method should the isolation of speech be understood?” The reply is, “First, the order should be explained.”

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa ni lus rnam par dben pa ste zhes pa ste /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa bshad ma thag pa ni lus rnam par dben pa ste zhes pa ste /
translated: The aggregates, constituents, sense bases, and so on, just explained, are the isolation of the body.

original: lus gcig tu 'dzin pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus gcig tu 'dzin pa ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the apprehension of the body as one [thing] is reversed.

original: de la lha rnam par dgod pa ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la lha dgod pa'o //
analyzed: de la lha rnam par dgod pa ni phung po dang / khams dang skye mched la lha dgod pa'o //
translated: The deity is the deity placed in the aggregates, elements, and media.

original: thams cad kyi thun mong gi dngos grub dang / mchog gi dngos grub thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'o //🔽rags pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thun mong gi dngos grub dang / mchog gi dngos grub thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'o // rags pa'i rnal 'byor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The common is the common attainment, and the supreme is the supreme attainment.

original: rags pa'i rtag pa bzlog pa dang / rags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: rags pa'i rtag pa bzlog pa dang / rags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The gross yoga is so called because it is the antidote to the gross, and because it has the gross as its object.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa mthar phyin nas ci byed ce na /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa mthar phyin nas ci byed ce na /
translated: Having completed the stage of generation, what does one do?

original: ngag rnam par dben pa la slob ste /
analyzed: ngag rnam par dben pa la slob ste /
translated: One trains in the isolation of speech.

original: rlung dang sngags dang rdo rje bzlas pa la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rlung dang sngags dang rdo rje bzlas pa la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the samadhi which has as its object the wind, the mantra, and the vajra repetition.

original: gang gi spyod yul yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi spyod yul yin zhe na /
translated: What is its domain?

original: rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi yul yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs pa'i rigs can gyi yul yin te /
translated: It is the domain of the vajra and other families.

original: gzhan gang gi yang yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gang gi yang yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not the domain of any other.

original: gang gi ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi ma yin zhe na /
translated: What is not its domain?

original: theg pa chen po pa rnams kyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po pa rnams kyi yul ma yin te /
translated: It is not the domain of the Mahayana.

original: rnam par rig pa po dang / bya ba dang spyod pa dang / gnyi ga'i rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyi yul yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa po dang / bya ba dang spyod pa dang / gnyi ga'i rgyud la gnas pa rnams kyi yul yin no //
translated: It is the object of the knowers of the various aspects, of the actions and conduct, and of those who abide in both continuums.

original: rdo rje theg pa nang pa yang kun gyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rdo rje theg pa nang pa yang kun gyi yul ma yin te /
translated: The inner Vajrayāna is also not the object of all,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la yang rags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la yang rags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because even in the stage of generation, the object is coarse.

original: / de dag gi yul ma yin pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de dag gi yul ma yin pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the object of those?

original: shin tu phra ba'i phyir te rtog ge pa'i yul ma yin zhing /
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i phyir te rtog ge pa'i yul ma yin zhing /
translated: Because it is extremely subtle, it is not the object of logicians.

original: lung dang zhe 'gras pa'i yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lung dang zhe 'gras pa'i yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the object of those who are hostile to scripture,

original: de bas na de bshad par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na de bshad par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: therefore, it should be explained.

original: ngag rnam par dben pa yang thabs gang dang gang gis byed cen  sngags kyi de kho na nyid de /
analyzed: ngag rnam par dben pa yang thabs gang dang gang gis byed cen  sngags kyi de kho na nyid de /
translated: By what means is speech isolation accomplished? By the reality of mantra.

original: ma nor ba'i bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: ma nor ba'i bzlas pa'o //
translated: It is the recitation that is not erroneous.

original: de yang gang gi grogs su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang gi grogs su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what is that accomplished?

original: rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi rim pa dang bral bas na mi shes te /
analyzed: rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi rim pa dang bral bas na mi shes te /
translated: It is not known because it is devoid of the stages of the reality of the vāyu.

original: de bas na rlung nye ba'i grogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rlung nye ba'i grogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the vāyu is the proximate cause.

original: rlung zhes bya ba yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called wind?

original: srog dang rtsol ba ste /
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba ste /
translated: It is life-force and exertion.

original: gnas pa ni srog go //
analyzed: gnas pa ni srog go //
translated: Life-force is abiding.

original: 'byung ba dang @247b 'jug pa ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang @247b 'jug pa ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: Exertion is arising and entering.

original: yang na 'byung ba ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, exertion is arising.

original: 'jug pa ni srog go //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni srog go //
translated: Life-force is entering.

original: yang na rtsa ba'i rlung lnga ni srog ste /
analyzed: yang na rtsa ba'i rlung lnga ni srog ste /
translated: Alternatively, the five root winds are life-force.

original: yan lag gi rlung ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi rlung ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: The branch winds are exertion.

original: yang na rlung dngos ni srog ste /
analyzed: yang na rlung dngos ni srog ste /
translated: Alternatively, the actual wind is life-force.

original: de'i las ni rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: de'i las ni rtsol ba'o //
translated: Its function is exertion.

original: de yang gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de yang gang las shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: gsang ba 'dus pa las te /
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa las te /
translated: It is known from the Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa ni rdo rje rtse lnga pa'o //
translated: The five-colored jewel is the five-pronged vajra.

original: tshad ji tsam zhe na /🔽yungs kar tsam ste /
analyzed: tshad ji tsam zhe na / yungs kar tsam ste /
translated: What is its size?🔽It is the size of a mustard seed.

original: yungs kar dang 'dra ba'i tshad do //
analyzed: yungs kar dang 'dra ba'i tshad do //
translated: It is the size of a mustard seed.

original: gar bsgom zhe na rang gi sna'i rtse mo'i sor bzhi tsam du bsgoms la de la rlung bsdu'o //
analyzed: gar bsgom zhe na rang gi sna'i rtse mo'i sor bzhi tsam du bsgoms la de la rlung bsdu'o //
translated: Where is it meditated? It is meditated at the tip of one's nose, about four finger-widths away, and the wind is gathered there.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: rnal 'byor rig pas te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor rig pas te /
translated: By the knowledge of yoga.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis yang dang yang du gtad de bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis yang dang yang du gtad de bsgom pa'o //
translated: By samādhi, one focuses again and again and meditates.

original: dus ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: dus ji tsam zhe na /
translated: For how long?

original: rtag tu ste ji srid du 'bras bu ma thob pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom zhe'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ste ji srid du 'bras bu ma thob pa de srid kyi bar du bsgom zhe'o //
translated: Always, until the fruit is attained.

original: yang na rin po che dang 'dra bas rin po che ste /
analyzed: yang na rin po che dang 'dra bas rin po che ste /
translated: Or, it is a jewel because it is like a jewel.

original: rang gi sna'i rtse mo la thig le yungs kar tsam bsams la /
analyzed: rang gi sna'i rtse mo la thig le yungs kar tsam bsams la /
translated: One should imagine a drop the size of a mustard seed at the tip of one's nose.

original: rang gi snying gar yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar yang de bzhin te /
translated: And also in one's heart.

original: 'dis ye shes lnga skye bar gyur pas kha dog lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dis ye shes lnga skye bar gyur pas kha dog lnga'o //
translated: Since the five intuitions arise through this, it is five-colored.

original: yungs kar la sogs pa ni gong bzhin no //
analyzed: yungs kar la sogs pa ni gong bzhin no //
translated: Mustard seed, etc., are as above.

original: yang na rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa ni byang chub sems kyi thig le yungs kar tsam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa ni byang chub sems kyi thig le yungs kar tsam pa'o //
translated: Or, the five-colored jewel is the drop of the enlightenment spirit the size of a mustard seed.

original: gnas gar bsgom zhe na sna'i rtse mo ste /
analyzed: gnas gar bsgom zhe na sna'i rtse mo ste /
translated: Where should one meditate? At the tip of the nose.

original: mig la sogs pa la ye shes kyi rtsa kha bye ba la bsgom par bya'o zhe'o ;
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la ye shes kyi rtsa kha bye ba la bsgom par bya'o zhe'o ;
translated: One should meditate on the opening of the intuition channel in the eye, etc.

original: / yang na rang gi rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa'i nor bu'i cha la bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i dbus kyi mdud pa'i nang du byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le yungs kar tsam pa zhig bsams la rang bzhin lte ba'i phyogs su yang de bzhin te
analyzed: / yang na rang gi rdo rje rtse mo lnga pa'i nor bu'i cha la bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i dbus kyi mdud pa'i nang du byang chub kyi sems kyi thig le yungs kar tsam pa zhig bsams la rang bzhin lte ba'i phyogs su yang de bzhin te
translated: Or else, in the part of the jewel of one's five-pointed vajra, in the middle of the wheel of great bliss, in the interior of the knot, one should imagine a drop of bodhicitta the size of a mustard seed.

original: de la 'byung ba dang 'jug pa la bslab par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba dang 'jug pa la bslab par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: In the same way, in the natural navel region, one should train in the arising and entering.

original: yang na / rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa //
analyzed: yang na / rin chen kha dog sna lnga pa //
translated: Or else, the five-colored jewel

original: zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi sna rtse re re la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs kyi sna rtse re re la gnas pa ste /
translated: is located at the tip of the nose of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'dis 'bras bu rin thang med pa thob pa'i phyir rin po che'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'bras bu rin thang med pa thob pa'i phyir rin po che'o //
translated: It is a jewel because it obtains the priceless fruit.

original: yungs kar gyi 'bru tshad tsam pa ni tshad 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yungs kar gyi 'bru tshad tsam pa ni tshad 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The size of a mustard seed is the measure.

original: gang gi gzugs yungs kar dang mnyam pa de la yungs kar tsam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi gzugs yungs kar dang mnyam pa de la yungs kar tsam zhes bya'o //
translated: That which has the form equal to a mustard seed is called the size of a mustard seed.

original: rdo rje'i tshig ni rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig ni rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: The vajra words are difficult to understand.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o //
translated: They are explained with an intention.

original: yang na rdo rjes gzhan 'joms par byed pa bzhin du tshig 'di bstan pa'i don la gnas na gzhan nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: yang na rdo rjes gzhan 'joms par byed pa bzhin du tshig 'di bstan pa'i don la gnas na gzhan nyon mongs pa 'joms par byed do //
translated: Or, just as a diamond destroys other things, so this speech, if one abides in the meaning of the teaching, destroys other afflictions.

original: yang na rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje ni rdo rje sems dpa' ste /
translated: Or, a diamond is Vajrasattva,

original: de'i ngag gi tshogs 'di yang rdo rje'i tshig @248a * //
analyzed: de'i ngag gi tshogs 'di yang rdo rje'i tshig @248a * //
translated: and this collection of his speech is diamond speech.

original: go ; / nges pa'i don dang drang ba'i don gyi dbye bas zhes pa ni nges pa'i don du phra mo'i rnal 'byor la drang ba'i don du bskyed pa'i rim pa'o zhes bya ba dgongs so //
analyzed: go ; / nges pa'i don dang drang ba'i don gyi dbye bas zhes pa ni nges pa'i don du phra mo'i rnal 'byor la drang ba'i don du bskyed pa'i rim pa'o zhes bya ba dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that by the division of the definitive and interpretable meanings, the subtle yoga is definitive, and the generation stage is interpretable.

original: bskyed pa'i rnal 'byor yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rnal 'byor yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the generation yoga?🔽Therefore, it is said,

original: de'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom par byed pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: by one who cultivates the generation stage,

original: gang gis sems can skye ba dang mthun par byas pas bskyed pa'i rim pa ste /🔽kha cig  ni sgo nga las skyes pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis sems can skye ba dang mthun par byas pas bskyed pa'i rim pa ste / kha cig  ni sgo nga las skyes pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: since it is made to accord with the birth of sentient beings, it is the generation stage.🔽Some are in accord with birth from an egg.

original: kha cig  ni sgo nga la skyes pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig  ni sgo nga la skyes pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Some are in accord with birth from a womb.

original: kha cig  ni drod gsher las skyes pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig  ni drod gsher las skyes pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Some are born from heat and moisture.

original: kha cig  ni mngal nas skyes pa dang mthun par byas pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig  ni mngal nas skyes pa dang mthun par byas pa'o //
translated: Some are born from a womb.

original: de'i dbang du byas pa bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas pa bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of that is as follows.

original: sna'i rtse mor yungs kar gyi 'bru tshad tsam pa'i rang gi lha'i mtshan ma rdo rje la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs dang tshul dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sna'i rtse mor yungs kar gyi 'bru tshad tsam pa'i rang gi lha'i mtshan ma rdo rje la sogs pa kha dog dang dbyibs dang tshul dang ldan par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: At the tip of the nose, one should meditate on the seed syllable of one's deity, the size of a mustard seed, with the color, shape, and form of a vajra, and so on.

original: cig shos bshad pa /
analyzed: cig shos bshad pa /
translated: The other is explained.

original: a'a li dang k'a li ni thabs dang shes rab kyi yi ge'o //
analyzed: a'a li dang k'a li ni thabs dang shes rab kyi yi ge'o //
translated: The vowels and consonants are the method and wisdom syllables.

original: de nyid las btus nas gsum du 'dod pa'i aom a'a:h'um ngo //
analyzed: de nyid las btus nas gsum du 'dod pa'i aom a'a:h'um ngo //
translated: Extracted from that, they are asserted as three: Om, Ah, and Hum.

original: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning ni gzhung 'di nyid kyi dpe dgod do //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning ni gzhung 'di nyid kyi dpe dgod do //
translated: Female, male, and neuter are cited in this very text.

original: 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba ni dbugs kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba ni dbugs kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Entering, abiding, and rising are in terms of the breath.

original: aom ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: aom ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: Om is entering.

original: h'um ni ldang ba'o //
analyzed: h'um ni ldang ba'o //
translated: Hum is rising.

original: a'a: ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: a'a: ni gnas pa'o //
translated: Ah is abiding.

original: gang gis gang las 'byung ba gnas par byed ce na ;
analyzed: gang gis gang las 'byung ba gnas par byed ce na ;
translated: By what and from what does it arise and abide?

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi ste 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi ste 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The four mandalas will be explained below.

original: ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin dbugs //
analyzed: ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin dbugs //
translated: The breath has the nature of the five intuitions.

original: zhes pa ni kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: This refers to the wind possessing the five colors.

original: 'byung ba lnga yi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga yi ngo bo nyid //
translated: It has the nature of the five elements.

original: ces pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid gyen du rgyu ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid gyen du rgyu ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This refers to the up-moving wind, etc., which have the nature of earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: gong bu'i gzugs kyis phyung nas ni //🔽zhes pa ni thig le'am /
analyzed: gong bu'i gzugs kyis phyung nas ni // zhes pa ni thig le'am /
translated: Having brought it out in the form of a globe,🔽This refers to the form of a drop,

original: yi ge'am / sku dang mtshan ma dang kha dog rags pa'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: yi ge'am / sku dang mtshan ma dang kha dog rags pa'i ngo bor ro //
translated: a syllable, a body, a sign, or a gross color.

original: gnas gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gang du zhe na /
translated: Where is it located?

original: steng gi sna'i rtse mor rab tu brtag ste /
analyzed: steng gi sna'i rtse mor rab tu brtag ste /
translated: It is to be examined at the tip of the nose above.

original: sna'i rtse mo la sems gzung bar bya zhing yang dang yang du de la brtag par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sna'i rtse mo la sems gzung bar bya zhing yang dang yang du de la brtag par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intention is that the mind should be held at the tip of the nose and that it should be examined again and again there.

original: des bka' dgongs pa can gzhan ston pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: des bka' dgongs pa can gzhan ston pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is argued that this teaches other intentional statements, that is not so.

original: de'i phyir dgongs pa lung ston pa las bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes pa ni rigs drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgongs pa lung ston pa las bshad de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te de nas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje can zhes pa ni rigs drug pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: Then, the Blessed One, the Vajra Holder, is the sixth buddha, Mahāvajradhara.

original: rdo rje snying po mchog 'dzin pa //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po mchog 'dzin pa //
translated: Holding the supreme vajra essence

original: zhes pa ni don dam pa spros pa @248b dang ngal  ba thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don dam pa spros pa @248b dang ngal  ba thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: means that he has realized the ultimate, free from conceptual elaborations and effort.

original: 'gro ba gcig pu zhes pa ni sems can gyi don mtha' dag byed pa'i bdag po rdo rje 'chang nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba gcig pu zhes pa ni sems can gyi don mtha' dag byed pa'i bdag po rdo rje 'chang nyid do //
translated: The sole protector of beings means that he is Vajradhara himself, the lord who accomplishes the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: 'o na thub pa sangs rgyas gzhan ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na thub pa sangs rgyas gzhan ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t the Sage another buddha?

original: de nyid kyang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is also the very body of Mahāvajradhara.

original: gal te de lta na ni de ltar snang bar mi rigs so zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni de ltar snang bar mi rigs so zhe na ;
translated: If that is so, it is not reasonable that he appears in that way.

original: ma yin te bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje chen pos ji ltar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: ma yin te bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje chen pos ji ltar yang snang ngo //
translated: No, it is not so, because he appears in any way through the great compassion of the Blessed One.

original: de lta gang gis phyag 'tshal zhe na /
analyzed: de lta gang gis phyag 'tshal zhe na /
translated: By whom is he thus praised?

original: sdud pa po thugs rje chen po'i snang ba las byung ba des phyag 'tshal zhe'o //
analyzed: sdud pa po thugs rje chen po'i snang ba las byung ba des phyag 'tshal zhe'o //
translated: pays homage.

original: gsol ba btab pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gsol ba btab pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The supplication is easy to understand.

original: lan du / khyod gsang dgongs pa ma rtogs pa //
analyzed: lan du / khyod gsang dgongs pa ma rtogs pa //
translated: In response, [the Bhagavān] says, “You have not realized the secret intention.”

original: zhes pa ni lag na rdo rje khyod kyis gsang ba chen po'i dgongs pa can ma rtogs pa slar 'dri bar byed pa legs so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lag na rdo rje khyod kyis gsang ba chen po'i dgongs pa can ma rtogs pa slar 'dri bar byed pa legs so zhes pa'o //
translated: This means, “O Vajrapāṇi, it is excellent that you ask again because you have not realized the one who has the intention of the great secret.”

original: byang chub sems ni rlung gyur cing //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni rlung gyur cing //
translated: Bodhicitta becomes wind.

original: zhes pa ni rang gi khu ba byang chub sems nyad rlung du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang gi khu ba byang chub sems nyad rlung du gyur pa'o //
translated: This means that one’s own bodhicitta becomes wind.

original: de yang gnyis te de nyid rlung du gyur pa dang / de las rlung du gyur pa las de nyid ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: de yang gnyis te de nyid rlung du gyur pa dang / de las rlung du gyur pa las de nyid ni ma yin te ;
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds: that which becomes wind and that which becomes wind from that. The former is not the latter.

original: g-yo ba dang brtan pa gcig gis gcig spangs pa dang / don dam par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang brtan pa gcig gis gcig spangs pa dang / don dam par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The moving and the stable are mutually exclusive, and ultimately, they are also mutually exclusive.

original: 'dir ni de las byung bar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni de las byung bar brtag par bya ste /
translated: Here, it should be considered that [bodhicitta] arises from that.

original: 'dir dang po byang chub sems las srog 'dzin pa'i rlung la sogs par gyur to //
analyzed: 'dir dang po byang chub sems las srog 'dzin pa'i rlung la sogs par gyur to //
translated: Here, first, bodhicitta becomes the life-sustaining wind, and so on.

original: nam mkha' la ni rnam gnas pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni rnam gnas pa //
translated: Abiding in space.

original: zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: This means abiding in ultimate truth.

original: de la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yang gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of that:

original: ngo bor gnas pa dang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bor gnas pa dang thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: abiding in the essence and becoming the cause of attainment.

original: ngo bor gnas pa ni byang chub sems dang rlung gnyis ye nas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bor gnas pa ni byang chub sems dang rlung gnyis ye nas rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Abiding in the essence means that bodhicitta and the vāyu are primordially pure by nature.

original: thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni byang chub sems dang rlung las bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni byang chub sems dang rlung las bde ba skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Becoming the cause of attainment means that bliss arises from bodhicitta and vāyu.

original: gang gi tshe bde ba skyes pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bde ba skyes pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When bliss arises, concepts cease.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa 'gags pa de'i tshe mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa 'gags pa de'i tshe mi rtog pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When concepts cease, nonconceptual gnosis arises.

original: gang gi tshe mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes pa de'i tshe chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyes pa de'i tshe chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur bar dgongs so //
translated: When nonconceptual gnosis arises, the dharmakāya is attained.

original: yang na steng gi don gyi nam mkha' ni bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: yang na steng gi don gyi nam mkha' ni bde ba chen po'o //
translated: Alternatively, the space above means great bliss.

original: de la gnas pa ni mchog gi ham ngo //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni mchog gi ham ngo //
translated: Abiding in that is the supreme aṃ.

original: yang na go 'byed pa'i don ni shong bas nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: yang na go 'byed pa'i don ni shong bas nam mkha' ste /
translated: Or else, the meaning of “space” is “to contain,”

original: gang du snying gi dbus su shes pa'i rten byas nas bag chags la sogs pa shong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang du snying gi dbus su shes pa'i rten byas nas bag chags la sogs pa shong bar byed pa'o //
translated: where the support of consciousness is in the middle of the heart, and it contains the traces, etc.

original: yang na steng gi don gyi nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: yang na steng gi don gyi nam mkha' ste /
translated: Or else, the meaning of “space” is “above,”

original: de'i dbus na gnas pa ni @249a * //
analyzed: de'i dbus na gnas pa ni @249a * //
translated: and that which is located in its middle

original: byang chub sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems te /
translated: is the bodhicitta,

original: rlung mi shigs pa'o //
analyzed: rlung mi shigs pa'o //
translated: the indestructible wind.

original: yang na nam mkha' la sprin 'byung /
analyzed: yang na nam mkha' la sprin 'byung /
translated: Or else, clouds arise in space,

original: de las char pa 'bab ste /
analyzed: de las char pa 'bab ste /
translated: and rain falls from them,

original: de'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: and it becomes the place for that.

original: de bzhin du mgrin par gyen du gyur pa gnas pas zas kyi ro myang ba'i char ba 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mgrin par gyen du gyur pa gnas pas zas kyi ro myang ba'i char ba 'bab pa'o //
translated: In the same way, since it is located in the throat, the rain of the taste of the food falls.

original: ji srid du nam mkha' na nyi ma dang / zla ba dang ; skar ma dang / sprin dang / na bun dang / ri'i rgyal po stong la sogs pa mang po'i rten du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ji srid du nam mkha' na nyi ma dang / zla ba dang ; skar ma dang / sprin dang / na bun dang / ri'i rgyal po stong la sogs pa mang po'i rten du gyur pa ste /
translated: As long as there is space, it is the support for many things, such as the sun, moon, stars, clouds, fog, and the king of mountains.

original: de bzhin du lte ba'i 'khor lo las /
analyzed: de bzhin du lte ba'i 'khor lo las /
translated: In the same way, from the navel cakra,

original: a'a li dang k'a li dang / aom dang / me 'bar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: a'a li dang k'a li dang / aom dang / me 'bar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the ḍākinīs, the ḍākas, the ḍākinīs’ ḍākas, the ḍākinīs’ ḍākas’ ḍākas, the ḍākinīs’ ḍākas’ ḍākas’ ḍākas, and the ḍākinīs’ ḍākas’ ḍākas’ ḍākas’ ḍākas arise.

original: sems can rnams kyi srog gyur pa //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi srog gyur pa //
translated: The life of sentient beings

original: zhes pa 'di ltar srog ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang gnas pa dang dar ba la sogs pa byed de /
analyzed: zhes pa 'di ltar srog ni 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang gnas pa dang dar ba la sogs pa byed de /
translated: Life is that which increases, decreases, abides, and flourishes.

original: de yang rlung gis byed do zhe'o //
analyzed: de yang rlung gis byed do zhe'o //
translated: And that is done by the winds.

original: rlung de nyid kyang du zhe na /🔽lnga yi bdag nyid bcu ming can //
analyzed: rlung de nyid kyang du zhe na / lnga yi bdag nyid bcu ming can //
translated: How many winds are there?🔽Fivefold, tenfold

original: zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i dbang du ni lnga dang / dbang po la brten pa'i yan lag gi dbang du ni lnga ste bcu'o //🔽rlung bcu po 'di yang tshul lam /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i dbang du ni lnga dang / dbang po la brten pa'i yan lag gi dbang du ni lnga ste bcu'o // rlung bcu po 'di yang tshul lam /
translated: From the point of view of the root winds, there are five, and from the point of view of the branch winds that are based on the sense faculties, there are five, making ten.

original: rdzas kyis tha dad gnas sha na /
analyzed: rdzas kyis tha dad gnas sha na /
translated: These ten winds are different in terms of their mode or substance.

original: rdzas kyis tha dad de /
analyzed: rdzas kyis tha dad de /
translated: They are different in terms of their substance

original: gnas ngang dus dang las dang dkyil 'khor so so ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: gnas ngang dus dang las dang dkyil 'khor so so ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes 'dod do //
translated: because their locations, directions, functions, and maṇḍalas are different.

original: yang na tshul gyis tha dad pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yang na tshul gyis tha dad pa yang yin te /
translated: Or they are different in terms of their mode

original: rlung gcig yin yang rgyu dang dus la sogs pas tha dad pa nyid kyi yang phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gcig yin yang rgyu dang dus la sogs pas tha dad pa nyid kyi yang phyir ro //
translated: because, although they are one wind, they are different in terms of their causes, directions, and so on.

original: yang na tshul 'di ni gtso bo dang grogs kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yang na tshul 'di ni gtso bo dang grogs kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Or this mode is the principal and secondary aspect.

original: zhes pa la la dag 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes pa la la dag 'dod do //
translated: Some people believe this.

original: rten 'brel bcu gnyis grags pa zhes pa ni srog 'dzin pa dang / thur du sel ba la sogs pa blun pa nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: rten 'brel bcu gnyis grags pa zhes pa ni srog 'dzin pa dang / thur du sel ba la sogs pa blun pa nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
translated: The twelvefold dependent origination is also known as the twelvefold life-sustaining wind, because it is the cause of the stupidity of the world.

original: de bzhin du rlung dang shes pa dang yul la sogs pa la ltos nas rten 'brel bcu gnyis su gzhag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung dang shes pa dang yul la sogs pa la ltos nas rten 'brel bcu gnyis su gzhag go //
translated: In the same way, the twelvefold dependent origination is established in relation to the wind, consciousness, objects, and so forth.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thams cad rlung dang 'dres pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rlung dang 'dres pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything arises from the combination of the wind and the mind.

original: ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The nature is threefold.

original: zhes pa ni gzugs can dang / gzugs med dang / shin tu med pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs can dang / gzugs med dang / shin tu med pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: This is threefold, because of the distinctions of having form, being formless, and being utterly formless.

original: yang na go 'byed par byed pas nam mkha'o //
analyzed: yang na go 'byed par byed pas nam mkha'o //
translated: Or, it is space, because it provides room.

original: 'dis 'tsho ba dang shin tu gces pa'i phyir srog go //
analyzed: 'dis 'tsho ba dang shin tu gces pa'i phyir srog go //
translated: It is life, because it is the most precious thing that keeps one alive.

original: yang ba dang g-yo ba'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir yang zhing g-yo ba ste 'dir gsum mo //
analyzed: yang ba dang g-yo ba'i bya ba byed pa'i phyir yang zhing g-yo ba ste 'dir gsum mo //
translated: It is light and movement, because it performs the function of lightness and movement.

original: yang na 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'i bye brag gis gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'i bye brag gis gsum mo //
translated: Or else, it is threefold by way of the distinctions of emergence, entry, and abiding.

original: yang na bud med dang skyes pa dang / ma ning gi rten can gyis gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na bud med dang skyes pa dang / ma ning gi rten can gyis gsum mo //
translated: Or else, it is threefold by way of the bases of women, men, and eunuchs.

original: rlung zhes bya ba'i @249b byang chub sems //
analyzed: rlung zhes bya ba'i @249b byang chub sems //
translated: The bodhisattva called “wind”

original: dbang po kun gyi gtso bo yin //
analyzed: dbang po kun gyi gtso bo yin //
translated: is the chief of all the faculties.

original: zhes pa ni dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa 'dis bskyed pas na dbang po'i gtso bo'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa mchog tu gyur pa 'dis bskyed pas na dbang po'i gtso bo'o //
translated: It is the chief of the faculties because it generates the supreme ones, such as the faculty of faith.

original: yang na dbang po thams cad la khyab pa nyid dang / skyed pa nyid dang / dbang sgyur ba nyid dang / yongs su sgrub pa nyid dang rgyu ba zlog pa nyid kyi phyir yang gtso bo'o //
analyzed: yang na dbang po thams cad la khyab pa nyid dang / skyed pa nyid dang / dbang sgyur ba nyid dang / yongs su sgrub pa nyid dang rgyu ba zlog pa nyid kyi phyir yang gtso bo'o //
translated: Or else, it is the chief because it pervades all the faculties, because it generates them, because it dominates them, because it accomplishes them, and because it reverses their activity.

original: yang na dbang po rnams 'phel ba nyid dang / 'grib pa nyid dang / gnas pa nyid kyi phyir yang gtso bo'o //🔽'di ltar mi mngon phra ba las //
analyzed: yang na dbang po rnams 'phel ba nyid dang / 'grib pa nyid dang / gnas pa nyid kyi phyir yang gtso bo'o // 'di ltar mi mngon phra ba las //
translated: Or else, it is the chief because it increases, decreases, and abides in the faculties.🔽Thus, it is said to be always clear

original: rtag tu gsal ba brjod pa yin //
analyzed: rtag tu gsal ba brjod pa yin //
translated: from the subtle, which is not manifest.

original: zhes pa ni so so'i skye bo'i yul ma yin zhing rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis gsal bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni so so'i skye bo'i yul ma yin zhing rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyis gsal bar gyur pa nyid kyi phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is so called because it is not the domain of ordinary people, and because it is clearly manifest through the direct perception of yoga.

original: 'gro ba yul sogs las byed pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba yul sogs las byed pa //
translated: The activities of going, and so on,

original: 'di ni de la brtan pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni de la brtan pa yin //
translated: are its stability in that.

original: zhes pa ni 'gro ba gang dag 'gro ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'chag pa dang / sdud pa dang / steg pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / dgod pa dang / lta ba dang / nyan pa dang /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'gro ba gang dag 'gro ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'chag pa dang / sdud pa dang / steg pa dang / 'khyud pa dang / dgod pa dang / lta ba dang / nyan pa dang /
translated: The activities of going, sitting, lying down, standing, walking, contracting, expanding, embracing, laughing, looking, listening,

original: snom pa dang / smra ba dang / reg pa dang / khro ba dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad rlung gis byed pa'o //
analyzed: snom pa dang / smra ba dang / reg pa dang / khro ba dang / nga rgyal la sogs pa dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa thams cad rlung gis byed pa'o //
translated: smelling, speaking, touching, being angry, being proud, and so on, all virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral activities are performed by the wind.

original: zhi ba dang ni zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i bye brag thams cad rlung gis byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba dang ni zhes pa la sogs pa'i don ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa la sogs pa'i bye brag thams cad rlung gis byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of “pacifying” and so on is that all the different activities of pacifying, increasing, and so on are performed by the wind.

original: de yang kha cig  ni rlung gcig gis byed /
analyzed: de yang kha cig  ni rlung gcig gis byed /
translated: Some say that one wind does this,

original: kha cig  ni gnyis 'dus pa la sogs pas byed do //
analyzed: kha cig  ni gnyis 'dus pa la sogs pas byed do //
translated: others that two winds and so on do this.

original: de bas na rlung gi las ni bsam las 'das //
analyzed: de bas na rlung gi las ni bsam las 'das //
translated: Therefore the function of the winds is inconceivable.

original: bsdu ba rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur //🔽gang zhig nyon mongs dbang gyur dang // de bzhin ting 'dzin las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur // gang zhig nyon mongs dbang gyur dang // de bzhin ting 'dzin las byung ba'o //
translated: There are two types of collection:🔽that which is under the power of affliction

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and that which arises from meditative concentration.

original: klog dang bsam gtan rnam par spangs //
analyzed: klog dang bsam gtan rnam par spangs //
translated: Abandoning reading and concentration.

original: zhes pa ni klog pa ma yin /
analyzed: zhes pa ni klog pa ma yin /
translated: This does not mean not reading,

original: kha ton byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: kha ton byed pa ma yin /
translated: not reciting,

original: lta ba ma yin /
analyzed: lta ba ma yin /
translated: not looking at,

original: sems pa'i bar du ma yin /
analyzed: sems pa'i bar du ma yin /
translated: up to not thinking.

original: de las gzhan la rtse gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan la rtse gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: It means not being one-pointed on anything other than that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽de las gzhan pa dang de ni mi mthun par 'gyur te /🔽gang mi mthun pa de ni gcig la gcig bsgrib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de las gzhan pa dang de ni mi mthun par 'gyur te / gang mi mthun pa de ni gcig la gcig bsgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because that is incompatible with anything other than that.🔽That which is incompatible mutually obscures each other.

original: gcig la gcig bsgrib pa de ni gcig gis gcig spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig bsgrib pa de ni gcig gis gcig spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That mutual obscuration mutually abandons each other.

original: gcig gis gcig spangs pa de ni gang spangs pa de'i 'bras bu mngon du bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig spangs pa de ni gang spangs pa de'i 'bras bu mngon du bya bar mi nus so //
translated: One cannot manifest the result of what is abandoned by the other.

original: de bas na @250a * //
analyzed: de bas na @250a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: rigs kyi bu gang zhig gis 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'i bzlas pa'i dus su klog pa la sogs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gang zhig gis 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'i bzlas pa'i dus su klog pa la sogs pa spong ngo //
translated: son of noble family, one should abandon recitation, etc., at the time of the repetition of arising, entering, and abiding.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i dus su sems la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bsam gtan spang bar bya'o //🔽'byung ba'i dus su 'jug pa spang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i dus su sems la dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bsam gtan spang bar bya'o // 'byung ba'i dus su 'jug pa spang ngo //
translated: At the time of vajra repetition, one should abandon the concentrations such as the observation of mind, and so on.🔽At the time of arising, one should abandon entering.

original: 'jug pa'i dus su ni 'byung ba spang ngo //🔽gnas pa'i dus su ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa spang ngo //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i dus su ni 'byung ba spang ngo // gnas pa'i dus su ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa spang ngo //
translated: At the time of entering, one should abandon arising.🔽At the time of abiding, one should abandon arising and entering.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i dus su gnas pa spang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i dus su gnas pa spang ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: At the time of arising and entering, one should abandon abiding.🔽This is the intention.

original: bdag po rang nyid zlos pa ste //
analyzed: bdag po rang nyid zlos pa ste //
translated: The master himself repeats.

original: zhes pa ni gtso bor bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gtso bor bya ba ste /
translated: This is the primary activity.

original: gang gi tshe rdo rje bzlas pa gtso bor byas pa de'i tshe ni sems la dmigs pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / tshogs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rdo rje bzlas pa gtso bor byas pa de'i tshe ni sems la dmigs pa dang / bskyed pa'i rim pa dang / tshogs la sogs pa ste /
translated: When vajra repetition is primary, then the focus on mind, the stage of development, and the group practice and so forth,

original: de dag thams cad kyang rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang rdo rje bzlas pa'o //
translated: all of these are vajra repetition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la phan par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la phan par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is beneficial for vajra repetition.

original: dper na lha sbyin gyi dpung la lha sbyin gyi tshogs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gyi dpung la lha sbyin gyi tshogs bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like Devadatta's army being Devadatta's group.

original: nyin dang mtshan mo bye brag gis //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan mo bye brag gis //
translated: Day and night are distinguished

original: nyi zla rab tu sbyor ba yin //
analyzed: nyi zla rab tu sbyor ba yin //
translated: by the application of sun and moon.

original: zhes pa ni 'di ltar nyin mo ni thabs kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'di ltar nyin mo ni thabs kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Thus, day is the repetition of method.

original: mtshan mo ni shes rab kyi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo ni shes rab kyi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Night is the repetition of wisdom.

original: des ci byed ce na /
analyzed: des ci byed ce na /
translated: What does that do?

original: dngos po med 'gro khyab pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po med 'gro khyab pa ste /
translated: It is the pervasion of the movement of non-entity.

original: gnag gi chos ki sku thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnag gi chos ki sku thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the method for attaining the dharmakāya of the horse.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That has two aspects:

original: dngos su dang brgyud nas rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dngos su dang brgyud nas rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: direct and indirect causes.

original: de la de nyid kyi rnam pa can gyis gang zag gi dbang du byas nas rlung gnas pa la bzlas pa na dngos su rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la de nyid kyi rnam pa can gyis gang zag gi dbang du byas nas rlung gnas pa la bzlas pa na dngos su rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: In that regard, in terms of the person who has the aspect of reality, when one is intent on the abiding of the wind, it is the direct cause.

original: gzhan la rag las pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas pa rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa 'brel pa dang go rims nges pa'i tshul gyis phyag rgya chen po'i mchog thob pa ni brgyud nas rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas pa rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa 'brel pa dang go rims nges pa'i tshul gyis phyag rgya chen po'i mchog thob pa ni brgyud nas rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In terms of the person who is dependent on another, the attainment of the supreme of the great seal by the method of the ascertainment of the connection and the order of the repetition of the vajra and so forth is the indirect cause.

original: de rnam pa can gyi dbang du byas nas gang gi tshe thob ce na /
analyzed: de rnam pa can gyi dbang du byas nas gang gi tshe thob ce na /
translated: In terms of the person who has the aspect of that, when is it attained?

original: byang chub sems kyi rlung gcig pu zhes pa ni gnas pa la brtan pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi rlung gcig pu zhes pa ni gnas pa la brtan pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: The single wind of the enlightenment spirit is the wind stabilized in the abiding.

original: gnyis pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the second and so forth,

original: bslab par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not to be trained in.

original: dge ba ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: The virtuous is the entering.

original: mi dge ba ni 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'byung ba ste /
translated: The nonvirtuous is the arising.

original: 'di ni yul la chags pa nyid dang / zhen pa nyid dang / rangs pa nyid dang / khro ba nyid dang / rtog pa rags pa la 'jug pa nyid kyang rtog pa'i sa bon len pa nyid kyi phyir mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yul la chags pa nyid dang / zhen pa nyid dang / rangs pa nyid dang / khro ba nyid dang / rtog pa rags pa la 'jug pa nyid kyang rtog pa'i sa bon len pa nyid kyi phyir mi dge ba'o //
translated: This is nonvirtuous because it is the seed of the conception of the object as attractive, unattractive, and so on, and because it is the seed of the conception of the object as the basis of desire, hatred, and so on.

original: de las zlog pa'o //
analyzed: de las zlog pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is virtuous.

original: gnyi ga spangs pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga spangs pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of both is neutral.

original: des na nam mkha' @250b 'dra ste /🔽nam mkha' dang 'dra bar 'dus ma byas pa nyid dang / kha dog med pa nyid dang / dbyibs med pa nyid dang / rnam par rig byed med pa nyid dang / dge ba med pa nyid dang / mi dge ba med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: des na nam mkha' @250b 'dra ste / nam mkha' dang 'dra bar 'dus ma byas pa nyid dang / kha dog med pa nyid dang / dbyibs med pa nyid dang / rnam par rig byed med pa nyid dang / dge ba med pa nyid dang / mi dge ba med pa nyid dang /
translated: Therefore, it is like space.🔽It is uncompounded like space, colorless, shapeless, imperceptible, neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous,🔽neither manifest nor unmanifest, neither to be cultivated nor not to be cultivated, neither to be thoroughly known nor to be thoroughly known as already thoroughly known, neither to be abandoned nor to be abandoned as already abandoned, neither to be realized nor to be realized as already realized, neither to be cultivated nor to be cultivated as already cultivated.

original: lung du ma bstan pa nyid dang / sgra med pa nyid dang / sgras brjod pa med pa nyid dang / brjod pa'i yul med pa nyid dang / snang ba med pa nyid la sogs pa thob po zhe'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa nyid dang / sgra med pa nyid dang / sgras brjod pa med pa nyid dang / brjod pa'i yul med pa nyid dang / snang ba med pa nyid la sogs pa thob po zhe'o //
translated: It is not sound, not expressed by sound, not an object of expression, not light, and so on.

original: 'di dag gis ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gis ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What do these terms indicate?

original: klu sgrub kyi zhal nas /
analyzed: klu sgrub kyi zhal nas /
translated: Nagarjuna says:

original: ngo bo dang ni rnam pa dbye gsum //
analyzed: ngo bo dang ni rnam pa dbye gsum //
translated: Essence, divisions, and distinctions,🔽Chief, and distinctions of knowledge,🔽And the nature that is the cause,

original: gtso dang shes pa'i khyad par dang // gang gi rang bzhin rgyur gyur dang // dag pa'i las dang ma dag las //
analyzed: gtso dang shes pa'i khyad par dang // gang gi rang bzhin rgyur gyur dang // dag pa'i las dang ma dag las //
translated: From pure and impure actions,🔽The object of abandonment and the abandoner,🔽The time and distinctions of abandonment,

original: spang bya dang ni spong byed dang // dus dang spong ba'i khyad par dang // bstan pa'i dus dang 'bras bu'i dus //
analyzed: spang bya dang ni spong byed dang // dus dang spong ba'i khyad par dang // bstan pa'i dus dang 'bras bu'i dus //
translated: The time of teaching and the time of result,

original: dgongs pa lung bstan rjes su 'brangs nas //
analyzed: dgongs pa lung bstan rjes su 'brangs nas //
translated: Following the prophecies of intention,

original: skye bo mchog la bstan pa yin //
analyzed: skye bo mchog la bstan pa yin //
translated: I have taught to the supreme beings.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid mi shes nas rgyas par 'dod nas dris pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nyid mi shes nas rgyas par 'dod nas dris pa ni go sla'o //
translated: Not knowing that, wanting an extensive explanation, he asked, which is easy to understand.

original: lan du de nas de bzhin gshegs pa kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /🔽'dis ni rgyud 'di nyid las rtsa ba dang yan lag gi rlung gi dbye ba zhig rgyas par bstan te /
analyzed: lan du de nas de bzhin gshegs pa kun dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'dis ni rgyud 'di nyid las rtsa ba dang yan lag gi rlung gi dbye ba zhig rgyas par bstan te /
translated: In response, it says Then, all the Tathagatas and so on.🔽This extensively teaches the divisions of the root and branch winds from this very tantra.

original: lung dang man ngag gis shin tu rgyas par ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: lung dang man ngag gis shin tu rgyas par ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: The extensive explanation by scripture and instruction will be shown below.

original: ko ta khya zhes pa la sogs pa ni rlung bcu po 'di'i brdas bshad de /
analyzed: ko ta khya zhes pa la sogs pa ni rlung bcu po 'di'i brdas bshad de /
translated: The words koṭakhya and so forth are the symbolic explanations of these ten winds.

original: 'og nas srog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'og nas srog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are in the order of life and so forth below.

original: brda'i don sngags dang 'dra ba'i brda can ni rlung bcu po yin te /
analyzed: brda'i don sngags dang 'dra ba'i brda can ni rlung bcu po yin te /
translated: The symbolic meaning is the ten winds, which are like the mantra.

original: brda bshad pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: brda bshad pa la dgos pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: If it is asked, What is the purpose of explaining the symbols?

original: 'di ltar 'dis ni dam pa la brten nas rtogs pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i yul yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dis ni dam pa la brten nas rtogs pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i yul yin par bstan to //
translated: in this way, it is explained that by relying on the sublime, one will understand and that it is the domain of the sublime.

original: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, Why is that?

original: 'di ltar brdal ma goms shing brda yod par mi shes pa theg pa chen po'i rigs can ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar brdal ma goms shing brda yod par mi shes pa theg pa chen po'i rigs can ma yin pa /
translated: in this way, those who are not familiar with the expansion, who do not know that the symbols exist, who do not have the Mahayana lineage,

original: log pa'i bla ma la brten pa /
analyzed: log pa'i bla ma la brten pa /
translated: who rely on a false guru,

original: yang dag pa'i bla ma la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba lta ba log pa la zhen pa /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bla ma la 'jug par mi 'gyur ba lta ba log pa la zhen pa /
translated: who do not enter into the true guru, who are attached to false views,

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la rtog pa sngon du mi gtong ba gang dag dang por ni bla ma dam pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la rtog pa sngon du mi gtong ba gang dag dang por ni bla ma dam pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and who do not contemplate the true view will first abandon the sublime guru.

original: bla ma dam pa spangs pa de'i tshe bka' dgongs pa can la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa spangs pa de'i tshe bka' dgongs pa can la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they abandon the holy guru, they will enter into the interpretable words of the Buddha.

original: gang gi tshe bka' dgongs pa can la zhugs pa de'i tshe de la sgra ji bzhin par gzung ba de'i tshe log pa'i lta ba dang spyod pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bka' dgongs pa can la zhugs pa de'i tshe de la sgra ji bzhin par gzung ba de'i tshe log pa'i lta ba dang spyod pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they enter into the interpretable words of the Buddha, they will take them literally. When they do that, they will enter into false views and conduct.

original: @251a * // gang gi tshe log pa'i lta ba dang spyod pa la 'jug pa de'i tshe gang zag de ni 'jig rten 'di ru tshe thung ba dang / nad mang ba dang longs spyod zhen pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal thams cad skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @251a * // gang gi tshe log pa'i lta ba dang spyod pa la 'jug pa de'i tshe gang zag de ni 'jig rten 'di ru tshe thung ba dang / nad mang ba dang longs spyod zhen pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal thams cad skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they enter into false views and conduct, they will generate all the sufferings of this world, such as a short life, many illnesses, and a lack of resources.

original: 'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang ngan 'gro ngan song log par ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang ngan 'gro ngan song log par ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After they die, they will fall into the lower realms, the bad migrations.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: las ngan pa'i 'bras bu mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las ngan pa'i 'bras bu mi slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the results of bad karma are undeceiving.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi brda sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa ni rdo rje'i tshig ces bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi brda sgra ji bzhin pa ma yin pa ni rdo rje'i tshig ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the words of the Buddha that are not literal are called vajra words.

original: 'di la ni su la yang rtog gi sngon du gtong ba mad do //
analyzed: 'di la ni su la yang rtog gi sngon du gtong ba mad do //
translated: In this case, there is no doubt that one should first rely on a spiritual friend.

original: gang gi tshe rtog pa dang bral ba de'i tshe yang dag pa'i bla ma 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rtog pa dang bral ba de'i tshe yang dag pa'i bla ma 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is free from doubt, then one enters into the true path.

original: yang dag pa'i bla ma zhugs pa de'i tshe ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bla ma zhugs pa de'i tshe ni yang dag pa'i gdams ngag thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one enters into the true path, then one obtains the true instructions.

original: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag thob pa de'i tshe yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gdams ngag thob pa de'i tshe yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one obtains the true instructions, then one abides in the true practice.

original: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la gnas pas 'bas bu thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sgrub pa la gnas pas 'bas bu thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By abiding in the true practice, one attains the result.

original: 'jig rten gyi yon tan dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yon tan dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains the immeasurable mundane and supramundane qualities.

original: brda can gyi dbye ba de nyid mi shes nas dris pa dang / lan du rlung lnga ni lus kyi cha la gnas nas lus kyi bya ba rnams byed do zhes pa la /
analyzed: brda can gyi dbye ba de nyid mi shes nas dris pa dang / lan du rlung lnga ni lus kyi cha la gnas nas lus kyi bya ba rnams byed do zhes pa la /
translated: Not knowing the division of the five vāyus, when asked, the reply is, “The five vāyus perform the functions of the body by abiding in the parts of the body.”

original: rlung lnga ni rlung lnga ste rtsa ba'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: rlung lnga ni rlung lnga ste rtsa ba'i rlung ngo //
translated: The five vāyus are the five root vāyus.
