original: lus kyi cha ni lus kyi cha ste de la gnas pa ni lus kyi cha la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi cha ni lus kyi cha ste de la gnas pa ni lus kyi cha la gnas pa'o //
translated: The parts of the body are the parts of the body. Abiding in them is abiding in the parts of the body.

original: des ci byed ce na /
analyzed: des ci byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: lus kyi bya ba rnams byed de /
analyzed: lus kyi bya ba rnams byed de /
translated: It performs the functions of the body.

original: lus kho na'i bya ba byed pas lus kyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: lus kho na'i bya ba byed pas lus kyi bya ba byed do //
translated: It performs the functions of the body because it performs the functions of the body alone.

original: rlung lnga ni yan lag dag gi rlung ste /
analyzed: rlung lnga ni yan lag dag gi rlung ste /
translated: The five winds are the winds of the limbs,

original: mig la sogs pa nas lus kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa nas lus kyi bar du'o //
translated: from the eyes up to the body.

original: gnas pa ni der bzhugs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni der bzhugs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Abiding is abiding in them.

original: de nyid bshad par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
translated: Desiring to explain that, he said:

original: srog ces bya ba'i rlung ni 'dir 'tsho bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba'i rlung ni 'dir 'tsho bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wind called life-force is so called because it sustains life here.

original: gnas gang na gnas she na /
analyzed: gnas gang na gnas she na /
translated: In what place does it abide?

original: snying ga na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: snying ga na gnas pa ste /
translated: It abides in the heart.

original: de la brten nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la brten nas gnas pa'o //
translated: It abides in dependence on that.

original: gang gi rigs yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi rigs yin zhe na /
translated: To what family does it belong?

original: mi bskyod pa ste g-yo bar mi byed pa'i phyir mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa ste g-yo bar mi byed pa'i phyir mthun pa'o //
translated: It belongs to Akṣobhya because it does not move.

original: des ci byed ce na /
analyzed: des ci byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: 'phel ba nyid dang 'grib pa nyid dang / gnas pa nyid la sogs pa byed do //
analyzed: 'phel ba nyid dang 'grib pa nyid dang / gnas pa nyid la sogs pa byed do //
translated: It performs the functions of increase, decrease, abiding, and so on.

original: thur du sel ba ni thur du sel ba ste /
analyzed: thur du sel ba ni thur du sel ba ste /
translated: The downward-voiding wind is the downward-voiding wind.

original: 'dis thur sel gyi bya ba byed pas thur du sel ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis thur sel gyi bya ba byed pas thur du sel ba'o //
translated: It is called downward-voiding because it performs the function of voiding downward.

original: 'di yang yang ba nyid dang / g-yo ba nyid dang / go 'byed pa nyid dang / bshang ba dang gci ba sel ba dang / smin pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa nyid dang / zlog pa nyid @251b dang ; sa bon len pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di yang yang ba nyid dang / g-yo ba nyid dang / go 'byed pa nyid dang / bshang ba dang gci ba sel ba dang / smin pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa nyid dang / zlog pa nyid @251b dang ; sa bon len pa nyid dang /
translated: It is also called light, moving, opening, voiding feces and urine, ripening, flowing of semen, reversing, and taking up seed.

original: dbugs 'byung ba nyid dang / lam bsgrub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba nyid dang / lam bsgrub pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is also called exhalation, inhalation, and the path of practice.

original: gyen du rgyu ba ni gyen du rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: gyen du rgyu ba ni gyen du rgyu ba ste /
translated: Upward-moving is that which moves upward.

original: 'di yang dbugs 'byung ba nyid dang / 'jug pa nyid dang / smra ba nyid dang / mgrin pa 'dor ba nyid dang / mchu sgul ba nyid dang / 'o byed pa nyid dang // za ba nyid dang / 'thung ba nyid dang / za ba dang 'thung ba'i ro myong ba nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di yang dbugs 'byung ba nyid dang / 'jug pa nyid dang / smra ba nyid dang / mgrin pa 'dor ba nyid dang / mchu sgul ba nyid dang / 'o byed pa nyid dang // za ba nyid dang / 'thung ba nyid dang / za ba dang 'thung ba'i ro myong ba nyid dang /
translated: It is also called exhalation, inhalation, speech, stretching the neck, moving the lips, kissing, eating, drinking, tasting food and drink,

original: dangs snyigs 'byed pa nyid dang / stod kyi rtsa 'byed pa nyid dang / 'gog pa nyid dang / lus brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dangs snyigs 'byed pa nyid dang / stod kyi rtsa 'byed pa nyid dang / 'gog pa nyid dang / lus brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it separates the pure and impure, because it separates the upper channels, because it stops, and because it supports the body.

original: me dang mnyam du gnas pa ni drod dang mnyam du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: me dang mnyam du gnas pa ni drod dang mnyam du gnas pa ste /
translated: The fire-accompanying wind abides together with heat.

original: 'di yang pho ba 'gul ba nyid dang / phung po drod snyoms pa nyid dang / phung po chags par byed pa nyid dang / phung po'i bya ba la phan 'dogs pa dang / zas dang skom lhag pa gnas su 'gro ba nyid dang / zas dang skom gyi tshad snyoms par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang pho ba 'gul ba nyid dang / phung po drod snyoms pa nyid dang / phung po chags par byed pa nyid dang / phung po'i bya ba la phan 'dogs pa dang / zas dang skom lhag pa gnas su 'gro ba nyid dang / zas dang skom gyi tshad snyoms par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It also causes the stomach to move, equalizes the heat of the body, causes the body to grow, assists the activities of the body, causes the remainder of food and drink to be digested, and equalizes the amount of food and drink.

original: khyab byed ni khyab byed de /
analyzed: khyab byed ni khyab byed de /
translated: The pervading wind pervades.

original: 'dis phung po thams cad la khyab byed do //
analyzed: 'dis phung po thams cad la khyab byed do //
translated: It pervades the entire body.

original: 'di yang 'gro ba nyid dang 'dug pa nyid la sogs pa'i bya ba yang zo mdog bde ba thams cad byed do //
analyzed: 'di yang 'gro ba nyid dang 'dug pa nyid la sogs pa'i bya ba yang zo mdog bde ba thams cad byed do //
translated: It also performs all the functions of walking, sitting, and so forth, and it causes a healthy complexion.

original: de dag gis ni rtsa ba'i rlung lnga bshad do //
analyzed: de dag gis ni rtsa ba'i rlung lnga bshad do //
translated: These explain the five root winds.

original: yan lag gi rlung bshad par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: yan lag gi rlung bshad par 'dod nas gsungs pa /
translated: Now, wishing to explain the secondary winds, he says:

original: rgyu ba'i rlung ni gzugs so //
analyzed: rgyu ba'i rlung ni gzugs so //
translated: The moving wind is form.

original: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi yul ma yin pas 'di ni gzugs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs kyi yul ma yin pas 'di ni gzugs so //
translated: Since it is not the object of form, it is form.

original: bshad pa / rdzi ma 'gul ba dang / mig gis tho yul gyi tshor ba dang / mig zlog pa nyid dang / 'gul ba nyid dang / dang ba nyid dang / lta ba nyid dang / sdug pa nyid dang / mi 'bral ba nyid dang /
analyzed: bshad pa / rdzi ma 'gul ba dang / mig gis tho yul gyi tshor ba dang / mig zlog pa nyid dang / 'gul ba nyid dang / dang ba nyid dang / lta ba nyid dang / sdug pa nyid dang / mi 'bral ba nyid dang /
translated: The author replies: Because it moves the eyelashes, it is the feeling of the object of the eye, it is the turning of the eye, it is the movement of the eye, it is the clarity of the eye, it is the seeing of the eye, it is the beauty of the eye, it is the non-separation of the eye,

original: yul la chags par byed pa nyid dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa go 'byed pa nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'dod pa 'byung ba nyid dang / zlog pa nyid kyi yang yin phyir ro //
analyzed: yul la chags par byed pa nyid dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa go 'byed pa nyid dang / gzugs kyi 'dod pa 'byung ba nyid dang / zlog pa nyid kyi yang yin phyir ro //
translated: it is the attachment to the object of the eye, it is the opening of the eye consciousness, it is the arising of desire for form, and it is the turning of the eye.

original: mig la ji lta bar rna ba la sogs par yang de de bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la ji lta bar rna ba la sogs par yang de de bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is for the eye, so it is for the ear and so on.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dag go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dag go //
translated: The four circles are earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: lha mo bzhi ni gos dkar la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha mo bzhi ni gos dkar la sogs pa ste /
translated: The four goddesses are Pāṇḍaravāsinī and so on.

original: 'di dag ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These should be applied as appropriate.

original: de dag kyang steng gi sgo las 'byung ba'i dus su kha dog gang du 'byung ba dang / gnas gang du 'byung ba dang / rigs gang gi ngo bor 'byung ba dang / dus ji tsam nas 'byung ba dang / grangs dur 'byung ba mi shes nas @252a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang steng gi sgo las 'byung ba'i dus su kha dog gang du 'byung ba dang / gnas gang du 'byung ba dang / rigs gang gi ngo bor 'byung ba dang / dus ji tsam nas 'byung ba dang / grangs dur 'byung ba mi shes nas @252a * //
translated: when they arise from the upper door,

original: dris pa dang / len du /
analyzed: dris pa dang / len du /
translated: then, having asked,🔽it is said,

original: dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dpal de kho na nyid bsdus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The glorious Compendium of Reality and so on.

original: sangs rgyas lnga yi rigs gnas par //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga yi rigs gnas par //
translated: Abiding in the family of the five buddhas

original: zhes pa ni 'byung zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'byung zhes sbyar te /
translated: is connected with arising.

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i rigs dang mthun par 'byung zhe'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i rigs dang mthun par 'byung zhe'o //
translated: It means arising in accordance with the family of the five buddhas.

original: gnas gang nas 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gang nas 'byung zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, From what place do they arise?

original: sna rtse'i bu ga las te /🔽rang gi sna'i bu ga nas 'byung zhe'o //
analyzed: sna rtse'i bu ga las te / rang gi sna'i bu ga nas 'byung zhe'o //
translated: it is said, from the nostrils.🔽It means arising from one's nostrils.

original: du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: du 'byung zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, How many arise?

original: rlung lnga ste /
analyzed: rlung lnga ste /
translated: it is said, five vāyus.

original: srog 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srog 'dzin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It means the life-upholding vāyu and so on.

original: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa /
translated: That is explained extensively:

original: g-yas pa nas ni 'byung ba'i khams //
analyzed: g-yas pa nas ni 'byung ba'i khams //
translated: The elements that arise from the right

original: zhes pa ni sna bug g-yas pa nas 'byung ba'i rlung ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sna bug g-yas pa nas 'byung ba'i rlung ste /
translated: This is the wind that comes out of the right nostril.

original: byed pa med cing rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di ni khams so //
analyzed: byed pa med cing rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir 'di ni khams so //
translated: It is the element because it is without activity and because it holds its own characteristic.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: me'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: It is the circle of fire,

original: smin par byed pa'i bye brag yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smin par byed pa'i bye brag yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it has the function of ripening.

original: kha dog ji lta bu yod ce na /
analyzed: kha dog ji lta bu yod ce na /
translated: What is its color?

original: dmar po ste dmar po cher gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmar po ste dmar po cher gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is red, because it is the color of red.

original: chung ba ni gzhi de la gnas pa dkar po dang / ser po dang / ljang gu dang / mthing ga'i bye brag nyid dang yang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chung ba ni gzhi de la gnas pa dkar po dang / ser po dang / ljang gu dang / mthing ga'i bye brag nyid dang yang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also small, because it is the color of white, yellow, green, and blue, which are its variations.

original: rigs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rigs gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its family?

original: padma mgon po ste /
analyzed: padma mgon po ste /
translated: It is the family of Padma-natha,

original: ma chags shing skyob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma chags shing skyob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is without attachment and because it protects.

original: yang na ma chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa la skyob pa'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ma chags pa'i sems dang ldan pa la skyob pa'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, it is so called because it protects those who have a mind without attachment.

original: yang na padma mgon po ni tshe dpag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na padma mgon po ni tshe dpag tu med pa ste /
translated: Or else, Padma-natha is Amitayus.

original: dmar ba nyid dang smin par byed pa nyid du mthun pa nyid kyi phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dmar ba nyid dang smin par byed pa nyid du mthun pa nyid kyi phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is so called because it is similar to the ripening of red color.

original: gzhan la yang de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the same with regard to the others.

original: de ltar rlung gi de kho na nyid bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rlung gi de kho na nyid bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the reality of the winds,

original: da ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the reality of the mantra,

original: rdo rje slob mas gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje slob mas gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: the vajra disciple asks, “What is the mantra?” and so on.

original: de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa rtsa ba'i rgyud ni rtsa ba kho na'i rgyud do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa rtsa ba'i rgyud ni rtsa ba kho na'i rgyud do //
translated: The root tantra of the Compendium of Principles and so on is the root tantra.

original: rgyud phyi ma'i don phyi ma rgyas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma'i don phyi ma rgyas par ston pa'o //
translated: The later tantra is the teaching in detail of the meaning of the later tantra.

original: de la ci gsungs she na /
analyzed: de la ci gsungs she na /
translated: What is taught there?

original: sngags tsam gsungs zhes pa ni gzhan ma gsungs te /
analyzed: sngags tsam gsungs zhes pa ni gzhan ma gsungs te /
translated: “Just the mantra” is taught, nothing else.

original: lhag ma 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma 'gog pa'o //
translated: The rest is a refutation.

original: 'o na gang las gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na gang las gsungs she na /
translated: Well, where is it taught?

original: bshad pa'i rgyud las te /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud las te /
translated: In the explanatory tantra.

original: 'di bshad pa'i rgyud yin pas bshad pa'i rgyud do //
analyzed: 'di bshad pa'i rgyud yin pas bshad pa'i rgyud do //
translated: It is an explanatory tantra because it is an explanatory tantra.

original: de las ci gsungs she na /
analyzed: de las ci gsungs she na /
translated: What is taught there?

original: sngags btu ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngags btu ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should add the extraction of the mantra, and so on, are taught.

original: de nas bshad pa'i rgyud ma rtogs pa'i skyon bshad pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud ma rtogs shing zhes pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud khong du ma chud pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bshad pa'i rgyud ma rtogs pa'i skyon bshad pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud ma rtogs shing zhes pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud khong du ma chud pa'o //
translated: Next, the fault of not understanding the explanatory tantra is explained: Not understanding the explanatory tantra means not comprehending the explanatory tantra.

original: phyi rol gyi sngags ni bsam gtan dang bral @252b ba'i sngags te /🔽de la mngon par zhen pa ni de la chags pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sngags ni bsam gtan dang bral @252b ba'i sngags te / de la mngon par zhen pa ni de la chags pa ste /
translated: The external mantra is the mantra devoid of meditative concentration.

original: dar dkar gyi mar me bzhin no //
analyzed: dar dkar gyi mar me bzhin no //
translated: Attachment to that is attachment to it, like a white silk lamp.

original: des ci mi rtogs she na /
analyzed: des ci mi rtogs she na /
translated: What is not understood by that?

original: de kho na nyid kyi don mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi don mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of reality is not understood.

original: de bas na gang du bshad pa'i rgyud ma rtogs pas ni phyi rol gyi sngags tsam la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gang du bshad pa'i rgyud ma rtogs pas ni phyi rol gyi sngags tsam la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one who does not understand the explanatory tantra will engage in the mere external mantra.

original: phyi rol gyi sngags tsam la zhugs pas ni nang gi sngags la 'jug par mi nus so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sngags tsam la zhugs pas ni nang gi sngags la 'jug par mi nus so //
translated: By engaging in the mere external mantra, one is unable to engage in the internal mantra.

original: nang gi sngags la zhugs par ma gyur pa de'i tshe nang gi bsam gtan dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang gi sngags la zhugs par ma gyur pa de'i tshe nang gi bsam gtan dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not engage in the internal mantra, at that time one is devoid of internal meditative concentration.

original: nang gi bsam gtan la zhugs par ma gyur pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang gi bsam gtan la zhugs par ma gyur pa de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When one does not enter into inner meditative concentration, then discursive thought is not abandoned.

original: rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa de'i tshe bdud kyis slu ba 'byung zhing mi rtog pa'i shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa de'i tshe bdud kyis slu ba 'byung zhing mi rtog pa'i shes pa mi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When discursive thought is not abandoned, then the deception of Māra arises and non-conceptual knowledge does not arise.

original: de bas na dang por sngags kyi de kho na nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dang por sngags kyi de kho na nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, first one should know the reality of the mantra.

original: de yang gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: And from what does that arise?

original: sbrul la sogs pa'i sngags rnams ni /
analyzed: sbrul la sogs pa'i sngags rnams ni /
translated: The mantras of the snake and so forth

original: a'a li k'a li 'dus las 'byung //
analyzed: a'a li k'a li 'dus las 'byung //
translated: arise from the union of ālikāli.

original: zhes pa ni sbrul la sogs pa'i mtha' can dang / mtha' med pa dang / btus pa dang / sbrul lta bu ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sbrul la sogs pa'i mtha' can dang / mtha' med pa dang / btus pa dang / sbrul lta bu ste /
translated: The snake and so forth refer to those that end in a snake, those that end in a snake and are without end, those that are collected, and those that are like a snake.

original: de dag ni a'a li dang k'a li 'dus pa las yang dag par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dag ni a'a li dang k'a li 'dus pa las yang dag par 'byung ste /
translated: They arise correctly from the union of ālikāli.

original: dper na ri las gser 'byung zhes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri las gser 'byung zhes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying “gold arises from a mountain.”

original: 'o na yi ge gsum brda dang bcas pa gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yi ge gsum brda dang bcas pa gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: Well then, from what do the three syllables together with the symbolic letters arise?

original: 'di ltar mi shigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi shigs pa ste /
translated: In this way, they arise from the indestructible.

original: rlung mi shigs pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rlung mi shigs pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from the indestructible wind.🔽And that is said:

original: de yang / lte ba'i dbus gnas rgyal po yis //
analyzed: de yang / lte ba'i dbus gnas rgyal po yis //
translated: The king abiding in the center of the navel

original: snying ga'i rlung ni bskyod byas te //
analyzed: snying ga'i rlung ni bskyod byas te //
translated: moves the wind of the heart

original: 'bar ba mar me'i rtse lta bus //
analyzed: 'bar ba mar me'i rtse lta bus //
translated: like the tip of a blazing lamp,

original: brda yi sngags kyi skyed par byed //🔽ces pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: brda yi sngags kyi skyed par byed // ces pa lta bu'o //
translated: and generates the symbolic mantra.

original: sngags kyi rgyud bshad nas /
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyud bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the tantra of mantra,

original: sngags btu ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags btu ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: the extraction of the mantra will be explained.

original: sngags thams cad ni sprul la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngags thams cad ni sprul la sogs pa ste /
translated: All mantras are nāgas and so on,

original: de yang gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: and they are also threefold.

original: dpe bstan pa 'jig rten na yang skyes pa dang / bud med dang ma ning ste gsum yod pa bzhin du sngags kyang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: dpe bstan pa 'jig rten na yang skyes pa dang / bud med dang ma ning ste gsum yod pa bzhin du sngags kyang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Just as in the world there are three types of people—male, female, and neuter—mantras also have three aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yi ge gsum ni sngags thams cad kyi bdag po ste /
analyzed: yi ge gsum ni sngags thams cad kyi bdag po ste /
translated: The three syllables are the lords of all mantras.

original: 'di ltar rigs brgya dang lnga dang rigs gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rigs brgya dang lnga dang rigs gsum ste /
translated: Thus, there are one hundred and five families and three families,

original: de yang bdag po yin bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag po yin bzhin du'o //
translated: and they are the lords.

original: de ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re re zhing mi shigs pa dang / lhan cig ces pa ste /
analyzed: re re zhing mi shigs pa dang / lhan cig ces pa ste /
translated: Each is with the indestructible and the bindu.

original: 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas pa mi shigs pa'i rjes su 'jug cing de dang lhan cig tu 'gyur ro //🔽de nas sngags kyi @253a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa dang / gnas pa mi shigs pa'i rjes su 'jug cing de dang lhan cig tu 'gyur ro // de nas sngags kyi @253a * //
translated: It follows and is concomitant with the indestructible state of the elements, entry, and abiding.

original: las bshad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: las bshad pa'i phyir //
translated: Then, in order to explain the activity of mantra,

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “now” and so forth.

original: de la bya ba ni las te gang gi phyir rlung gi lus kyi bya ba la sogs pa byed pa bzhin du sngags kyis kyang byed do //
analyzed: de la bya ba ni las te gang gi phyir rlung gi lus kyi bya ba la sogs pa byed pa bzhin du sngags kyis kyang byed do //
translated: Therein, activity is action, because just as the body acts through the wind, so also mantra acts.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sngags ni nus pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
analyzed: sngags ni nus pa'i bdag nyid yin te /
translated: Mantra is the nature of power.

original: nus pa dang ldan pa des bya ba gzhan la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: nus pa dang ldan pa des bya ba gzhan la 'jug par byed do //
translated: That which possesses power causes engagement in other actions.

original: de yang bskyed pa'i byed pa dang ldan pa ni yi ge gsum las lha'i skur 'byung ste /
analyzed: de yang bskyed pa'i byed pa dang ldan pa ni yi ge gsum las lha'i skur 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, that which possesses the function of generation arises as the deity’s body from the three syllables.

original: 'di las aom la sogs pa 'dus pa dang ma 'dus pa las lha'i sku gcig dang du ma la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di las aom la sogs pa 'dus pa dang ma 'dus pa las lha'i sku gcig dang du ma la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From this, the deity’s body arises from the collection and non-collection of Oṃ and so forth, as one or many.

original: 'dzin pa'i las ni lus kyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i las ni lus kyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The function of retention is the retention of the characteristics of the body.

original: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang gnas par byed do //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang gnas par byed do //
translated: It causes increase, decrease, and stability.

original: sa bon bskyed pa las ni dbang po gnyis ni rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sa bon bskyed pa las ni dbang po gnyis ni rdo rje dang padma snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus su'o //
translated: From the generation of the seed, the two organs are the vajra and lotus at the time of union.

original: thur du bltas pa ni 'dod chags kyi mes zhu bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thur du bltas pa ni 'dod chags kyi mes zhu bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Looking downward, it is melted by the fire of passion.

original: gsang ba'i sna'i bu ga ni rdo rje'i sbu gu nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sna'i bu ga ni rdo rje'i sbu gu nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The secret nose-hole is the emergence from the vajra tube.

original: ci byed ce na /
analyzed: ci byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: sems can rnams bskyed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams bskyed de /
translated: It generates sentient beings.

original: mer mer po la sogs pa rim gyis skye ba'o //
analyzed: mer mer po la sogs pa rim gyis skye ba'o //
translated: The embryo and so on are gradually generated.

original: de nyid kyis mchog 'grub pa'i las ni srog dang rtsol ba stong du song ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis mchog 'grub pa'i las ni srog dang rtsol ba stong du song ste /
translated: The action of accomplishing the supreme by that is the life-force and exertion going a thousand times.

original: steng gi sna'i bu ga las byung nas dbang po'i sgo sad pa ni dbang po la gnas pa'i rtsa kha bye ba'o //
analyzed: steng gi sna'i bu ga las byung nas dbang po'i sgo sad pa ni dbang po la gnas pa'i rtsa kha bye ba'o //
translated: Emerging from the upper nose-hole, the activation of the sense doors is the opening of the channels located in the sense organs.

original: g-yon dang g-yas la sogs pa'i rim pas shes pa ni thun phyed pa dang po la sogs pa'i bye brag gi grangs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya 'thon pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas la sogs pa'i rim pas shes pa ni thun phyed pa dang po la sogs pa'i bye brag gi grangs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya 'thon pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the left, right, and so on is the emergence of the twenty-one thousand six hundred [breaths] through the distinctions of the first half-session, and so on.

original: lhun gyis grub pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa ste /
translated: Spontaneous is the vajra recitation.

original: rdo rje dang 'dra bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje dang 'dra bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is like a vajra.

original: des ni mchog gi dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni mchog gi dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the supreme attainment is accomplished.

original: thun mong gi dngos grub sgrub pa'ang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: thun mong gi dngos grub sgrub pa'ang bstan par bya ste /
translated: The common attainment is also to be taught.

original: lce rtse shin tu mi bskyod cing //
analyzed: lce rtse shin tu mi bskyod cing //
translated: The tip of the tongue is extremely unmoving.

original: zhes pa ni g-yo bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni g-yo bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means that it does not move.

original: zhi ba ni lte ba'i rlung la brten pa'i bzlas pas ni zhi ba dang bsrung ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni lte ba'i rlung la brten pa'i bzlas pas ni zhi ba dang bsrung ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the recitation based on the navel wind, pacification and protection are accomplished.

original: snying ga'i rlung la brten pa'i bzlas pas ni rgyas pa ste /
analyzed: snying ga'i rlung la brten pa'i bzlas pas ni rgyas pa ste /
translated: By the recitation based on the heart wind, increase is accomplished.

original: lo tog sgrub pa dang / bu tsha bskyed pa dang / nor phyugs 'phel ba dang / bcud dgug pa dang ; tshe bsring ba la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo tog sgrub pa dang / bu tsha bskyed pa dang / nor phyugs 'phel ba dang / bcud dgug pa dang ; tshe bsring ba la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The accomplishment of crops, the production of children, the increase of wealth and cattle, the summoning of vitality, and the prolongation of life, and so forth, are accomplished.

original: mgrin pa'i rlung la brten pas ni dbang ste /
analyzed: mgrin pa'i rlung la brten pas ni dbang ste /
translated: By the recitation based on the throat wind, power is accomplished.

original: lha'i bu mo dgug pa la sogs pa dang / rgyal po la sogs pa dbang du bya ba dang / khugs su gzhug pa yang ngo //
analyzed: lha'i bu mo dgug pa la sogs pa dang / rgyal po la sogs pa dbang du bya ba dang / khugs su gzhug pa yang ngo //
translated: and summoning celestial maidens, and so on, and subjugating kings, and so on, and bringing them under one's power.

original: gsang ba'i rlung la brten par ni drag po ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i rlung la brten par ni drag po ste /
translated: The violent is based on the secret wind.

original: rmongs pa dang / @253b rengs pa dang / lkugs pa dang / smyo 'bros pa dang / bsad pa dang / bskrad pa dang / dbye ba dang / 'thab pa dang / dpral ba dang / g-yul bzlog pa dang / ri rab bshig pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽zas sbyong ba la sogs pa'i las bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rmongs pa dang / @253b rengs pa dang / lkugs pa dang / smyo 'bros pa dang / bsad pa dang / bskrad pa dang / dbye ba dang / 'thab pa dang / dpral ba dang / g-yul bzlog pa dang / ri rab bshig pa la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro // zas sbyong ba la sogs pa'i las bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is accomplished by means of stupefying, paralyzing, muting, driving mad, killing, banishing, dividing, fighting, striking, turning back an army, destroying Mount Meru, and so on.

original: yi ge gsum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yi ge gsum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the purification of food and so on, he says the three syllables, and so on.

original: yi ge gsum po 'dis zas sbyong ste /
analyzed: yi ge gsum po 'dis zas sbyong ste /
translated: By means of these three syllables, one purifies food.

original: a'a: ni rtogs par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: a'a: ni rtogs par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The aḥ is the very realization.

original: aom gyis ni 'bar bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: aom gyis ni 'bar bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: The oṃ is the very ignition.

original: h'um gis ni sbyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: h'um gis ni sbyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The hūṃ is the very purification.

original: yang na de las bzlog pa ste ci rigs so //
analyzed: yang na de las bzlog pa ste ci rigs so //
translated: Alternatively, it is the reverse of that, as is appropriate.

original: kha zas ni rtog med pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: kha zas ni rtog med pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: As for food, it is in terms of the non-conceptual.

original: sha lnga la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: sha lnga la sogs pa'o//
translated: the five meats, etc.

original: yang na ni spyi po dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga sbyong ba ste /
analyzed: yang na ni spyi po dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga sbyong ba ste /
translated: Or else, the purification of the head, throat, and heart,

original: 'os su byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: 'os su byed pa'i las can no //
translated: is the function of making fit.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: de nas yi ge btu ba ston te /
analyzed: de nas yi ge btu ba ston te /
translated: Then, the extraction of the syllables is taught.

original: de la yi ge btu ba 'di yang gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de la yi ge btu ba 'di yang gang las shes she na /
translated: And from what is this extraction of the syllables known?

original: dgongs pa lung ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dgongs pa lung ston pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement “as taught in the Sandhivyākaraṇa, etc. ”

original: de yang tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i dbang du byas te rnal 'byor pa lha'i dkyil 'khor du byas pa dgu ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de yang tshogs kyi 'khor lo'i dbang du byas te rnal 'byor pa lha'i dkyil 'khor du byas pa dgu ni gtso bo'o //
translated: Moreover, from the perspective of the wheel of the gaṇa, the yogin who has made the maṇḍala of the deity is the principal one.

original: de'i dbus na rigs dang po'i ngo bo gcig po pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus na rigs dang po'i ngo bo gcig po pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'o //
translated: In the middle of that, the one who is the nature of the first family is Mahāvajradhara.

original: 'di yang bcur 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: 'di yang bcur 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: This is also not ten.

original: yang na sha dang bdud rtsi bcu la spyod kyang des ma bcings pa ni de'i rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sha dang bdud rtsi bcu la spyod kyang des ma bcings pa ni de'i rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Or else, even though one enjoys the ten substances and nectars, one is not bound by them, being free from the conception of them.

original: de ni bcings med ces bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bcings med ces bya ste /
translated: That is called “unbound. ”

original: zhes pa ni chags pa med pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni chags pa med pa ste /
translated: This is nonattachment.

original: yi ge las byung ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge las byung ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the perspective of the syllables.

original: yang na dang po ni yi ge drug ste /
analyzed: yang na dang po ni yi ge drug ste /
translated: Or else, the first is the six-syllable,

original: de'i gcig ni yi ge aa'o //
analyzed: de'i gcig ni yi ge aa'o //
translated: and one of those is the syllable A.

original: dgu'i dbus na zhes pa ni shes rab kyi sde tshan ring po dang thung du'i bye brag gis dgu'i dbus na'o //
analyzed: dgu'i dbus na zhes pa ni shes rab kyi sde tshan ring po dang thung du'i bye brag gis dgu'i dbus na'o //
translated: In the middle of the nine is the middle of the nine classes, by the distinction of long and short of the class of wisdom.

original: gang zhig bcu yis ma bcings pa ni 'di la sde tshan bcu pa ni med do zhe'o //
analyzed: gang zhig bcu yis ma bcings pa ni 'di la sde tshan bcu pa ni med do zhe'o //
translated: That which is not bound by the ten is that in which there is no class of ten.

original: de shes pa ni mchog gi gnas zhes pa ni mchog thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de shes pa ni mchog gi gnas zhes pa ni mchog thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The knowledge of that is the supreme place, the cause of attaining the supreme.

original: yang na dang po gcig ni byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon yi ge aa'i gzugs can no //
analyzed: yang na dang po gcig ni byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon yi ge aa'i gzugs can no //
translated: Or else, the first one is the seed of the thought of enlightenment, having the form of the syllable A.

original: 'di ni bu ga dgu'i dbus snying gi nang na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bu ga dgu'i dbus snying gi nang na gnas pa'o //
translated: This is in the middle of the nine openings, in the interior of the heart.

original: 'di la bu ga bcu bar gyur pa ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la bu ga bcu bar gyur pa ni gang yang med do //
translated: There is no other that is the tenth opening.

original: de ni mchog gnas te sting ga'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de ni mchog gnas te sting ga'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: That is the supreme place, the navel wheel.

original: aa sa bcings pa ni aa dang rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: aa sa bcings pa ni aa dang rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: The binding of the A is the A and the following.

original: de shes pa'i khyad par bstan pa /
analyzed: de shes pa'i khyad par bstan pa /
translated: The knowledge of that is taught.

original: gang gis de shes 'gro ba'i bla /
analyzed: gang gis de shes 'gro ba'i bla /
translated: By whom that is known, the mind of the world.

original: zhes pa ni yi ge'i don de gang gis gang gi sgo nas shes rab gsum mthar phyin @254a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yi ge'i don de gang gis gang gi sgo nas shes rab gsum mthar phyin @254a * //
translated: This is the meaning of the words.🔽

original: pa bslabs pa de ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pa bslabs pa de ni 'gro ba thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the syllables. By whom, by means of what, the three wisdoms are perfected, that one becomes the best of all beings.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the supramundane qualities,

original: gang gis shes nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gis shes nas zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “By whom, having known . . .”

original: gang gis yi ge shes pa de ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa rnam par grol zhe'o //
analyzed: gang gis yi ge shes pa de ni nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa rnam par grol zhe'o //
translated: and so on. By whom the syllables are known, that one is liberated from the afflictive and the cognitive obstructions, and so on.

original: 'byung ba'i mtha' ni ksha ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i mtha' ni ksha ste /
translated: The end of the elements is kṣa.

original: 'dis rnal 'byor ba'i gsang ba'i gzhal yas khang du bzhugs nas las thams cad byed do //
analyzed: 'dis rnal 'byor ba'i gsang ba'i gzhal yas khang du bzhugs nas las thams cad byed do //
translated: By this, having dwelt in the secret celestial mansion of the yogin, one performs all activities.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: cha la sogs pa bcu drug gnas //
analyzed: cha la sogs pa bcu drug gnas //
translated: The sixteen parts and so on are the locations.

original: zhes pa ni ha'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ha'o //
translated: This is ha.

original: lnga pa lnga ni ma ste ham ngo //
analyzed: lnga pa lnga ni ma ste ham ngo //
translated: The fifth of the fifth is ma, which is haṃ.

original: bzhi ni gsum du nges par sbyar ;
analyzed: bzhi ni gsum du nges par sbyar ;
translated: The fourth is definitely applied to the third.

original: / zhes pa ni ham dang ksha la sogs pa la brten nas 'dir rnal 'byor pas dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa dang gnas pa la bslab par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: / zhes pa ni ham dang ksha la sogs pa la brten nas 'dir rnal 'byor pas dbugs dbyung ba dang 'jug pa dang gnas pa la bslab par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Thus, based on the haṃ, kṣa, and so on, here the yogī should train in the exhalation, inhalation, and retention of breath.

original: yi ge gsum po gang zhe na /
analyzed: yi ge gsum po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three syllables?

original: a'am ni a'am ste gnas pa'o //
analyzed: a'am ni a'am ste gnas pa'o //
translated: The long a is the exhalation.

original: ring po ni h'um zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ring po ni h'um zhes pa'o //
translated: The long one is the hūṃ.

original: yon tan sbyor ba ni tshe bsring ba la sogs pa ste aom mo //
analyzed: yon tan sbyor ba ni tshe bsring ba la sogs pa ste aom mo //
translated: The application of the qualities is the extension of life, and so on, which is the oṃ.

original: thung du ni aa thung du ste /
analyzed: thung du ni aa thung du ste /
translated: The short one is the short a.

original: ngag ma lus pa'i rgyur gyur cing lhan cig tu gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ngag ma lus pa'i rgyur gyur cing lhan cig tu gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of all speech and abides together.

original: don dam par na yi ge zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par na yi ge zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the ultimate nature of the syllables?

original: gcig min du ma ma yin te //
analyzed: gcig min du ma ma yin te //
translated: It is not one and not many.

original: gcig dang du ma'i rnam par bral //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma'i rnam par bral //
translated: It is free from one and many.

original: zhe'o // ya yi don gyis ci yang rung //
analyzed: zhe'o // ya yi don gyis ci yang rung //
translated: The meaning of ya is “anything.”

original: zhes pa ni ya ni rlung ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ya ni rlung ste /
translated: Ya is the wind.

original: gsang ba'i rlung la brten pas ni drag po'i las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i rlung la brten pas ni drag po'i las thams cad 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Based on the secret wind, all violent activities are accomplished.

original: gzhan gong du bshad par bas so //
analyzed: gzhan gong du bshad par bas so //
translated: The others are explained above.

original: sngags kyi de kho na nyid ni sngags ma nor ba ston pas sngags kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: sngags kyi de kho na nyid ni sngags ma nor ba ston pas sngags kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The reality of mantra is the reality of mantra because it teaches the unerring mantra.

original: de la gang du thung du zhes bya ba de nyid mi shes nas dris pa dang / lan du 'di na gsung rab 'chad pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la gang du thung du zhes bya ba de nyid mi shes nas dris pa dang / lan du 'di na gsung rab 'chad pa dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: There, not knowing what is meant by “short,” he asks, and in reply it is said, “Here, those who explain the scriptures…”

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab 'chad pa dang / nyan pa dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab 'chad pa dang / nyan pa dang / klog pa dang / kha ton byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In this world realm, there are those who explain the scriptures of the Tathāgata, listen, read, recite, and so on.

original: by'a ka ra na'i tshig sngon du byas nas zhes pa ni by'a ka ra na'i sgra dngos po dang las kyis la sogs pa sngon du btang ba'i sgra'i don 'ba' zhig gi rjes su 'brang gi zhes pa ni sgra kho na la 'jug gi don la ma yin
analyzed: by'a ka ra na'i tshig sngon du byas nas zhes pa ni by'a ka ra na'i sgra dngos po dang las kyis la sogs pa sngon du btang ba'i sgra'i don 'ba' zhig gi rjes su 'brang gi zhes pa ni sgra kho na la 'jug gi don la ma yin
translated: Having made the Vyakaraṇa word precede means that the sound of the Vyakaraṇa word follows only the meaning of the sound that is preceded by the case ending and so on, it does not engage the meaning.

original: no zhe'o // yi ge'i don la gang du 'jug na skabs 'dir don la thos pa la sogs pas mdzub mos zla ba ston pa ltar ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: no zhe'o // yi ge'i don la gang du 'jug na skabs 'dir don la thos pa la sogs pas mdzub mos zla ba ston pa ltar ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: The meaning of the syllables is that, when one enters, it is not like the moon being shown by the finger of hearing and so forth in this context.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod @254b yul te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod @254b yul te /
translated: It is the domain of the buddhas.

original: shugs kyi dam pa ma yin pa rnams kyi yul ma yin par bstan to zhe'o //
analyzed: shugs kyi dam pa ma yin pa rnams kyi yul ma yin par bstan to zhe'o //
translated: It is taught that it is not the domain of those who are not sublime.

original: 'o na sgra yang gang gi rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sgra yang gang gi rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: Well, what is the nature of sound?

original: de'i phyir sgra ni a'a li dang k'a li rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra ni a'a li dang k'a li rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, sound is the nature of the vowels and consonants.

original: rjod par byed pa thams cad ni a'a li dang k'a li'i ngo bo nyid do zhe'o //🔽a'a li dang k'a li zhes pa yang gang yin du zhig ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa thams cad ni a'a li dang k'a li'i ngo bo nyid do zhe'o // a'a li dang k'a li zhes pa yang gang yin du zhig ce na de'i phyir /
translated: All that expresses is the nature of the vowels and consonants.🔽What are the vowels and consonants?

original: a'a li ni aa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: a'a li ni aa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the vowels are a, and so on.

original: 'di la bcu drug yod pas na 'di ni bcu drug go //
analyzed: 'di la bcu drug yod pas na 'di ni bcu drug go //
translated: Since there are sixteen of them, there are sixteen.

original: k'a li ni ka la sogs pa sde tshan bdun no //
analyzed: k'a li ni ka la sogs pa sde tshan bdun no //
translated: The consonants are the seven groups beginning with ka.

original: 'di la sum cu rtsa gsum yod pas 'di ni sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di la sum cu rtsa gsum yod pas 'di ni sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: Since there are thirty-three of these, this is the Thirty-three.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: ka'i don dang de ston pa'i sgra la sogs pa aa las 'byung ngo zhes pa de yang gang las shes she na /
analyzed: ka'i don dang de ston pa'i sgra la sogs pa aa las 'byung ngo zhes pa de yang gang las shes she na /
translated: If it is asked from where is it known that the meaning of ka and the🔽sound that shows it arise from a, therefore it is said, The Bhagavān

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las gsungs zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las gsungs zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: said in the Laṅkāvatāra Sūtra.

original: 'dir lang kar gshegs pa kho na las gsungs zhes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir lang kar gshegs pa kho na las gsungs zhes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not that it is said only in the Laṅkāvatāra;

original: gsungs pa kho na zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsungs pa kho na zhes sbyar ro //
translated: it is said only in the Laṅkāvatāra.

original: dpe dgod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe dgod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to give an example,

original: skyes bu la la zhig ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: skyes bu la la zhig ces pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: a certain person and so on are easy to understand.

original: tshig dang ngag la sogs pa ni ming dang yi ge dang bstan bcos te /
analyzed: tshig dang ngag la sogs pa ni ming dang yi ge dang bstan bcos te /
translated: Words, speech, and so on are the treatises of names and syllables.

original: de'i bye brag gam khyad par rnam par shes pa ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bye brag gam khyad par rnam par shes pa ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what is the consciousness that is the particular or🔽distinction of that,

original: lan du aa zhes bya ba 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lan du aa zhes bya ba 'di yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the reply is this a and so on.

original: de la aa zhes bya ba ni mi shigs pa'i thig le ste /
analyzed: de la aa zhes bya ba ni mi shigs pa'i thig le ste /
translated: A is the indestructible bindu.

original: sgra thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: is the cause of all sounds.

original: de nyid dgongs pa can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid dgongs pa can yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that this is intentional,

original: ma yin pa'i lung gzhan yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i lung gzhan yod pa'i phyir /
translated: it is not, because there are other scriptures.

original: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: mtshan yang dag par brjod pa las kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: It is also said in the Nāmasaṃgīti, A is the supreme of all letters, and so on. This is easy to understand.

original: gang gis gang gi mtshan dang dpe byad nges par brjod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis gang gi mtshan dang dpe byad nges par brjod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is called by the name of a certain one's marks and beauties is so-called.🔽A is the supreme of all letters,

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces pa ni yi ge gang las mchog tu gyur pa de ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog ste /
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog / ces pa ni yi ge gang las mchog tu gyur pa de ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog ste /
translated: that from which the supreme arises is the supreme of all letters.

original: yi ge thams cad skyed pa dang khyab pa nyid do //
analyzed: yi ge thams cad skyed pa dang khyab pa nyid do //
translated: It is the origination and pervasion of all letters.

original: de nyid bstan pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa /
translated: That is taught:

original: don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
analyzed: don chen yi ge dam pa yin //
translated: A is the great meaning, the holy letter.

original: zhes pa don khyad par ston pa nyid dang / 'byung ba nyid dang ; 'thob pa nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa don khyad par ston pa nyid dang / 'byung ba nyid dang ; 'thob pa nyid la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of teaching the special meaning, origination, attainment, and so on.

original: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
analyzed: khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
translated: Arisen from within, unborn.

original: ces pa ni gang khong nas 'byung ba de ni khong nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni gang khong nas 'byung ba de ni khong nas 'byung ba ste /
translated: That which arises from within is arisen from within.

original: skyes bu rnams kyi snying gi nang nas 'byung ba'o //🔽tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi snying gi nang nas 'byung ba'o // tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: It arises from the heart of all beings.🔽It is beyond verbal expression.

original: zhes pa'i ngag gi brjod pa las 'das zhes pa'i tha tshig @255a * //
analyzed: zhes pa'i ngag gi brjod pa las 'das zhes pa'i tha tshig @255a * //
translated: It is beyond the expression of speech.🔽The supreme cause of all expressions.

original: go ; / brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces pa ni a'a li dang k'a li thams cad 'byung ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽chig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: go ; / brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / ces pa ni a'a li dang k'a li thams cad 'byung ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o // chig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: It is so called because it is the source of all the vowels and consonants.🔽It illuminates all words.

original: ces pa ni sgra thams cad gsal zhing zur phyin par byed ce'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni sgra thams cad gsal zhing zur phyin par byed ce'o //
translated: It illuminates and clarifies all sounds.

original: de skad gsungs pa ni thub pa chen pos bka' stsal pa'o ;
analyzed: de skad gsungs pa ni thub pa chen pos bka' stsal pa'o ;
translated: This is what the Great Sage said.

original: / lung gzhan las kyang gsal bar ston pa yod pas de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: / lung gzhan las kyang gsal bar ston pa yod pas de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: And because there is also a clear teaching in another scripture, therefore it is said:

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: bsam gtan ma lus pa'i sgo ni thabs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan ma lus pa'i sgo ni thabs te /
translated: The door of all meditations is the means.

original: gang gis chos thams cad kyi chos nyid thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad kyi chos nyid thob pa'i thabs su gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is so called because it is the means by which one attains the reality of all dharmas.

original: de'i tshig ni de ston pa'i sgra'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de'i tshig ni de ston pa'i sgra'i tshogs so //
translated: Its words are the collection of sounds that teach that.

original: de'i rgyur gyur pa dang khyad pa la sogs pa gang yin zhe na //🔽aa'o // de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyur gyur pa dang khyad pa la sogs pa gang yin zhe na // aa'o // de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is its cause, and what is its distinction, etc.?

original: skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Its own characteristic is non-arising.

original: gang la skye ba dang bral ba de ni skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la skye ba dang bral ba de ni skye ba med pa'o //
translated: That which is free from arising is non-arising.

original: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba yang yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyis med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes bya ba yang yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyis med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: Non-arising is merely the negation of the convention of existence; it is not the affirmation of the convention of non-existence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med par 'gag pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: med par 'gag pa yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cessation of non-existence.🔽It is also said to be the innate syllable.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i yi ge yin par yang gsungs te zhes pa ni gang skye ba mer mer po la sogs pa'i dus na skye ba ste /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i yi ge yin par yang gsungs te zhes pa ni gang skye ba mer mer po la sogs pa'i dus na skye ba ste /
translated: That which arises at the time of the kalala, etc., is arising.

original: de yang gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de yang gang las shes she na /
translated: How is that known?

original: de'i phyir / rdo rje dkyil 'khor brgyan zhes bya ba'i rgyud las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / rdo rje dkyil 'khor brgyan zhes bya ba'i rgyud las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “In the Tantra Adorned with the Vajra Mandala,” and so on.

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ni rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The vajra maṇḍala is the maṇḍala of the vajra.

original: rdo rje sems dpas gtso bo byas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpas gtso bo byas pa'o //
translated: It is headed by Vajrasattva.

original: de la mdzes pa'am des mdzes par bstan te /
analyzed: de la mdzes pa'am des mdzes par bstan te /
translated: It is beautiful in it, or it is beautiful by it.

original: de'i gzhung gi tshogs gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhung gi tshogs gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the collection of its scriptures is so-called.

original: de las ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de las ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught in it?

original: de'i phyir snying gi dbus ni mi shigs pa zhes pa ni gnas bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir snying gi dbus ni mi shigs pa zhes pa ni gnas bstan pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the middle of the heart is the indestructible. This teaches the location.

original: gang na gnas na snying gi dbus te /
analyzed: gang na gnas na snying gi dbus te /
translated: Where is it located? In the middle of the heart.

original: snying gi dbus na rtsa padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i tshul can gyi dbus su'o //
analyzed: snying gi dbus na rtsa padma 'dab ma brgyad pa'i tshul can gyi dbus su'o //
translated: In the middle of the heart, in the middle of a channel in the form of an eight-petaled lotus.

original: gang gnas zhe na /
analyzed: gang gnas zhe na /
translated: What is located there?

original: mi shigs pa ste rlung mi shigs pa rgyal po aa'i ngo bor gnas so //
analyzed: mi shigs pa ste rlung mi shigs pa rgyal po aa'i ngo bor gnas so //
translated: The indestructible, the indestructible wind, located in the nature of the king, the letter A.

original: ji ltar gnas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas she na /
translated: How is it located?

original: 'bar zhing zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bar zhing zhes pa'o //
translated: It is blazing.

original: dpe nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: dpe nyid bshad pa /
translated: The example itself is explained.

original: mar me dag kyang mtshungs zhes pa ni gang las gsal zhing mi g-yob yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mar me dag kyang mtshungs zhes pa ni gang las gsal zhing mi g-yob yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The lamps are also similar. That which is clear and unmoving is so-called.

original: de'i don nyid bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i don nyid bshad pa /
translated: The meaning of that itself is explained.

original: mi 'gyur mchog tu phra ba ste //
analyzed: mi 'gyur mchog tu phra ba ste //
translated: It is unchanging, supremely subtle,

original: zhes pa ni dngos po dang mtshan ma gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing rtog ge bas mi shes pas de'i @255b phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dngos po dang mtshan ma gzhan du mi 'gyur zhing rtog ge bas mi shes pas de'i @255b phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is because things and signs do not change into something else, and are not known by logicians. Therefore, it is called that.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: gang gis gang du bshad pa de'i phyir zhe'o //
analyzed: gang gis gang du bshad pa de'i phyir zhe'o //
translated: It is because of that which is explained where. Therefore, it is said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad aa'i rigs su gyur pa ni mi g-yo bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad aa'i rigs su gyur pa ni mi g-yo bar gyur pa ste /
translated: All tathāgatas become the family of A, which is immobility.

original: gang rnam par rtog pa thams cad g-yo ba med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par rtog pa thams cad g-yo ba med pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is without the movement of all conceptuality is called that.

original: aa rgyur gyur pa ni aas lus skyed par byed pa dang / aa las nges par byung ba ni yi ge 'byung bar byed pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: aa rgyur gyur pa ni aas lus skyed par byed pa dang / aa las nges par byung ba ni yi ge 'byung bar byed pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which becomes the cause of A is that which generates the body with A, and that which arises from A is that which produces the syllables. That is called that.

original: brjod bzhin pa ni 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa ni ngag gi tshogs thams cad skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: brjod bzhin pa ni 'gag pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa ni ngag gi tshogs thams cad skad cig ma ste /
translated: That which is being expressed is the nature of cessation means that all collections of speech are momentary.

original: gang phyis brjod par 'byung ba na sngar brjod pa 'gags te dper na chu bo bzhin no//
analyzed: gang phyis brjod par 'byung ba na sngar brjod pa 'gags te dper na chu bo bzhin no//
translated: When that which is later expressed arises, that which was previously expressed ceases, just as in the case of a river.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: The characteristic of conceptualization

original: zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtog bcas kyi gzung ba'i cha'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtog bcas kyi gzung ba'i cha'o //
translated: This is the apprehended aspect of the conceptual mental consciousness.🔽Having understood it as it really is,

original: de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes nas zhes pa ni dngos po dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes nas zhes pa ni dngos po dang mthun pa ste /
translated: means in accordance with the thing,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha yin pa dang / aa las byung bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba'i cha yin pa dang / aa las byung bar shes pa'o //
translated: understanding that it arises from a and is the apprehended aspect of the mental consciousness.

original: sgra dang sgra ma yin pa la ltos pa med pa yang aa las byung bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: sgra dang sgra ma yin pa la ltos pa med pa yang aa las byung bar shes pa'o //
translated: Understanding that it arises from a is also independent of sound and nonsound.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbye bas shes pa ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i tshogs dpag tu med pa dang / mthun par sgra sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbye bas shes pa ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i tshogs dpag tu med pa dang / mthun par sgra sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa'o //
translated: Understanding it through the divisions of sentient beings' thoughts is teaching the Dharma with various sounds in accordance with the immeasurable assemblies of sentient beings' thoughts.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gis ngag gcig pas ni gang yang 'dul bar mi 'gyur bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang gis ngag gcig pas ni gang yang 'dul bar mi 'gyur bar dgongs so //
translated: It is thought that no one will be tamed by any one speech.

original: yi ge yang don dam par yongs su dag pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: yi ge yang don dam par yongs su dag pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: And the syllable is ultimately pure.

original: de yang gang las shes she na //
analyzed: de yang gang las shes she na //
translated: How is that known?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said, “Subhūti, you have spoken well.

original: don la brtag pa ni don la brtag pa ste /
analyzed: don la brtag pa ni don la brtag pa ste /
translated: Investigating the meaning is investigating the meaning.

original: rgyu dang lam dang 'bras bu la dpyad cing de sngon du bya'o//
analyzed: rgyu dang lam dang 'bras bu la dpyad cing de sngon du bya'o//
translated: Analyze cause, path, and effect, and put that first.

original: yi ge la rton par mi bya ba ni yi ge la dpyad pa dang / yi ge mngon du mi bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge la rton par mi bya ba ni yi ge la dpyad pa dang / yi ge mngon du mi bya'o //
translated: Do not rely on the letters. Do not analyze the letters. Do not manifest the letters.

original: 'o na yi ge la mi rton pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yi ge la mi rton pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Well then, why not rely on the letters?

original: de'i lan du yi ge'i rjes su 'jug pa ni yi ge la gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: de'i lan du yi ge'i rjes su 'jug pa ni yi ge la gzhol ba'o //
translated: The answer is: “To engage in the letters is to be devoted to the letters.”

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by that?

original: don nyams par byed cing gzhan yang khong du chud par mi byed do zhes pa ni don brjod pa las 'das te /
analyzed: don nyams par byed cing gzhan yang khong du chud par mi byed do zhes pa ni don brjod pa las 'das te /
translated: “It causes the meaning to deteriorate and also does not cause others to understand.”

original: yi ge la rtog na ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa mi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge la rtog na ni chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa mi rtogs pa'o //
translated: If one conceptualizes the letters, one does not realize that all phenomena are essenceless.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: brjod pa dang bral ba ni gcig gis gcig spangs pa ste /
analyzed: brjod pa dang bral ba ni gcig gis gcig spangs pa ste /
translated: “Free from expression” is mutually exclusive.

original: rta dang ba glang bzhin no //
analyzed: rta dang ba glang bzhin no //
translated: Like a horse and an ox.

original: yi ge las gzhan pa ni don dam pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge las gzhan pa ni don dam pa ste /
translated: “Other than the letters” is the ultimate.

original: yi ge bsten pas shes par mi 'gyur ba @256a * //
analyzed: yi ge bsten pas shes par mi 'gyur ba @256a * //
translated: One does not come to know by relying on the letters.🔽

original: ni gong bzhin no //
analyzed: ni gong bzhin no //
translated: It is not the case that one does not understand the meaning by relying on the letters, as was said above.

original: de bas ni yi ge ni don ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas ni yi ge ni don ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the letters are not the meaning.

original: 'o na yi ges don mi brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na yi ges don mi brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the meaning is not expressed by the letters?

original: yi ge zhes bya ba 'dis ci zhig byed ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: yi ge zhes bya ba 'dis ci zhig byed ce na ma yin te /
translated: What is the function of what is called a letter? It is not the case that it is not.

original: yang dag pa'i don brjod pa'i brdar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don brjod pa'i brdar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the sign for expressing the true meaning.

original: 'o na des brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na des brjod par 'gyur ro zhe na'ang ma yin te /
translated: But if it is the case that it is expressed by that, it is not the case.

original: brjod par bya ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of expression is not established.

original: 'o na des ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na des ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: But what does it do?

original: brda byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brda byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it makes a sign.

original: brda zhes bya ba ni ci zhig bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: brda zhes bya ba ni ci zhig bstan par bya'o //
translated: What is called a sign should be shown.

original: yod pa ma yin pas mi rung ngo zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pas mi rung ngo zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that it is not suitable because it does not exist, it is not the case.

original: dngos po med pa nyid bstan bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa nyid bstan bya'o //
translated: The nonexistence of an entity should be shown.

original: bstan bya zhes bya ba yang ci rdzas su yod pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: bstan bya zhes bya ba yang ci rdzas su yod pa ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is asked, “Is what is called a show also not substantially existent? ” it is not the case.

original: rdzas su med pa la yang de ltar snang ba'i blo skye ste /
analyzed: rdzas su med pa la yang de ltar snang ba'i blo skye ste /
translated: The mind that appears in that way arises in the absence of substance.

original: gang la ci ltar snang ba de ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gang la ci ltar snang ba de ni bstan par bya'o //
translated: Whatever appears in whatever way is to be taught.

original: 'o na de nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that that is not the object of expression,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not so,

original: brjod par bya ba yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of expression is not established.

original: 'o na yi ger snang ba nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na yi ger snang ba nyid yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don't the syllables appear?

original: ci'i phyir de la med ces bya zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la med ces bya zhe na ;
translated: Why are they said to be nonexistent?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: yi ge yang snang ba tsam nyid na rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge yang snang ba tsam nyid na rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: because the syllables are mere appearance and are pure by nature,

original: me long gi gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: me long gi gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: like reflections in a mirror.

original: 'on kyang kun rdzob tu ni don byed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang kun rdzob tu ni don byed pa'i ngo bor rnam par gnas so //
translated: However, conventionally they exist as the nature of the performance of function.

original: brda zhes bya ba yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: brda zhes bya ba yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is called a sign?

original: la las sor mo'i rtse mo gcig la dngos po gcig bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: la las sor mo'i rtse mo gcig la dngos po gcig bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Some say that a single fingertip is for a single activity, and so on.

original: sor mo'i rtse mos bstan pa ni byis pa la sor mo bsgreng ste des zla ba bstan na don la rtog pa ni nam mkha'i zla ba rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sor mo'i rtse mos bstan pa ni byis pa la sor mo bsgreng ste des zla ba bstan na don la rtog pa ni nam mkha'i zla ba rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: When a fingertip is shown, a child imagines the moon when the fingertip points to the moon.

original: sgra la rtog pa ni sor mo zla bar rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra la rtog pa ni sor mo zla bar rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: The idea of sound is like the idea of a finger as the moon.

original: sor mo 'dis zla ba ston pa ni gzhan la shes pa bskyed pa'i don du brda phrad sla bar byed do //
analyzed: sor mo 'dis zla ba ston pa ni gzhan la shes pa bskyed pa'i don du brda phrad sla bar byed do //
translated: This finger points to the moon in order to generate knowledge in another person, making it easy to understand.

original: dngos po la ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But it is not like that with a thing.

original: gzhan yang sgra la ni don med kyi sor mo bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgra la ni don med kyi sor mo bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, sound is meaningless, like a finger.

original: don la ni don yod par 'gyur te nam mkha'i zla ba bzhin no //
analyzed: don la ni don yod par 'gyur te nam mkha'i zla ba bzhin no //
translated: But a thing would be meaningful, like the moon in the sky.

original: don med pa'i sgras kyang de ston par mi nus te /
analyzed: don med pa'i sgras kyang de ston par mi nus te /
translated: A meaningless sound cannot show that.

original: mdzub mos zla ba ston pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mdzub mos zla ba ston pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a finger pointing to the moon.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The other is easy to understand.

original: tshig la yang dbye ba du  zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: tshig la yang dbye ba du  zhig yod ce na /
translated: How many kinds of words are there?

original: rnam pa bzhi yod de zhes pa ni 'di la bzhi yod pas na rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi yod de zhes pa ni 'di la bzhi yod pas na rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four kinds.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Words of definition, and so on.

original: de nyid mi shes nas dris pa /
analyzed: de nyid mi shes nas dris pa /
translated: Not knowing that, he asks:

original: mtshan nyid kyi tshig kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi tshig kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are words of definition?

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa gzugs la mtshan mar mngon par zhen pa las byung @256b ngo zhes pa ni gzugs kyi shes pa rkyen bzhi las skyes pas te /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa gzugs la mtshan mar mngon par zhen pa las byung @256b ngo zhes pa ni gzugs kyi shes pa rkyen bzhi las skyes pas te /
translated: The words arises from one's own conceptual discrimination means that the consciousness of form arises from the four conditions.

original: de las yi ge'i gzugs snang ngo //
analyzed: de las yi ge'i gzugs snang ngo //
translated: From that, the appearance of the form of letters arises.

original: de las sgrar 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las sgrar 'byung ngo //
translated: From that, sound arises.

original: de bas na gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called that because it exists in that way.

original: de la rmi lam gyi tshig gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rmi lam gyi tshig gang zhe na /
translated: What are dream words?

original: sngon myong ba'i yul rjes su dran pa ni rmi lam ma yin pa'i dus na myong ba'i yul gyi bag chags shes pa la yod pa'o //
analyzed: sngon myong ba'i yul rjes su dran pa ni rmi lam ma yin pa'i dus na myong ba'i yul gyi bag chags shes pa la yod pa'o //
translated: Remembering a previously experienced object means that the latent impressions of an object experienced at a time when one is not dreaming exist in consciousness.

original: de'i bag chags rmi lam ni myong ste /
analyzed: de'i bag chags rmi lam ni myong ste /
translated: The latent impressions of that dream are experienced.

original: de las byung ba'i tshig dang / rtog pa'i yul med pa las byung ba ni sngon ma mthong ba'i yul rmi lam na mthong ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i tshig dang / rtog pa'i yul med pa las byung ba ni sngon ma mthong ba'i yul rmi lam na mthong ste /
translated: The words and conceptual objects that arise from that arise from a nonexistent object because an object that was not seen before is seen in a dream.

original: de las byung ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i tshig go //
translated: The words that arise from that are dream words.

original: de la rmi lam gyi tshig ces ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la rmi lam gyi tshig ces ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why are they called dream words?

original: rmi lam na brdar btags kyang rung /
analyzed: rmi lam na brdar btags kyang rung /
translated: Because they are conventional in a dream means that even though they are conventional in a dream, they are not conventional in the waking state.

original: sad nas brdar btags kyang rung ste /
analyzed: sad nas brdar btags kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether one is awake or asleep,

original: rmi lam gyi yul las byung ba'i phyir rmi lam gyi tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi yul las byung ba'i phyir rmi lam gyi tshig ces bya'o //
translated: it is called a dream because it arises from the objects of a dream.

original: gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i tshig gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i tshig gang zhe na /
translated: What is a word that is the result of the imagination of what is unreal?

original: sems can rnams kyis mngon byas pa'i las ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas bsags pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i las rnams te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis mngon byas pa'i las ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas bsags pa'i dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i las rnams te /
translated: It is the actions that are performed by beings, the wholesome, unwholesome, and non-defined actions accumulated since beginningless time.

original: de dag rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos shing rjes su dran pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis yongs su bsgos shing rjes su dran pa las byung ba'o //
translated: They arise from the latent impressions of one’s own imagination and memory.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi tshig gang zhe na /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus kyi tshig gang zhe na /
translated: What is a word that has no beginning?

original: lan du thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa la mngon par zhen pa ni nam mkha' nam yod pa'i dus nas rang gi gzugs la sogs pa la btags shing yul du byas te de la zhen cing chags pa'o //
analyzed: lan du thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa la mngon par zhen pa ni nam mkha' nam yod pa'i dus nas rang gi gzugs la sogs pa la btags shing yul du byas te de la zhen cing chags pa'o //
translated: It is the imagination of what is unreal that has existed since beginningless time. Since space has existed, one has imagined one’s own form, etc. , and has taken it as an object, becoming attached to it and desiring it.

original: de'i bag chags rang gi shes pa la bzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i bag chags rang gi shes pa la bzhag ste /
translated: The latent impressions of that are deposited in one’s own consciousness.

original: de'i sa bon langs nas phyis yul dran zhing rang gi tshig 'byung ba'o//
analyzed: de'i sa bon langs nas phyis yul dran zhing rang gi tshig 'byung ba'o//
translated: The seed of that arises, and later the object is remembered and one’s words come forth.

original: rigs pa 'dis na zhes pa ni gtan tshigs de'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis na zhes pa ni gtan tshigs de'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: This reasoning is the reason “because of that.”

original: 'di ni lung gi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni lung gi gtan tshigs so //
