translated: This is the reason of scripture.

original: sgra rnams ni sgra rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams ni sgra rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Sounds are the four types of sounds.

original: gang las byung zhe na /
analyzed: gang las byung zhe na /
translated: From what do they arise?

original: yi ge aa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: yi ge aa las byung ba ste /
translated: They arise from the syllable a.

original: mi shigs pa las skye zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi shigs pa las skye zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they arise from the indestructible.

original: aa de yang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig ce na /
analyzed: aa de yang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa zhig ce na /
translated: Is that a permanent or impermanent a?

original: mi 'gyur ba ni mi 'jig pa ste zhes pa /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba ni mi 'jig pa ste zhes pa /
translated: “Unchanging” means “indestructible.”

original: de nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis rtag pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis rtag pa ste /
translated: That is permanent in the sense of not changing into something else, such as an apprehended object or an apprehending subject.

original: btags pa'o // don dam par ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa zhes bya ba gang du yang ma grub po //
analyzed: btags pa'o // don dam par ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa zhes bya ba gang du yang ma grub po //
translated: It is imputed; ultimately, it is not established as either permanent or impermanent.

original: sgra mi bden pa ni mi rtag pa ste /🔽sgra skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir mi @257a * //
analyzed: sgra mi bden pa ni mi rtag pa ste / sgra skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir mi @257a * //
translated: An untrue sound is impermanent.

original: rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid do //
translated: Because a sound is momentary, it is impermanent.

original: des bstan pa'i don ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gang du yang ma grub po //
analyzed: des bstan pa'i don ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gang du yang ma grub po //
translated: The meaning that is taught by that is that it is not established as either permanent or impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma bcos pa thog ma tha ma med pa ste /
analyzed: ma bcos pa thog ma tha ma med pa ste /
translated: It is unfabricated and without beginning or end.

original: de dag gis dmigs pa la sogs pa dang bral zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de dag gis dmigs pa la sogs pa dang bral zhes pa ni lhag ma'o //
translated: The rest is that it is free from the observation of those.

original: de yang gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de yang gang las shes she na /
translated: From what is that known?

original: tshul gcig par bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: tshul gcig par bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs zhes sbyar te /
translated: It is connected with what is said in the Sūtra That Teaches a Single Principle.

original: chos 'di sgra skad dag gis lung bstan te zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang lam dang spang bar bya ba thams cad sgra'i tshogs kyis bstan zhing bshad ces pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'di sgra skad dag gis lung bstan te zhes pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang lam dang spang bar bya ba thams cad sgra'i tshogs kyis bstan zhing bshad ces pa'o //
translated: This dharma is taught through sounds and words means that all causes, results, paths, and things to be abandoned are taught and explained through the collection of sounds.

original: sgra dang don zhes bya ba yang ci rdzas su yod pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: sgra dang don zhes bya ba yang ci rdzas su yod pa zhig yin nam /
translated: Are the so-called sounds and meanings substantially existent?

original: 'on te ma yin zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Or are they not? They are not.

original: chos dang sgra dag 'dir ni snang mi 'gyur //
analyzed: chos dang sgra dag 'dir ni snang mi 'gyur //
translated: Dharmas and sounds do not appear here.

original: zhes pa ni don dam par brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa gnyis su med cing dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni don dam par brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa gnyis su med cing dbyer med pa'o //
translated: In the ultimate, the two—the object of expression and the expression—are nondual and inseparable.

original: 'on gnyis su med par shes pa des ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on gnyis su med par shes pa des ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the use of knowing the non-duality of those two?

original: chos nyid tshul gcig ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid tshul gcig ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The one mode of reality is non-duality,

original: shes par bya ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i yul lo //
translated: the object to be known.

original: de la 'jug par byed pa ni de rton par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug par byed pa ni de rton par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The one who engages in that is the yogi who relies on that.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by that?

original: bzod mchog bla na med la reg par 'gyur //
analyzed: bzod mchog bla na med la reg par 'gyur //
translated: One will touch the supreme, unexcelled patience.

original: zhes pa ni bzod pa gsum dang / chos kyi mchog gsum dang / rab tu dga' ba nas bcu pa ni ltos nas bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bzod pa gsum dang / chos kyi mchog gsum dang / rab tu dga' ba nas bcu pa ni ltos nas bla na med pa'o //
translated: This refers to the three patiences, the three supreme mundane qualities, and the Joyous, up to the tenth stage, which is unexcelled in dependence.

original: kun du 'od kyis ni dngos su bla na med pa ste /
analyzed: kun du 'od kyis ni dngos su bla na med pa ste /
translated: The stage of Universal Radiance is unexcelled in actuality.

original: de la reg pa ni de thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la reg pa ni de thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Touching that is attaining it.🔽Is that not interpretable in meaning?

original: de dgongs pa can ma yin nam zhe na ma yin pa'i phyir lung gzhan bshad 'dod nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dgongs pa can ma yin nam zhe na ma yin pa'i phyir lung gzhan bshad 'dod nas gsungs pa /
translated: In order to explain another scripture, he says:🔽In the tantra called the Enlightenment of Vairochana, it is said that knowledge and so forth

original: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba spyod pa'i rgyud las shes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba spyod pa'i rgyud las shes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: are the five buddhas.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa ste /
translated: The Lord of Secrets is the speaker.

original: gang gis zhus pa de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis zhus pa de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to respond to the questioner.

original: gsang sngags kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rgyu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi mtshan nyid ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rgyu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The definition of mantra is nonconceptual intuition together with its cause.

original: ye shes de nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes de nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that intuition?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ma byas pa ni ma bcings pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis ma byas pa ni ma bcings pa ste /
translated: Not made by all the Tathagatas is not bound.

original: bya ba dang byed pa la sogs pa dang bral zhe'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa la sogs pa dang bral zhe'o //
translated: It is free from action, agent, etc.

original: rjes su yi rang ba ma yin pa ni yi rang ba'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su yi rang ba ma yin pa ni yi rang ba'i yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not rejoicing is because there is no object of rejoicing.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The other terms are easy to understand.

original: de ltar ngag gi dbye ba dang rgyud dang nus pa la sogs pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar ngag gi dbye ba dang rgyud dang nus pa la sogs pa bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the divisions of speech, the tantra, the power, etc.,

original: de nas gsung rdo rje bstan te /
analyzed: de nas gsung rdo rje bstan te /
translated: then the vajra of speech is taught.

original: de'i phyir rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “perfect and imperfect,” etc.

original: 'dis ni @257b skabs 'di nyid kyi dgongs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni @257b skabs 'di nyid kyi dgongs pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the intention of this very occasion.

original: de nyid bshad pa lung gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa lung gang las shes she na /
translated: If it is asked by whom that is explained, it is known from the scriptures.

original: de'i phyir mi'am ci'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi'am ci'i rgyal pos zhus pa'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “In the Sūtra Requested by the King of the Kinnaras,” and so on.

original: mi'am ci'i bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: mi'am ci'i bdag po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: The lord of the kinnaras is the questioner.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sgra skad gang tsam las byung zhes pa ni sgra gang las byung ba mi shes nas dris pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sgra skad gang tsam las byung zhes pa ni sgra gang las byung ba mi shes nas dris pa'o //
translated: “ From what source do the sounds and voices of all sentient beings arise?” means that not knowing the source of the sound, he asks.

original: de'i lan du sems can thams cad kyi sgra skad ni nam mkha' las 'byung ngo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i lan du sems can thams cad kyi sgra skad ni nam mkha' las 'byung ngo zhes pa ste /
translated: The answer is, “The sounds and voices of all sentient beings arise from space.”

original: sgra thams cad ni rang bzhin med cing 'dus ma byas pa las byung bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sgra thams cad ni rang bzhin med cing 'dus ma byas pa las byung bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that all sounds arise from the unconditioned, which is essenceless.

original: de'i gzhi las the tshom du gyur nas dris pa //
analyzed: de'i gzhi las the tshom du gyur nas dris pa //
translated: Having doubts about that, he asks,

original: sgra skad khong pa'i nang nas mi 'byung ngam zhes pa ni lus dang sems 'dus pa'i sgra khong pa nas mi 'byung ngam zhes dris pa'o //
analyzed: sgra skad khong pa'i nang nas mi 'byung ngam zhes pa ni lus dang sems 'dus pa'i sgra khong pa nas mi 'byung ngam zhes dris pa'o //
translated: “Do sounds and voices not arise from the inside of the body?” means, “Do sounds that arise from the union of body and mind not arise from the inside?”

original: lan du / khong pa nas 'byung ngam /
analyzed: lan du / khong pa nas 'byung ngam /
translated: The answer is, “Do they arise from the inside?

original: sems las 'byung zhes dris pa ni lus sems gnyis kyi brtag pa 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: sems las 'byung zhes dris pa ni lus sems gnyis kyi brtag pa 'dri ba'o //
translated: Do they arise from the mind?” means, “Do they arise from the body or the mind?”

original: de'i lan du /
analyzed: de'i lan du /
translated: The answer is,🔽“They do not arise from the inside.”

original: lus las kyang ma yin /
analyzed: lus las kyang ma yin /
translated: It does not arise from the body,🔽nor does it arise from the mind.

original: sems las kyang ma yin no zhes pa ni lus dang sems gnyi ga las mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems las kyang ma yin no zhes pa ni lus dang sems gnyi ga las mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: This means that it does not arise from either the body or the mind.🔽Why does it not arise from either of those two?

original: de gnyi ga las mi 'byung ba'i de ci'i phyir na zhes dris pa dang / lus las mi 'byung ba'i lan gdab pa lus ni bems po ste /
analyzed: de gnyi ga las mi 'byung ba'i de ci'i phyir na zhes dris pa dang / lus las mi 'byung ba'i lan gdab pa lus ni bems po ste /
translated: The answer to that is that the body is inanimate,

original: rig pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'o //
translated: and it is not the essence of awareness.

original: sems dpa'am yin pa'i phyir g-yo ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa'am yin pa'i phyir g-yo ba med pa'o //
translated: The mind is not a mover, because it is not a substance.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pas byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ma yin pas byed pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not an agent, because it is not a cause or condition.

original: dpe bstan pa rtsa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dpe bstan pa rtsa la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: The example is like a root, etc.

original: 'o na sems ni de las bzlog par 'byung ngo zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na sems ni de las bzlog par 'byung ngo zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Well, the mind arises in the opposite way to that?

original: gang la 'phel 'grib dang / yul bstan pa dang / reg pa la sogs pa ma yin pas gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la 'phel 'grib dang / yul bstan pa dang / reg pa la sogs pa ma yin pas gzugs med pa'o //
translated: It is not, because it is not a form, since it does not increase or decrease, it is not a representation of an object, and it is not a contact, etc.

original: 'di na'o zhes med pas bstan du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di na'o zhes med pas bstan du med pa'o //
translated: It is not a representation, because it is not something that can be pointed to and said to be here.

original: go gcod pa dang sgrib pa med pas thog ma med pa'o //
analyzed: go gcod pa dang sgrib pa med pas thog ma med pa'o //
translated: It is not a beginning, because it is not something that can be obstructed or obscured.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba med pas rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba med pas rnam par rig pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not a consciousness, because it is not virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: de'i phyir sgra'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the cause of sound.🔽If neither the body nor the mind is the cause of sound, from what does sound arise?

original: de ltar lus sems gnyi ga rgyu ma yin na gang las 'byung snyam nas dris pa dang / lan du sems can rnams kyi sgra ni nam mkha' las byung bar rtogs so zhes pa ni sems can gyi ngag gi tshogs kyi sgra ni stong pa las byung zhe'o //
analyzed: de ltar lus sems gnyi ga rgyu ma yin na gang las 'byung snyam nas dris pa dang / lan du sems can rnams kyi sgra ni nam mkha' las byung bar rtogs so zhes pa ni sems can gyi ngag gi tshogs kyi sgra ni stong pa las byung zhe'o //
translated: The response is: “One should understand that the sound of sentient beings arises from space.” The sound of the collection of the speech of sentient beings arises from emptiness.🔽Moreover, if one thinks that there is a cause, if space does not exist, from what does sound arise?

original: gzhan yang rgyu yod snyam nas nam mkha' med na sgra gang las 'byung zhes dris pa dang / rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir nam mkha' ma gtogs par gzhan las sgra 'byung bar 'gyur te mi 'gyur @258a * //🔽ro zhes bya ba ste go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu yod snyam nas nam mkha' med na sgra gang las 'byung zhes dris pa dang / rgyu gzhan med pa'i phyir nam mkha' ma gtogs par gzhan las sgra 'byung bar 'gyur te mi 'gyur @258a * // ro zhes bya ba ste go sla'o //
translated: The response is: “Because there is no other cause, apart from space, sound would arise from another, but it does not.” This is easy to understand.

original: nam mkha' las sgra 'byung ba nyid kyang ci'i phyir snyam pa la /🔽nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid ni sgra ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' las sgra 'byung ba nyid kyang ci'i phyir snyam pa la / nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid ni sgra ste /
translated: Why does sound arise from space?🔽The nature of space is sound.

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni sgra'i rang bzhin zhe'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni sgra'i rang bzhin zhe'o //
translated: The nature of space is the nature of sound.

original: de nyid ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i phyir snyam pa la /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par rig ma thag tu 'gag ste mi rtag cing gzung du med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rnam par rig ma thag tu 'gag ste mi rtag cing gzung du med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is said that as soon as it is cognized, it ceases, because it is impermanent and cannot be apprehended.

original: /'gags nas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: /'gags nas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it ceases, what happens?

original: nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid du yang dag pa gnas te stong par 'gyur zhe'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid du yang dag pa gnas te stong par 'gyur zhe'o //
translated: It is said that it abides in the nature of space, becoming empty.

original: 'o na yi ge ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid yin yang gnas ma yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na yi ge ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid yin yang gnas ma yin no snyam pa la /
translated: But if a letter has the nature of space, it is not a location.

original: chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang mnyam ste nam mkha' ltar rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni nam mkha' dang mnyam ste nam mkha' ltar rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: It is said that all phenomena are equal to space, like space, without intrinsic nature.

original: rnam par rig pa med pa ni rnam par rig pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa ni rnam par rig pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The absence of cognition is free from cognition.

original: rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa ni gnyis su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of consciousness is because of nonduality.

original: 'o na sgra yang mi 'byung ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sgra yang mi 'byung ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: But then sound does not occur.

original: rang bzhin med pa yang sgra'i brdas brjod pa des ni sgra brjod pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa yang sgra'i brdas brjod pa des ni sgra brjod pa nyid de /
translated: It is said that sound is expressed by the symbolic designation of sound, which is without intrinsic nature.

original: gang gis gang brjod pa des ni sgra brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gis gang brjod pa des ni sgra brjod pa nyid do //
translated: That by which something is expressed is the expression of sound.

original: 'o na de nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But then it is not like space.

original: brjod pa de yang tha snyad de sgyu ma tsam nyid do //
analyzed: brjod pa de yang tha snyad de sgyu ma tsam nyid do //
translated: And that expression is just a mere illusion, a convention.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: brjod pa 'di 'dra bar rab tu shes pa ni sgra nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa 'di 'dra bar rab tu shes pa ni sgra nyid nam mkha' dang 'dra bar shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge that sound is like space is the knowledge that an expression such as this is just a mere illusion.

original: chos gang la yang /
analyzed: chos gang la yang /
translated: With regard to any phenomenon,

original: mngon par mi chags pa ni yul dang yul can du ma grub cing de'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par mi chags pa ni yul dang yul can du ma grub cing de'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: non-attachment is the absence of the subject-object dichotomy and the absence of its aspects.

original: ma chags pas cir 'gyur zhe na rnam par mi 'phro ste /
analyzed: ma chags pas cir 'gyur zhe na rnam par mi 'phro ste /
translated: What is the result of non-attachment? Non-diffusion.

original: yul thams cad la mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: yul thams cad la mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of grasping at all objects.

original: mi 'phro bas cir 'gyur zhe na mi 'khor te /
analyzed: mi 'phro bas cir 'gyur zhe na mi 'khor te /
translated: What is the result of non-diffusion? Non-wandering.

original: skye rga na 'chi'i sdug bsngal las grol zhe'o //
analyzed: skye rga na 'chi'i sdug bsngal las grol zhe'o //
translated: It is freedom from the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: mi 'khor bas ci 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'khor bas ci 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of non-wandering?

original: mi phyed pa ste /
analyzed: mi phyed pa ste /
translated: Non-division.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang dbyer med pa'o //
translated: It is indivisibility from nirvana.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The other [lines] are easy to understand.

original: stong pa dang gang zag tu yang bzod ces pa ni stong pa dang gang zag gi rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa dang gang zag tu yang bzod ces pa ni stong pa dang gang zag gi rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The line one is patient with emptiness and the person means being free from the aspects of emptiness and the person.

original: 'o na gang zag nyid dam de las gzhan gnas med pa zhes bya ba nyid tsam na stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na gang zag nyid dam de las gzhan gnas med pa zhes bya ba nyid tsam na stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Well then, since the person itself or what is other than that is just empty in terms of non-abiding,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: The nature of signs is signlessness,

original: gdod ma nas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdod ma nas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is empty from the beginning.

original: rmi lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyis smon pa med pa'o zhes pa ni rmi lam gyi gzugs la sogs pa dang bral ba med par ye nas bral ba nyid 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyis smon pa med pa'o zhes pa ni rmi lam gyi gzugs la sogs pa dang bral ba med par ye nas bral ba nyid 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of dreams is wishlessness is similar because it is primordially free from the absence of freedom from the forms of dreams and so on.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: 'o na chos thams cad rab tu 'byung zhing rnam par dag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'o na chos thams cad rab tu 'byung zhing rnam par dag pa nyid yin na /
translated: Well then, if all phenomena are completely pure and totally pure,

original: de lta na ni chos kyi sku thob @258b nas sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa dang / bdag la bsnyen bkur byed pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni chos kyi sku thob @258b nas sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa dang / bdag la bsnyen bkur byed pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: in that case, after attaining the dharmakāya, it would be impossible to benefit all sentient beings and to be served by them.

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa stong pa nyid yin yang don byed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa ni yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa stong pa nyid yin yang don byed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa ni yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Although all phenomena are pure and empty by nature, it is possible to benefit others and to be served and so on.

original: de yang gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de yang gang las shes she na /
translated: Moreover, from what is this known?

original: chos thams cad du 'jug pa bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad du 'jug pa bstan pa'i mdo las gsungs zhes sbyar ro //
translated: It is said in the Sūtra Teaching the Entrance into All Dharmas.

original: lha'i bu zhes pa ni yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas bos pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bu zhes pa ni yon tan brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas bos pa'o //
translated: The son of the gods is addressed with a prior expression of his good qualities.

original: sgra grags pa la 'jug pas zhugs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra grags pa la 'jug pas zhugs pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: He is engaged in the engagement in the bodhisattva conduct, because he is engaged in the engagement in the sound of fame.

original: gzhan go sla'o //🔽ngag rnam par dben pa bsdus pa la the tshom gcod pa ni rlung dang sngags dang de'i rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / gang zag gi khyad par dang / nus pa dang / las dang yon tan dang / de nyid kyi lung rgyud dang mdo dang /
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o // ngag rnam par dben pa bsdus pa la the tshom gcod pa ni rlung dang sngags dang de'i rang bzhin dang / 'bras bu dang / gang zag gi khyad par dang / nus pa dang / las dang yon tan dang / de nyid kyi lung rgyud dang mdo dang /
translated: The rest is easy to understand.🔽The elimination of doubts about the collection of the isolation of speech is for the sake of eliminating the non-establishment and doubts about the tantra, sūtra,

original: rigs pa la sogs pa ma grub pa dang / the tshom za bar gyur pa de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa la sogs pa ma grub pa dang / the tshom za bar gyur pa de rnam par bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: reasoning, and so on, of the distinctions of the vāyu, mantra, its nature, result, person, ability, function, quality, and so on.

original: gang la de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has that is called that.

original: spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma'i 'grel pa las le'u gsum pa bshad pa'o /
analyzed: spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma'i 'grel pa las le'u gsum pa bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the third chapter of the Commentary on the Lamp of the Compendium of Practice.

original: // / de nas sems rnam par dben pa la bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas sems rnam par dben pa la bslab par bya ste /
translated: Then one should train in the mind's isolation.

original: de'i phyir rdo rje slob mas gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rdo rje slob mas gsol ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, The vajra disciple requests...

original: sems rnam par dben pa la slob par 'tshal na zhes pa ni sems yongs su dag pa dang / dngos po sems tsam du byed par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dben pa la slob par 'tshal na zhes pa ni sems yongs su dag pa dang / dngos po sems tsam du byed par 'dod pa'o //
translated: If one wishes to train in the mind's isolation, one should purify the mind and make things just mind.

original: zab mo la lhag par mos pa ni bsgom pa la mchog tu gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: zab mo la lhag par mos pa ni bsgom pa la mchog tu gzhol ba'o //
translated: Deeply devoted means being intent on meditation.

original: de la gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of devotion:

original: de kho na nyid la gzhol ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa la gzhol ba las 'dir ni dang po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la gzhol ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa la gzhol ba las 'dir ni dang po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: devotion to reality and devotion to realization. Here, it is from the perspective of the former.

original: de la phan par bya ba ni des mchog gi dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir zhe'o //
analyzed: de la phan par bya ba ni des mchog gi dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir zhe'o //
translated: For the sake of benefiting that... means for the sake of attaining the supreme attainment.

original: rdo rje slob dpon ston pas bshad du gsol //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon ston pas bshad du gsol //
translated: The vajra master teacher should explain.

original: zhes pa ni bdag cag gi sems kyi som nyi bsal du gsol zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdag cag gi sems kyi som nyi bsal du gsol zhe'o //
translated: This means, Please remove the doubts of our minds.

original: de skad ces dris pa dang / lan btab pa /
analyzed: de skad ces dris pa dang / lan btab pa /
translated: Having asked this, the reply is:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi man ngag ni nus pa khyad par can gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi man ngag ni nus pa khyad par can gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The instruction of all the Tathagatas is so called because it has a special power.🔽It is not the domain of those who look outward is said because one might think that this is the common domain of all persons.

original: de nyid gang zag thams cad kyi thun mong gi spyod yul yin nam snyam pa la kha phyir bltas pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa zhes pa ni kha phyir bltas pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de nyid gang zag thams cad kyi thun mong gi spyod yul yin nam snyam pa la kha phyir bltas pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa zhes pa ni kha phyir bltas pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Those who look outward are of two kinds:

original: spyi'i dbang du byas pa dang / bye brag gi dbang du byas pa'o//
analyzed: spyi'i dbang du byas pa dang / bye brag gi dbang du byas pa'o//
translated: those who look outward in general and those who look outward in particular.

original: @259a * // de la spyi'i dbang du byas pa ni phyi rol mu stegs pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa dang zhe 'gras pa /
analyzed: @259a * // de la spyi'i dbang du byas pa ni phyi rol mu stegs pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa dang zhe 'gras pa /
translated: Those who look outward in general are those who are hostile to the Buddha's teaching, the non-Buddhists.

original: log pa'i bdud kyis bslus pa /
analyzed: log pa'i bdud kyis bslus pa /
translated: They are deceived by false demons.

original: dam pa ma yin pa bsten pa /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa bsten pa /
translated: They rely on the unholy.

original: dam pa yang dag par spong ba ste /
analyzed: dam pa yang dag par spong ba ste /
translated: They abandon the holy.

original: de'i yang yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i yang yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not their domain.

original: bye brag gi dbang du byas pa ni 'phags pa nyin thos dang / rang rgyal ba dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bye brag gi dbang du byas pa ni 'phags pa nyin thos dang / rang rgyal ba dang / sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa'i yang ma yin no //
translated: Those who look outward in particular are the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and those who abide in the stages and perfections.

original: de bas na gsang ba 'dus pa spangs pa'i bya ba'i rgyud dang / spyod pa'i rgyud dang / gnyi ga'i rgyud dang / bla na med pa'i rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gsang ba 'dus pa spangs pa'i bya ba'i rgyud dang / spyod pa'i rgyud dang / gnyi ga'i rgyud dang / bla na med pa'i rgyud gzhan la gnas pa'i yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not in the Action Tantras, the Performance Tantras, the Yoga Tantras, or the Unsurpassed Yoga Tantras, which are other than the Guhyasamaja.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag ni 'di'i rigs can ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni 'di'i rigs can ma yin te /
translated: Because they are not of its class.

original: gang rigs can ma yin pa de ni 'di la 'jug par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang rigs can ma yin pa de ni 'di la 'jug par mi byed do //
translated: That which is not of its class does not enter into it.

original: gang ma zhugs pa des ni nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang ma zhugs pa des ni nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which does not enter into it does not abandon the afflictions.

original: gang gi nyon mongs pa spangs pa de ni 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis thob par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang gi nyon mongs pa spangs pa de ni 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis thob par mi byed do //
translated: That which does not abandon the afflictions does not attain the two fruits.

original: de bas na de dag kyang phyir bltas pa yin no //🔽'o na dge slong dag pa gang zhig gis //
analyzed: de bas na de dag kyang phyir bltas pa yin no // 'o na dge slong dag pa gang zhig gis //
translated: Therefore, they are also called “retrogressive”.

original: gsang ba mchog ni spyad par bya //
analyzed: gsang ba mchog ni spyad par bya //
translated: “But, monks, which one should practice the supreme secret?”

original: zhes bya ba ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ci zhig ce na /
translated: What does that mean?

original: de ni dge slong gi bslab pa dang bral bsam yin gyis /
analyzed: de ni dge slong gi bslab pa dang bral bsam yin gyis /
translated: It means that one who is free from the training of a monk.

original: dge slong gi bslab pa la gnas pa des 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi bslab pa la gnas pa des 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is accomplished by one who is established in the training of a monk.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de ni gzhi dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //🔽'o na dge slong gi bslab pa la mi gnas pa'i gang zag gis mchog 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ni gzhi dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro // 'o na dge slong gi bslab pa la mi gnas pa'i gang zag gis mchog 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because it is not separate from the basis.

original: dge slong gi bslab pa la gnas pas ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gi bslab pa la gnas pas ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But it is said that a person who does not observe the precepts of a bhikshu will attain the highest goal, but one who does observe them will not.

original: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnyis te /
translated: This is not so, because there are two kinds of non-observation:

original: spangs nas mi gnas pa dang skyes nas mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: spangs nas mi gnas pa dang skyes nas mi gnas pa'o //
translated: non-observation after abandoning and non-observation after arising.

original: de la spangs nas mi gnas pa ni dper na lha sbyin grong khyer dang bral na grong khyer na mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la spangs nas mi gnas pa ni dper na lha sbyin grong khyer dang bral na grong khyer na mi gnas pa ste /
translated: Non-observation after abandoning is like Devadatta, who is not observed in the city after he has left it.

original: de lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case.

original: 'di ni skyes nas mi gnas pa ste skyes bu bong tshad khru gang la gnas pa ma yin zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni skyes nas mi gnas pa ste skyes bu bong tshad khru gang la gnas pa ma yin zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Non-observation after arising is like saying that a person who is one cubit tall is not observed.

original: de bas na 'di ni bogs phyung ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni bogs phyung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is an improvement.

original: mi gnas zhes bya ba 'di yang sgra bye brag med pa yin te /
analyzed: mi gnas zhes bya ba 'di yang sgra bye brag med pa yin te /
translated: This non-observation is not a different word.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal la /
translated: The Bhagavan said:

original: rigs kyi bu mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgra bye drag med pa ste gnas skabs kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sgra bye drag med pa ste gnas skabs kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: Son of good family, “non-abiding” means not being a loud-mouthed braggart, and should be understood in terms of the situation.

original: gnas skabs kyang gang du bya zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyang gang du bya zhe na /
translated: In what situation?

original: 'di ltar dge ba'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba spangs nas mi gnas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba spangs nas mi gnas /
translated: Thus, in a virtuous situation, one does not abide having abandoned non-virtue.

original: dge ba sogs phyung ste mi gnas so //
analyzed: dge ba sogs phyung ste mi gnas so //
translated: One does not abide having cast out virtue, etc.

original: mi dge @259b ba'i gnas skabs su ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge @259b ba'i gnas skabs su ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: In a non-virtuous situation, it is the opposite of that.

original: gang de la phan pa ni theg pa chen po gsang ba 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: gang de la phan pa ni theg pa chen po gsang ba 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: That which is beneficial is the yoga of the Guhyasamāja of the Great Vehicle.

original: yul ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: yul ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i rigs so //
translated: The non-object is the other types.

original: de bas na gsang ba 'dus pas ni thams cad grol na thabs gzhan yang don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gsang ba 'dus pas ni thams cad grol na thabs gzhan yang don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if all are liberated by the Guhyasamāja, other methods would be pointless.

original: shin tu zab pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu zab pa ni rtogs par dka' ba'o //
translated: Very profound means difficult to realize.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ni sangs rgyas kyis mkhyen pa'i yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi spyod yul ni sangs rgyas kyis mkhyen pa'i yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: The domain of the buddhas is the object of knowledge of the buddhas.

original: de gang yin zhe na sems te /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na sems te /
translated: What is that? It is the mind.

original: don la sems pa dang sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don la sems pa dang sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the meaning, it is the mind, and because it is various, it is the mind.

original: sems de yang mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sems de yang mtshan nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of that mind?

original: gnas med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
analyzed: gnas med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te go sla'o //
translated: It is taught by “without abode,” and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: de nyid gang las gsungs she na /
analyzed: de nyid gang las gsungs she na /
translated: From what is that taught?

original: rgyud thams cad bstan pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad bstan pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: It is taught by “the teaching of all tantras.”

original: 'o na sems kyi mtshan nyid de'ang gang la bstan nas shes par bya zhe na /🔽rdo rje theg pa la gnas nas //
analyzed: 'o na sems kyi mtshan nyid de'ang gang la bstan nas shes par bya zhe na / rdo rje theg pa la gnas nas //
translated: Well, by what is that characteristic of mind taught, so that it can be known?🔽It is taught by “abiding in the Vajra Vehicle,” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'dod pa zhes pa la rdo rje theg pa ni shes rab dang snying rje khyad par can nyid lam du bshad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'dod pa zhes pa la rdo rje theg pa ni shes rab dang snying rje khyad par can nyid lam du bshad do //
translated: The Vajra Vehicle is explained as the path of special wisdom and compassion.

original: de la gnas pa ni sgrub pa po nyid do //
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni sgrub pa po nyid do //
translated: Abiding in that is the practitioner himself.

original: des thob par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: des thob par bya ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is to be attained by him?

original: 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid de /
analyzed: 'bras bu sangs rgyas nyid de /
translated: The result, buddhahood.

original: zag bcas dang zag med kyi sa bon spangs pa dang rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: zag bcas dang zag med kyi sa bon spangs pa dang rgyas pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: Buddhahood is the abandonment and expansion of the seeds of the contaminated and the uncontaminated.

original: thob par 'dod pa ni rag las pa ni rag las pa'i tshul gyis 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: thob par 'dod pa ni rag las pa ni rag las pa'i tshul gyis 'brel pa'o //
translated: Desiring to attain it is the connection by the mode of dependence.

original: des gang la brten zhe na /
analyzed: des gang la brten zhe na /
translated: By what is that attained?

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bla ma dam pa la brten zhing bla ma mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bla ma dam pa la brten zhing bla ma mnyes par bya'o //
translated: Rely on the holy spiritual friend, the guru, and please the guru.

original: bla ma las kyang ci btsal zhe na /
analyzed: bla ma las kyang ci btsal zhe na /
translated: What is sought from the guru?

original: rang gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi sems kyi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The nature of one's own mind.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin bla ma la brten nas shes par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin bla ma la brten nas shes par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: The nature of mind is to be known in dependence on the guru.

original: bla mas kyang gang la brten zhe na /
analyzed: bla mas kyang gang la brten zhe na /
translated: On what does the guru rely?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la brten nas shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la brten nas shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, he says, as the Lord has said...

original: rigs kyi bu zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: Son of noble lineage is a salutation.

original: mnyam par gzhag pas rang gi sems so sor rtogs shig ces pa ni legs par lung bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas rang gi sems so sor rtogs shig ces pa ni legs par lung bstan pa ste /
translated: Meditate and understand your own mind is the excellent prophecy.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: Meditate is to cultivate.

original: des rang gi sems so sor rtogs shig ces pa ni sems ji lta bu yin pa shes par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: des rang gi sems so sor rtogs shig ces pa ni sems ji lta bu yin pa shes par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Understand your own mind is to know what the mind is like.

original: de nyid gang la brten nas rtag snyam pa la /
analyzed: de nyid gang la brten nas rtag snyam pa la /
translated: On what is that to be relied?

original: dpal rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpal rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The glorious Vairocana, etc.

original: byang chub ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o//
analyzed: byang chub ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o//
translated: Enlightenment is the ultimate truth.

original: @260a * // de nyid gang yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: @260a * // de nyid gang yin snyam pa la /
translated: What is that?

original: rang gi sems yang dag pa lta ba bzhin du yongs su zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems yang dag pa lta ba bzhin du yongs su zhes pa ste /
translated: One's own mind, as it is, is thoroughly purified.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause and effect are not perceived, etc.

original: 'o na sems de yang gcig gam du ma zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sems de yang gcig gam du ma zhe na /
translated: Well, is that mind one or many?

original: gcig pa ste de gang las shes she na /
analyzed: gcig pa ste de gang las shes she na /
translated: It is one. How is that known?

original: sde snod gsum gyi tshul las zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sde snod gsum gyi tshul las zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The three baskets, etc.

original: gcig pu 'gro zhing ring du rgyu //
analyzed: gcig pu 'gro zhing ring du rgyu //
translated: It goes alone, and goes far.

original: zhes pa ni sems ni gcig pu yin te bgrang ba'i rdzas dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems ni gcig pu yin te bgrang ba'i rdzas dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is one, because it is free from the substance of enumeration.

original: de skad cig kyang gnas par mi byed pas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de skad cig kyang gnas par mi byed pas 'gro ba'o //
translated: Since it does not remain even for a moment, it goes.

original: gang du zhe na ring du ste /
analyzed: gang du zhe na ring du ste /
translated: Where does it go? Far.

original: nyi ma bdun gyi lam yang skad cig tsam gyis phyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyi ma bdun gyi lam yang skad cig tsam gyis phyin par byed pa ste /
translated: It goes even to the path of the seven suns in an instant.

original: de'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called that.

original: gang na gang gnas shes /
analyzed: gang na gang gnas shes /
translated: Where does it abide?

original: lus kyi phug ni snying gi dbus su'o //
analyzed: lus kyi phug ni snying gi dbus su'o //
translated: The interior of the body is the middle of the heart.

original: lus med dbang po ni rang gi sems te /
analyzed: lus med dbang po ni rang gi sems te /
translated: The bodiless sense is one's own mind.

original: thams cad la dbang byed pa nyid dang / bstan du med pa nyid dang / thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad la dbang byed pa nyid dang / bstan du med pa nyid dang / thogs pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yang ngo //
translated: It is also because it is the ruler of all, because it is invisible, and because it is unobstructing.

original: gdul bar dka' ba'i sems kyang de nyid de /
analyzed: gdul bar dka' ba'i sems kyang de nyid de /
translated: That very mind is difficult to subdue,

original: ri gzar po'i chu bzhin no //
analyzed: ri gzar po'i chu bzhin no //
translated: like a mountain torrent.

original: de gang gis 'dul zhe na /
analyzed: de gang gis 'dul zhe na /
translated: By what is it subdued?

original: yang dag pa'i chos dge ba'i phyogs su gtogs pas 'dul bar byed do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos dge ba'i phyogs su gtogs pas 'dul bar byed do //
translated: It is subdued by the true Dharma, which is included in the category of virtue.

original: btul nas cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: btul nas cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens when it is subdued?

original: bdud kyi bcings las grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdud kyi bcings las grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: One is freed from the bondage of Mara.

original: phung po'i bdud dang 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa las grol zhing chos kyi sku yang myur du thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: phung po'i bdud dang 'chi bdag gi bdud la sogs pa las grol zhing chos kyi sku yang myur du thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: One is freed from the Mara of the aggregates, the Mara of the Lord of Death, and so on, and one quickly attains the Dharma Body. This is the intended meaning.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te gong ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir te gong ma dang 'brel to //
translated: Therefore means for that reason, and is connected to what precedes it.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed pa 'dod pas shes pa ni chos kyi sku thob par 'dod pas zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed pa 'dod pas shes pa ni chos kyi sku thob par 'dod pas zhes sbyar ro //
translated: One should understand by one who desires to attain the Dharma Body as by one who desires to manifest the meditative concentration which is like an illusion.

original: ci byed ce na /
analyzed: ci byed ce na /
translated: What does one do?

original: g-yeng dbang sgrib pa thams cad spangs te zhes pa ni 'du 'dzi dang / rtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ste zhe'o //
analyzed: g-yeng dbang sgrib pa thams cad spangs te zhes pa ni 'du 'dzi dang / rtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa ste zhe'o //
translated: One should understand having abandoned all obscurations and distractions as having abandoned all the obscurations of social interactions, conceptual thoughts, afflictions, and objects of knowledge.

original: des kyang chog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des kyang chog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because that is not sufficient,

original: rdo rje slob dpon mnyes par byas te zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra ba'i slob dpon yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon mnyes par byas te zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang 'dra ba'i slob dpon yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: one should understand having pleased the vajra master as having pleased the master who is like Vajrasattva,

original: yang na rdo rje dang 'dra bar slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje dang 'dra bar slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or as having pleased the vajra-like master.

original: de mchod pas ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de mchod pas ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it necessary to please him?

original: shin tu drin che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu drin che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is extremely kind.

original: drin yang gang zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: drin yang gang zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is his kindness?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi man ngag yang dag pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi man ngag yang dag pa thob pa ste /
translated: He is the one who has obtained the instructions of all the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i man ngag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thob pa'i thabs kyi man ngag go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i man ngag ni de bzhin gshegs pa thob pa'i thabs kyi man ngag go //
translated: The instruction of the Tathagata is the instruction of the means of attaining the Tathagata.

original: de thob par byed pa ni @260b rdo rje slob dpon no //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa ni @260b rdo rje slob dpon no //
translated: The one who causes that attainment is the Vajra Master.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gyis kyang gang gi rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gyis kyang gang gi rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par byed ce na /
translated: And following whom does the Vajra Master understand?

original: dpal ye shes rdo rje kun las btus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dpal ye shes rdo rje kun las btus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, The glorious Wisdom Vajra Compendium, and so on.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud ni bshad pa'i rgyud de rtsa ba'i rgyud ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud ni bshad pa'i rgyud de rtsa ba'i rgyud ni ma yin no //
translated: The explanatory tantra is the explanatory tantra, not the root tantra.

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs pa ni de las rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs pa ni de las rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Following that, he understands it from that.

original: gang rtogs par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang rtogs par byed ce na /
translated: What does he understand?

original: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the three consciousnesses.

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin la sogs pa rtogs par byed ce'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin la sogs pa rtogs par byed ce'o //
translated: He understands the nature of appearance and so on.

original: de yang rgyas par ni lang kar gshegs pa las bstan pas de la 'jug par bya ste /🔽blo gros chen po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyas par ni lang kar gshegs pa las bstan pas de la 'jug par bya ste / blo gros chen po zhes pa ni bod pa'o //
translated: Moreover, since that is taught extensively in the Lanka Descent Sutra, one should enter there.🔽Great Mind is Tibetan.

original: sems la rtog pa po gang zhig snyam pa la /
analyzed: sems la rtog pa po gang zhig snyam pa la /
translated: The one who thinks about the mind is what is meant.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes smos so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes smos so //
translated: The bodhisattva is mentioned.

original: des kyang su'i sems la brtags par bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: des kyang su'i sems la brtags par bya snyam pa la /
translated: One may wonder, By whom is the mind to be examined?

original: rang gi sems zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said, of oneself.

original: rang gi ji lta ba bzhin la yang da ltar ro //
analyzed: rang gi ji lta ba bzhin la yang da ltar ro //
translated: One's own is just as it is, and it is also present.

original: ji lta brtags nas shes par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ji lta brtags nas shes par 'dod ce na /
translated: Having examined it, how does one wish to know?

original: gzung ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: gzung ba'i yul lo //
translated: The object to be grasped is the external.

original: 'dzin pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind to be grasped is the internal.

original: dkar po la sogs pa 'di yang sems kyi las so //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa 'di yang sems kyi las so //
translated: This white, etc. is also the activity of the mind.

original: de shes par 'dod pa ni khong du chud par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de shes par 'dod pa ni khong du chud par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The wish to know it is the wish to understand it.

original: ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be done?

original: spang bar bya ba spangs pas mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba spangs pas mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is seen by abandoning what is to be abandoned.

original: spang bar bya ba'ang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'ang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is to be abandoned?

original: 'du 'dzi'i tshogs ni phyi rol gyi g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i tshogs ni phyi rol gyi g-yeng ba'o //
translated: The multitude of distractions is external distraction.

original: gnyid ni 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid ni 'jug pa rang dbang med par sems sdud pa'o //
translated: Sleep is the involuntary withdrawal of the mind.

original: sgrib pa ni nyon mongs dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: sgrib pa ni nyon mongs dang shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: Obscuration is the obscuration of afflictions and the obscuration of the knowable,

original: thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa la sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa la sgrib pa'o //
translated: which obscures liberation and nirvana.

original: de med par bya ba ni spang bar bya /
analyzed: de med par bya ba ni spang bar bya /
translated: That which is to be made non-existent is to be abandoned.

original: sems zhes bya ba yang du zhig ce na /
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba yang du zhig ce na /
translated: How many kinds of mind are there?

original: rnam par shes pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of consciousness:

original: snang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the consciousness of appearance, etc.

original: de yang rgyu'am 'bras bu'i de nyid gang yin pa mi shes so zhe na /
analyzed: de yang rgyu'am 'bras bu'i de nyid gang yin pa mi shes so zhe na /
translated: Moreover, it is not known what is the reality of cause or effect.

original: mtho ris zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mtho ris zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse says, “heaven, etc.”

original: sa 'og dang sa steng la sogs pa yang sems kyi snang ba yin pas rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'og dang sa steng la sogs pa yang sems kyi snang ba yin pas rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: The lower and upper regions, etc. are also the appearance of mind, and so are the cause.

original: sems de yang dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dus na mya ngan las 'das par yang snang ngo //
analyzed: sems de yang dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dus na mya ngan las 'das par yang snang ngo //
translated: Moreover, that mind, when associated with virtue, appears as nirvana.

original: mi dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dus na 'khor ba yang snang ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dus na 'khor ba yang snang ste /
translated: When associated with non-virtue, it appears as samsara.

original: dper na me long gi gzugs bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me long gi gzugs bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a reflection in a mirror.

original: rgyu ba ni bcud kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: rgyu ba ni bcud kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The moving is the world of beings.

original: mi rgyu ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: mi rgyu ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: The unmoving is the world of the vessel.

original: gzung ba ni yul te gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba ni yul te gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object is the apprehended, i.e., form, etc.

original: de la 'dzin pa sems te mig gi rnam shes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa sems te mig gi rnam shes la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind is the apprehender, i.e., eye-consciousness, etc.

original: @261a * // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar te /
analyzed: @261a * // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar te /
translated: The twelve members of dependent origination are from ignorance up to old age and death.

original: shing rta'i 'khor lo bzhin 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing rta'i 'khor lo bzhin 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called members because they are parts of cyclic existence, like the parts of a wheel.

original: dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba ni dad pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The virtuous are faith and so on.

original: bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called virtuous because they are the causes of happiness.

original: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa ste /
translated: The nonvirtuous are attachment and so on.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called nonvirtuous because they are the causes of suffering.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The other members are easy to understand.

original: de dag kyang sems las byung bas sems rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems las byung bas sems rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: Since they are mental factors, they are caused by the mind.

original: de yang sems las tha dad pa'am gcig pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang sems las tha dad pa'am gcig pa yin zhe na /
translated: Is the mind different from or the same as mental factors?

original: gnyis pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i rnam pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not the second because it is not a form.

original: bzang skyong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bzang skyong zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Bhadrapāla and so on say:

original: 'khor ni ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du ste /
analyzed: 'khor ni ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar du ste /
translated: The retinue is from ignorance up to old age and death.

original: 'khrul pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i stobs kyis 'khor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called retinue because they are the parts of cyclic existence, like the parts of a wheel.

original: las de las gzugs can ma yin pa ni bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las de las gzugs can ma yin pa ni bstan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From that karma, the nonphysical are not demonstrated because they are not form.

original: 'o na sa bon gang las byung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sa bon gang las byung zhe na /
translated: Well then, from what seed do they arise?

original: rnam par shes pa las mngon par grub pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las mngon par grub pa ste /
translated: It is established from consciousness.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ni med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu ni med do //
translated: There is no other cause than that.

original: de ni spyir bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni spyir bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the general teaching.

original: khyad par gyi dbang du byas te bshad pa /
analyzed: khyad par gyi dbang du byas te bshad pa /
translated: The specific teaching is as follows:

original: lus kyi 'khrul 'khor ni lus kyi skye ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'khrul 'khor ni lus kyi skye ba'o //
translated: The body machine is the birth of the body.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams ni dmigs pa rnam par rig pa dang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness element is the awareness of the object and the absence of activity.

original: lus sna tshogs la 'jug pa ni lus thams cad skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus sna tshogs la 'jug pa ni lus thams cad skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The entry into various bodies is the production of all bodies.

original: 'o na de nyid byed pa por 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid byed pa por 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Well then, it would be the agent.🔽This consciousness element is the agent because it produces the body.

original: rnam par shas pa'i khams 'di ni lus skyed par byed pa'i phyir byed pa po yang yin no zhes pa ni lus bskyed pa'i gtan tshigs 'dis byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shas pa'i khams 'di ni lus skyed par byed pa'i phyir byed pa po yang yin no zhes pa ni lus bskyed pa'i gtan tshigs 'dis byed pa po yin te /
translated: It is the agent by this reason of producing the body.

original: bdag dang 'dra ba ni med do //
analyzed: bdag dang 'dra ba ni med do //
translated: There is no self like it.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs can ma yin pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang ther zugs ma yin pa nyid dang gcig ma yin pa nyid dang / du ma ma yin pa nyid kyi'ang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa nyid dang / mi rtag pa nyid dang ther zugs ma yin pa nyid dang gcig ma yin pa nyid dang / du ma ma yin pa nyid kyi'ang phyir ro //
translated: because it is not material, because it is impermanent, because it is not eternal, because it is not unitary, and because it is not multiple.

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa 'di gang la brten zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa 'di gang la brten zhe na /
translated: On what does this consciousness rest?

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni chos kyi dbyings la brten te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni chos kyi dbyings la brten te /
translated: This consciousness element rests on the dharma-dhātu,

original: gang rnam par dag cing mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / de las 'byung ba dang / de la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang rnam par dag cing mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / de las 'byung ba dang / de la 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is pure and non-abiding, and because it arises from that and enters into it.

original: de'i phyir mi zad pa ni khams gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi zad pa ni khams gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is inexhaustible, because it is distinguished from the other elements.

original: rnam par shes pa yang blo ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang blo ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of understanding is this consciousness?

original: blo phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: blo phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: It is perfect understanding,

original: blo mchog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: blo mchog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: it is endowed with the highest understanding.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sngon gyi lus kyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon gyi lus kyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it remembers the former abodes of the body,

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa yin @261b pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i shes pa yin @261b pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the knowledge that remembers former abodes.

original: de'i dpe bstan pa rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: de'i dpe bstan pa rnam par shes pa'i khams 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The example of that is taught beginning with “This consciousness element,” and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: de nas rnam par shes pas lus ji ltar len pa mi shes nas dris pa /
analyzed: de nas rnam par shes pas lus ji ltar len pa mi shes nas dris pa /
translated: Then, not knowing how consciousness takes up the body, he asked:

original: rnam par shes pa lus las 'pho ba de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu lags zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa lus yang dang yang du len pa ji ltar len zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lus las 'pho ba de'i rang bzhin ji lta bu lags zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa lus yang dang yang du len pa ji ltar len zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “What is the nature of consciousness when it departs from the body?” This means, “How does consciousness take up the body again and again?”

original: de'i len du ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas dman pa'i lus len to //
analyzed: de'i len du ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas dman pa'i lus len to //
translated: In response to that, it is said that it takes up an inferior body through being concomitant with ignorance.

original: shes rab mchog dang mtshungs par ldan pas mchog gi lus len to zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
analyzed: shes rab mchog dang mtshungs par ldan pas mchog gi lus len to zhes bya ba ni lhag ma'o //
translated: It takes up a superior body through being concomitant with supreme wisdom. The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa de sus bstan par nus she na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa de sus bstan par nus she na /
translated: Well then, who is able to teach that consciousness?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan par bya ba yin te zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa 'di ni shes rab mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'o zhes pa dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan par bya ba yin te zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa 'di ni shes rab mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'o zhes pa dang / rnam par shes pa 'di ni gzhan gyi yul ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “it is taught by the Tathāgata” means that this consciousness is taught by the Tathāgata because it is endowed with supreme wisdom.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'o zhe'o //
translated: This consciousness is taught by the Tathāgata because it is not the domain of others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan dgos pa ci'i phyir snyam pa la /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan med do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bstan dgos pa ci'i phyir snyam pa la / de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs pa gzhan med do zhes pa ni /
translated: Why is it necessary for the Tathāgata to teach it?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs par rnam par shes ba ston pa gzhan gyis ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma gtogs par rnam par shes ba ston pa gzhan gyis ni mi nus so //
translated: The phrase “there is no one other than the Tathāgata” means that no one other than the Tathāgata is able to teach this consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa ma bstan pa de'i tshe ni rnam par shes pa shes par mi 'gyur ro //🔽rnam par shes pa ma shes pa de'i tshe ni chos thams cad mi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa ma bstan pa de'i tshe ni rnam par shes pa shes par mi 'gyur ro // rnam par shes pa ma shes pa de'i tshe ni chos thams cad mi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When consciousness is not taught, consciousness is not known.🔽When consciousness is not known, all dharmas are not known.

original: chos thams cad mi shes pa de'i tshe ni bsgom pa yang med /
analyzed: chos thams cad mi shes pa de'i tshe ni bsgom pa yang med /
translated: When all dharmas are not known, there is no cultivation.

original: spang ba yang med /
analyzed: spang ba yang med /
translated: There is nothing to be abandoned,

original: 'bras bu thob pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa yang med do //
translated: and there is no attainment of a result.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu sman chen ni skabs 'dir sdud pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu gzhon nu sman chen ni skabs 'dir sdud pa'o //
translated: The young prince Mahāmaudgalyāyana is included here.

original: tshe rabs lnga brgya'i zhes bya ba 'dis ni log par rtog pa po dang / log par rtog pa'i dus dang / gang la log par rtog pa spong ba dang / ji ltar rtog pa dang / spong ba'i dus la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshe rabs lnga brgya'i zhes bya ba 'dis ni log par rtog pa po dang / log par rtog pa'i dus dang / gang la log par rtog pa spong ba dang / ji ltar rtog pa dang / spong ba'i dus la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: This passage from “in five hundred lifetimes” up to “he did not know” teaches the one who has wrong views, the time of wrong views, what is to be abandoned through wrong views, how to view, the time of abandonment, and so on.

original: de la rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang mi shes nas dris pa dang / len du sa bon gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba yang mi shes nas dris pa dang / len du sa bon gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therein, since he did not know what is called consciousness, he asked, and it was said, “The seed of the consciousness” and so on.

original: sems kyi sa bon gyi myu gu skyed pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sems kyi sa bon gyi myu gu skyed pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The arising of the sprout of the seed of the mind is easy to understand.

original: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa shes pa zhes bya snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa shes pa zhes bya snyam pa la /
translated: Why is it called consciousness?

original: dge ba'i las kyang rab tu shes so zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyang rab tu shes so zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, “It also knows virtuous karma,” and so on.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de nas rnam @262a * //
analyzed: de nas rnam @262a * //
translated: Then, consciousness

original: par shes pa'i dbye ba rgyas par mi shes nas dris pa dang ; len du rnam par shes pa ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba'o zhes pa ni don dam pa rgyu yin par bstan to //
analyzed: par shes pa'i dbye ba rgyas par mi shes nas dris pa dang ; len du rnam par shes pa ni 'od gsal ba las byung ba'o zhes pa ni don dam pa rgyu yin par bstan to //
translated: Not knowing the extensive classification of consciousness, he asked, and the answer was, “Consciousness arises from clear light,” which teaches the ultimate cause.

original: de nyid ni sems dang yid ces bya ste zhes pa ni sems 'di'i rnam grangs bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid ni sems dang yid ces bya ste zhes pa ni sems 'di'i rnam grangs bstan to //
translated: “That itself is called mind and thought” teaches the synonyms of this mind.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'khor ba'i chos so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni 'khor ba'i chos so //
translated: “Afflicted” is the phenomena of saṃsāra.

original: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos so //
translated: “Purified” is the phenomena of nirvāṇa.

original: de'i rtsa ba can ni de'i rgyu can te /
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba can ni de'i rgyu can te /
translated: “Having that as its root” means having that as its cause.

original: 'dis ni sa bon thams cad la bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sa bon thams cad la bstan to //
translated: This teaches all seeds.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa 'dis gzhan thams cad bskyed do zhe'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa 'dis gzhan thams cad bskyed do zhe'o //
translated: Therefore this consciousness produces all others.

original: de las bdag dang gzhan du rtog pa rnam pa gnyis 'byung zhes pa ni sa bon bslang ba'i stobs kyis bdag dang bdag gi gsang ba phra mo zhes rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las bdag dang gzhan du rtog pa rnam pa gnyis 'byung zhes pa ni sa bon bslang ba'i stobs kyis bdag dang bdag gi gsang ba phra mo zhes rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: “From that, the two types of conception of self and other arise” means that by the power of arousing the seeds, the subtle secrets of self and mine are conceived.

original: rnam par shes pa de zhes pa ni bzhon pa byed de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de zhes pa ni bzhon pa byed de /
translated: “That consciousness” is the mount.

original: gang la zhon zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhon zhe na /
translated: What does it ride on?

original: rlung la zhon te dbang po'i lam du zhugs par byed do //
analyzed: rlung la zhon te dbang po'i lam du zhugs par byed do //
translated: It rides on the wind, and enters the path of the sense organs.

original: rlung las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rlung las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does the wind do?

original: me de drod du 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: me de drod du 'bar ba'o //
translated: The fire blazes with heat.

original: de 'dus pa las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de 'dus pa las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens from their combination?

original: 'du ba'i bdag nyid chu'o //
analyzed: 'du ba'i bdag nyid chu'o //
translated: The nature of their combination is water.🔽What does that do?

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na brten par bya ba'i bdag nyid sla'o //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na brten par bya ba'i bdag nyid sla'o //
translated: It has the nature of supporting.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens from that?

original: phung po lnga dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It says, “the five aggregates, etc.”

original: de nas sems las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa gsum zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sems las byung ba ni rnam par shes pa gsum zhes pa ni snang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, from the mind, the three consciousnesses arise, which are the visual consciousness, etc.

original: yongs su gsal bar nyams su myong ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar nyams su myong ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The experience of the complete manifestation is form, etc.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens from that?

original: rang bzhin rnams 'byung zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnams 'byung zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It says, “the natures arise,” which means the natures of desire, etc. arise.🔽What is that reality?

original: de nyid gang yin pa dang / dang por rnam grangs mi shes pas /
analyzed: de nyid gang yin pa dang / dang por rnam grangs mi shes pas /
translated: Since one does not know the enumeration at the beginning,

original: de'i log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir dris pa dang / lan du bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba 'dis ni gsungs pa po bstan to //
analyzed: de'i log par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir dris pa dang / lan du bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba 'dis ni gsungs pa po bstan to //
translated: In order to dispel his misconception, the question is asked, and in reply the Blessed One...

original: shes rab dang thabs ni skyes pa dang bud med de shugs kyis ma ning yang nye bar mtshon pa'am bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs ni skyes pa dang bud med de shugs kyis ma ning yang nye bar mtshon pa'am bstan pa yin la /
translated: Wisdom and means are male and female, and by implication, the neuter is also indicated or shown.

original: nye bar thob pa ni gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar thob pa ni gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: The attainment is not clear.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de la snang ba la sogs pa rnam grangs bstan nas /
analyzed: de la snang ba la sogs pa rnam grangs bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the synonyms such as appearance there,🔽the question is asked, What are the characteristics of those?

original: de nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang dang gang zhes dris pa dang / lan du bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang dang gang zhes dris pa dang / lan du bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The reply is, The Blessed One said...

original: sems ni snang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: sems ni snang ba gsum mo //
translated: The mind is the three appearances.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs dang bral ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs med pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs dang bral ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs med pa'o //
translated: Free from color and shape is without color and shape.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can ni dpe @262b 'god pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can ni dpe @262b 'god pa'o //
translated: Having the characteristic of space is the example.🔽Free from conceptuality like space is the teaching.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o zhes pa dang / yang zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o zhes pa dang / yang zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Again is the summary.

original: snang ba'i mtshan nyid sems gsum gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba'i mtshan nyid sems gsum gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of appearance is the characteristic of the three minds.

original: rjes su myong ba ni phyis myong ba ste /
analyzed: rjes su myong ba ni phyis myong ba ste /
translated: Experience is later experience.

original: rang bzhin zhe'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhe'o //
translated: It is the nature.

original: so sor brtag par bya'o zhes pa ni ma 'dres par brtag pa'o //
analyzed: so sor brtag par bya'o zhes pa ni ma 'dres par brtag pa'o //
translated: One should investigate individually means one should investigate separately.

original: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni 'di lta bu yin te zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes pa ni 'di lta bu yin te zhe'o //
translated: Thus means in this way.

original: dang po kun du snang ba ni snang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: dang po kun du snang ba ni snang ba gsum mo //
translated: First, the universal appearance is the three appearances.

original: phyi nas rang bzhin zhes pa ni 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin te de las 'byung ba'o //
