analyzed: phyi nas rang bzhin zhes pa ni 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin te de las 'byung ba'o //
translated: After that, the nature is the nature of error, which arises from that.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa'i dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam pa'i dbye ba bstan to //
translated: By the words appearance, etc., the divisions of aspects are taught.

original: de la snang ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes pa ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid mi shes nas 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: de la snang ba'i mtshan nyid gang zhe na zhes pa ni snang ba'i mtshan nyid mi shes nas 'dri ba ste /
translated: There, if one asks, what is the characteristic of appearance, it is asking, not knowing the characteristic of appearance,

original: mtshan nyid ni ci /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni ci /
translated: What is the characteristic?

original: dpe gang dang 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpe gang dang 'dra zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the example?

original: rnam pa med pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa ni dkar po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The nature without aspects is free from the aspects of white, etc.

original: lus dang ngag med pa ni lus dang ngag mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag med pa ni lus dang ngag mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The absence of body and speech is the non-apprehension of body and speech.

original: ji ltar zhes pa ni dper na zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa ni dper na zhes sbyar te /
translated: As is to be construed as for example.

original: ston gyi dus kyi nam mkha' ni ston gyi dus kyi nam mkha' bar snang ngo //
analyzed: ston gyi dus kyi nam mkha' ni ston gyi dus kyi nam mkha' bar snang ngo //
translated: The autumn sky is the autumn sky of space.

original: dri ma med pa ni sprin med pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni sprin med pa'o //
translated: The stainless is the cloudless.

original: de la zla ba shar ba ni mi gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la zla ba shar ba ni mi gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The moon rising in it is the non-manifest consciousness.

original: de'i don yang gang yin zhe na rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don yang gang yin zhe na rang bzhin gyis gsal ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: What is its meaning? It is the aspect of natural luminosity.

original: 'di la byed pa po ni med do //
analyzed: 'di la byed pa po ni med do //
translated: There is no agent here.

original: dngos po ma lus pa thams cad la dmigs pa ni rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po ma lus pa thams cad la dmigs pa ni rnam gnyis te /
translated: The observation of all things is twofold:

original: dngos po'i dngos la dmigs pa dang / dngos po'i chos nyid la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i dngos la dmigs pa dang / dngos po'i chos nyid la dmigs pa'o //
translated: the observation of the entity of a thing and the observation of the reality of a thing.

original: dngos po'i dngos la dmigs pa ni 'dir dpe snang ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i dngos la dmigs pa ni 'dir dpe snang ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The observation of the entity of a thing is here illustrated by the example of light.

original: dngos po'i chos nyid la dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos nyid la dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The observation of the reality of a thing is twofold:

original: thob pa'i rgyu la dmigs pa dang / chos nyid dngos la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyu la dmigs pa dang / chos nyid dngos la dmigs pa'o //
translated: the observation of the cause of attainment and the observation of reality itself.

original: thob pa'i rgyu la dmigs pa ni 'dir lam gyi snang ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i rgyu la dmigs pa ni 'dir lam gyi snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of the path is the objective reference to the cause of attainment.

original: chos nyid dngos la dmigs pa ni 'bras bu'i snang ba'o //
analyzed: chos nyid dngos la dmigs pa ni 'bras bu'i snang ba'o //
translated: The appearance of the result is the objective reference to reality itself.

original: 'di ni don dam pa'i byang chub sems zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i snang ba'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa'i byang chub sems zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i snang ba'o ;
translated: This is the ultimate thought of enlightenment.

original: / aom zhes bya ba ni brdar brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do /
analyzed: / aom zhes bya ba ni brdar brtags pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do /
translated: The syllable Om is merely a conventional symbol.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang lam gyi snang ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang lam gyi snang ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: All of these are from the point of view of the appearance of the path.

original: de nas snang ba mched pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas snang ba mched pa'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the characteristic of the appearance of increase should be explained.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa med pa ni yul dang yul can gyi rnam pa dang bral @263a * //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa med pa ni yul dang yul can gyi rnam pa dang bral @263a * //
translated: The absence of the aspects of subject and object is the absence of the aspects of object and subject.

original: ba'o // lus dang ngag med pa ni gong du bshad do //
analyzed: ba'o // lus dang ngag med pa ni gong du bshad do //
translated: The absence of body and speech has been explained above.

original: ston gyi dus kyi nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis ni thams cad 'ju zhing gsal ba'o //
analyzed: ston gyi dus kyi nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis ni thams cad 'ju zhing gsal ba'o //
translated: The light of the autumn sun pervades and illuminates everything.

original: de dang 'dra bar shin tu gsal ba ni dang ba'i ngo bo nyid du gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar shin tu gsal ba ni dang ba'i ngo bo nyid du gsal ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the very clear is the clear essence of clarity.

original: dri ma med pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni glo bur gyi dri ma dang bral ba'o //
translated: The stainless is free from adventitious stains.

original: kun du bzang po gnyis pa ni kun du bzang po dang 'dra bya'o //
analyzed: kun du bzang po gnyis pa ni kun du bzang po dang 'dra bya'o //
translated: The second Samantabhadra is like the Samantabhadra.

original: rim pa gnyis ni kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: rim pa gnyis ni kun rdzob ste /
translated: The two stages are conventional.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.🔽What is the attainment of appearance?

original: snang ba thob pa gang zhe na zhes pa ni snang ba thob pa'i dngos po mi shes nas 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba thob pa gang zhe na zhes pa ni snang ba thob pa'i dngos po mi shes nas 'dri ba'o //
translated: Since one does not know the entity of the attainment of appearance, it is asked.

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of space is the nature of space.

original: nam mkha' ltar rtog pa dang bral zhe'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar rtog pa dang bral zhe'o //
translated: Like space, it is free from conceptuality.

original: mtshams kyis smag la bab pa ni nam phyed kyi dus su'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyis smag la bab pa ni nam phyed kyi dus su'o //
translated: The darkness of the boundary is at midnight.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.🔽Thus, the intimate instruction of all buddhas is the characteristic of the three emptinesses.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyi man ngag stong pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan zhes pa ni snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba thob pa'i mtshan nyid 'khrul ba ni snang ba rang bzhin dang bcas pa 'byung ba'o ;
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyi man ngag stong pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan zhes pa ni snang ba dang / snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba thob pa'i mtshan nyid 'khrul ba ni snang ba rang bzhin dang bcas pa 'byung ba'o ;
translated: The characteristic of the error of appearance, the appearance of increase, and the attainment of appearance is the arising of appearance with a nature.

original: / lam ni sku dang thig le la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: / lam ni sku dang thig le la sogs pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The path is abiding in the kāyas, bindus, and so on.

original: 'bras bu ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob gnyis la dmigs pa lugs las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni don dam pa dang kun rdzob gnyis la dmigs pa lugs las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The result is the opposite of the two, the ultimate and the conventional, which are the objects.

original: dpe'i snang ba ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang / mun pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dpe'i snang ba ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang / mun pa lta bu'o //
translated: The example is the appearance of the moon, the sun, and darkness.

original: de la 'khrul ba'i snang ba gsum bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'khrul ba'i snang ba gsum bshad par bya ste /
translated: Among these, the three appearances of error should be explained.

original: de la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: And there are three kinds:

original: dus la ltos pa dang / pho dang mo'i rten la ltos pa dang / dbang po'i rten la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: dus la ltos pa dang / pho dang mo'i rten la ltos pa dang / dbang po'i rten la ltos pa'o //
translated: depending on time, depending on the support of male and female, and depending on the support of the sense faculties.

original: de la dus la ltos pa ni mer mer po la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'khrul ba yang rim gyi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la dus la ltos pa ni mer mer po la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'khrul ba yang rim gyi 'byung ngo //
translated: Among these, depending on time is the error that arises gradually, such as the stage of kalala.

original: pho dang mo'i rten la ltos pa ni brgya drug cu'o //
analyzed: pho dang mo'i rten la ltos pa ni brgya drug cu'o //
translated: Depending on the support of male and female is the sixty-four.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la ltos pa ni brgya dang bcu phrag lnga dang drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la ltos pa ni brgya dang bcu phrag lnga dang drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Depending on the sense faculties such as the eyes is five times one hundred and ten.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: de yang gang las shes zhes sam nyis gyur nas dris pa dang / lan du gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang gang las shes zhes sam nyis gyur nas dris pa dang / lan du gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud phyi ma las gsungs te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, it is asked, From what is this known? or Is it asked twice? and in reply it is said, It is taught in the Later Guhyasamaja Tantra, and so forth.

original: rkyen las byung ba gang dang gang zhes pa ni yul dang rnam par rtog pa de dang de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba gang dang gang zhes pa ni yul dang rnam par rtog pa de dang de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What arises from conditions, what and what? refers to objects and thoughts.

original: dbang po ni dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni dbang po lnga'o //
translated: The faculties are the five faculties.

original: yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The objects are form and so forth.

original: dbang po dang yul gnyis las skyes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul gnyis las skyes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
translated: What arises from the two, faculties and objects, is the six collections of consciousness.

original: skyob ba ni ngan 'gro srid pa las skyob pa'o //
analyzed: skyob ba ni ngan 'gro srid pa las skyob pa'o //
translated: Protection is protection from the existence of bad rebirths.

original: gzhan yang rang bzhin gang las @263b nyon mongs pa gang 'byung //
analyzed: gzhan yang rang bzhin gang las @263b nyon mongs pa gang 'byung //
translated: Moreover, from what nature do what afflictions arise?

original: 'on te mi 'byung na ni ci'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi 'byung na ni ci'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If they do not arise, why are they called delusions?

original: rang bzhin rnam pa brgyad cu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa brgyad cu las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, From the eighty natures, and so forth.

original: de la rang bzhin brgyad cu ni rtsa ba ste sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin brgyad cu ni rtsa ba ste sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: Therein, the eighty natures are the root, which is like a seed.

original: nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad ni khong khro ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad ni khong khro ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The eighty-eight afflictions are anger and so forth.

original: 'di ni de las byung bas 'bras bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de las byung bas 'bras bu lta bu'o //
translated: This is like a result because it arises from that.

original: de las gzhan 'byung bas lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ni 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba'i dbye ba ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan 'byung bas lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis ni 'jig tshogs kyi lta ba'i dbye ba ste /
translated: The sixty-two views arise from that.

original: 'di bsdus na ni 'jig tshogs su lta bar 'dus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di bsdus na ni 'jig tshogs su lta bar 'dus par 'gyur ro //
translated: When condensed, they are included in the view of the transitory collection.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by that?

original: log par spyad pa'i stobs kyis ngan song gsum du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par spyad pa'i stobs kyis ngan song gsum du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of wrong conduct, one is born in the three lower realms.

original: de nas dpe'i snang ba don dang bcas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas dpe'i snang ba don dang bcas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Next, in order to explain the meaning of the example of the appearance,

original: shes rab dang stong pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: shes rab dang stong pa'i ye shes te /
translated: it is the pristine consciousness of wisdom and emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir zla ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dpe bstan pa'i phyir zla ba lta bu ste /
translated: In order to explain the example of that, it is like the moon.

original: gang gis snying ga'i thig le la blo gtod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis snying ga'i thig le la blo gtod pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That is said of the one who focuses the mind on the bindu in the heart.

original: thabs kyi ye shes ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: thabs kyi ye shes ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The pristine consciousness of method is the pristine consciousness of the increase of appearance.

original: de'i dpe ni nyi ma'i snang ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de'i dpe ni nyi ma'i snang ba lta bu ste /
translated: The example of that is like the appearance of the sun.

original: gang gi 'od kyis gang la khyab pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi 'od kyis gang la khyab pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That by which it is pervaded is so called.

original: snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes ni yul dang sems la dbang thob pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes ni yul dang sems la dbang thob pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the attainment of light is the attainment of mastery over the object and the mind.

original: mtshams kyi mun nag gi dpe dgod pa ste /
analyzed: mtshams kyi mun nag gi dpe dgod pa ste /
translated: The example of the darkness of the horizon is given.

original: 'dir thams cad thig le gcig gi rnam par gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir thams cad thig le gcig gi rnam par gyur pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Here, that which is transformed into the form of the single sphere is so called.

original: de nas 'od gsal ba'i ye shes bshad pa /
analyzed: de nas 'od gsal ba'i ye shes bshad pa /
translated: Then the knowledge of clear light is explained.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum ni gong du bshad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum ni gong du bshad pa nyid do //
translated: The three consciousnesses have been explained above.

original: ji lta bu'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i rnam pa yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of form does it have?

original: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtshan nyid can ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It has the characteristic of space, like space.

original: rnam pa med pa ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa ni dmigs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is formless, free from the form of an object.

original: 'gro dang 'ong ba dang bral ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro dang 'ong ba dang bral ba ni 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa ste /
translated: Free from coming and going, it is without coming and going.

original: gang la dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa dang bral ba dang rnam pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / dmigs pa dang bral ba dang rnam pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has an object and is free from an object and free from form is so called.

original: de lta bu'i sems de ni sems nyid 'od gsal ba ste /🔽de ltar sems don dam par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'i ngo bo yin na ji ltar don byed par 'gyur zhes 'dri ba bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar na nyin dang mtshan du lus la spro zhing sdud par byed ces pa ni ci'i phyir nyin dang
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems de ni sems nyid 'od gsal ba ste / de ltar sems don dam par skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa'i ngo bo yin na ji ltar don byed par 'gyur zhes 'dri ba bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar na nyin dang mtshan du lus la spro zhing sdud par byed ces pa ni ci'i phyir nyin dang
translated: Such a mind is the clear light of mind itself.🔽If the mind is ultimately unborn and has the nature of non-cessation, how can it perform a function?

original: mtshan du yul la spro zhing slar sdud ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan du yul la spro zhing slar sdud ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said: “How does it expand and contract in the body day and night?” What is the reason that it expands in objects day and night and contracts again?

original: gang zhig 'dir me la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir me la /
translated: What is the mind that creates life here?

original: @264a * // tshe byed ces pa ni sems gang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed pa mi rigs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: @264a * // tshe byed ces pa ni sems gang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa sel bar byed pa mi rigs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is unreasonable for any mind to dispel the fear of conceptualization and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems gzung 'dzin dang bral pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gzung 'dzin dang bral pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mind is free from subject-object duality.

original: su zhig ni sems pa med par byed ces pa ni don la sems par byed pa po yang su zhig yin zhes pa ste /
analyzed: su zhig ni sems pa med par byed ces pa ni don la sems par byed pa po yang su zhig yin zhes pa ste /
translated: Who makes it mindless? Who is the agent that makes the mind think of an object?

original: de'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from that aspect.

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni 'dir sems rang bzhin med pa yin na ji ltar de las rang bzhin dang / nyon mongs pa rnams dang / lta ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur zhes dris pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni 'dir sems rang bzhin med pa yin na ji ltar de las rang bzhin dang / nyon mongs pa rnams dang / lta ba rnams 'byung bar 'gyur zhes dris pa dang /
translated: Here, the question is asked: “If the mind is essenceless, how can afflictions and views arise from it?”

original: de dag thams cad sems rang bzhin med pa yin yang 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag thams cad sems rang bzhin med pa yin yang 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The answer is that all of them arise, even though the mind is essenceless.

original: rdo rje slob dpon gyis smras pa zhes pa ni lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon gyis smras pa zhes pa ni lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: The vajra master said is the reply.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Consciousness and so on have already been explained.

original: kyang zhes pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyan no ;
analyzed: kyang zhes pa ni mi mthun pa'i rgyan no ;
translated: Also is a conjunctive particle.

original: / snang ba dang bcas pa ni yul dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: / snang ba dang bcas pa ni yul dang bcas pa ste /
translated: With appearance means with an object.

original: 'di ni kun rdzob tu bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni kun rdzob tu bshad do //
translated: This is explained conventionally.

original: rlung gi khams dang lhan cig me la tshe byed ces pa ni /
analyzed: rlung gi khams dang lhan cig me la tshe byed ces pa ni /
translated: The life force is generated in fire together with the wind element.

original: rlung la shes pa zhon nas des mel tshe byed pa'o //
analyzed: rlung la shes pa zhon nas des mel tshe byed pa'o //
translated: Consciousness rides on the wind and it generates the life force in fire.

original: rlung gi mtshan nyid kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gi mtshan nyid kyang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the defining characteristic of wind?

original: gzugs med pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa ste /
translated: It is formless.

original: gzugs rags pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o //🔽de'i las bstan pa'i phyir g-yo zhing bskyed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston pa ni yang ba nyid dang g-yo ba nyid dang / rang la yod pa ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs rags pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba'o // de'i las bstan pa'i phyir g-yo zhing bskyed pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston pa ni yang ba nyid dang g-yo ba nyid dang / rang la yod pa ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is free from the aspect of gross form.🔽In order to demonstrate its function, it is said, “It is the basis of the arising of the mind and mental factors, and of the various kinds of movement.”

original: nges gzhan la de lta bu byed pa'i las so //
analyzed: nges gzhan la de lta bu byed pa'i las so //
translated: The function of lightness is to cause the mind and mental factors to arise and to cause the various kinds of movement.🔽The function of movement is to cause the mind and mental factors to arise and to cause the various kinds of movement.

original: de gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de gang las shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: rjes su dpag pa las te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las te /
translated: It is known through inference.🔽That is, it is known on the basis of a reason.

original: gang gi rtags la brten nas gang shes par byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: gang gi rtags la brten nas gang shes par byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o // rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is selfevident.

original: de skad ces bya ba de nyid kyang gang la brten nas shes par bya ba de nyid mi shes so zhe na /
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba de nyid kyang gang la brten nas shes par bya ba de nyid mi shes so zhe na /
translated: If this is so, then how is it known that the mind and mental factors arise in dependence on the faculties, objects, and consciousnesses?

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'pho ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'pho ba'i mdo las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It is stated in the Sūtra on the Transference of Consciousness.”

original: rlung gi khams gzugs can ma yin yang zhes pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs med kyang zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rlung gi khams gzugs can ma yin yang zhes pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs med kyang zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The element of wind is not material, which means that it is not material that is impeded.

original: bstan du yod cing gzung du yod pa snang ngo zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu snang ba'o //
analyzed: bstan du yod cing gzung du yod pa snang ngo zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu snang ba'o //
translated: It appears as visible and graspable means that it appears conventionally.

original: gzhan go sla'o //🔽rang rig tsam @264b gyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o // rang rig tsam @264b gyi ye shes ni //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.🔽The wisdom of mere self-awareness

original: zhes pa ni rang snang ba tsam gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang snang ba tsam gyi ye shes so //
translated: means the wisdom that is merely self-apparent.

original: ji ltar yin zhe na /🔽nam mkha' 'dra bar mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: ji ltar yin zhe na / nam mkha' 'dra bar mtshan nyid med //
translated: How is that?🔽It is said, “It is without characteristics, like space.”

original: ces pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du dngos po'i rnam pa dang bral zhe'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni nam mkha' bzhin du dngos po'i rnam pa dang bral zhe'o //
translated: It is free from the aspect of entities, like space.

original: 'o na dbye ba med dam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dbye ba med dam zhe na /
translated: Well, is it not without divisions?🔽It is said, “However, it has divisions there.”

original: 'on kyang de la dbye ba yod do zhes pa ni gzung 'dzin dang bral ba yin yang dbye ba yod do zhe'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la dbye ba yod do zhes pa ni gzung 'dzin dang bral ba yin yang dbye ba yod do zhe'o //
translated: It is free from subject and object, but it has divisions.

original: du zhe na /
analyzed: du zhe na /
translated: How many?

original: 'di la dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'di la dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is said, “Here, the divisions are three.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyin mo dang / mtshan mo dang / mtshams kyi bye brag gis zhes bstan pa'i phyir bar mtshams nyin dang mtshan mo'i bdag ces pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mo dang / mtshan mo dang / mtshams kyi bye brag gis zhes bstan pa'i phyir bar mtshams nyin dang mtshan mo'i bdag ces pa'o //
translated: In order to teach the distinctions of day, night, and the interval, he says, “the self of day and night and the interval.”

original: don gang zhe na /
analyzed: don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning?

original: snang ba la sogs pa ste bshad zin to //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa ste bshad zin to //
translated: Light and so forth have already been explained.

original: de'i gzhi yang gang yin zhe na bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i gzhi yang gang yin zhe na bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: And what is the basis of that? In order to explain, he says,

original: de'i gzhi yang bshad par bya //
analyzed: de'i gzhi yang bshad par bya //
translated: “The basis of that will be explained.”

original: zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i gzhi bye brag dang bcas te bshad do zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i gzhi bye brag dang bcas te bshad do zhe'o //
translated: The basis of consciousness will be explained with its distinctions.

original: gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: phra ba'i gzugs can ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: phra ba'i gzugs can ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Consciousness has subtle form.

original: rlung dang ni zhes pa ni rlung nyid do //
analyzed: rlung dang ni zhes pa ni rlung nyid do //
translated: “Wind” is just wind.

original: ye shes dag ni 'dres gyur pa //
analyzed: ye shes dag ni 'dres gyur pa //
translated: “The two wisdoms mix”

original: zhes pa ni rlung dang shes pa 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rlung dang shes pa 'grogs pa'o //
translated: means that wind and consciousness are associated.

original: dbang po'i lam nas byung nas ni //
analyzed: dbang po'i lam nas byung nas ni //
translated: “Having emerged from the path of the sense organ”

original: zhas pa ni dbang po la brten pa'i rtsa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhas pa ni dbang po la brten pa'i rtsa las byung ba'o //
translated: means that it emerges from the nāḍī that supports the sense organ.

original: yul rnams la ni dmigs par byed //
analyzed: yul rnams la ni dmigs par byed //
translated: “It observes objects”

original: ces pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: means that it observes form and so on.

original: gang tshe snang ba ldan gyur pa //
analyzed: gang tshe snang ba ldan gyur pa //
translated: When there is light,

original: zhes pa ni yul gyi rnam pa dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yul gyi rnam pa dang bcas pas so //
translated: means together with the aspect of the object.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: rlung ni bzhon pa ste /
analyzed: rlung ni bzhon pa ste /
translated: The wind is the mount.

original: shes pa rlung la zhon te //
analyzed: shes pa rlung la zhon te //
translated: Consciousness rides on the wind.

original: des de ltar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: des de ltar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: That is the result of that.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na de tshe rang bzhin de thams cad 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na de tshe rang bzhin de thams cad 'byung ste /
translated: What is the result of that? At that time, all of that nature arises.

original: 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin dang / nyon mongs pa dang lta ba thams cad 'byung zhe'o //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin dang / nyon mongs pa dang lta ba thams cad 'byung zhe'o //
translated: The nature of error, all afflictions, and all views arise.

original: rang bzhin yang gang dang gang du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang gang dang gang du 'byung zhe na /
translated: In what way does the nature arise?

original: rlung ni gang dang gang gnas pa //
analyzed: rlung ni gang dang gang gnas pa //
translated: Wherever the wind abides,

original: rang bzhin de dang de 'byung 'gyur //
analyzed: rang bzhin de dang de 'byung 'gyur //
translated: that nature will arise.

original: zhes pa ni rlung dang shes pa 'grogs te yul la dmigs pa las 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rlung dang shes pa 'grogs te yul la dmigs pa las 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that consciousness arises from the wind and the object of observation.🔽In order to clarify this very meaning,

original: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni 'di kho na ste snang ba gsum mo //
analyzed: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni 'di kho na ste snang ba gsum mo //
translated: means this itself, the three lights.

original: ye shes de yang ji lta bur 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes de yang ji lta bur 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How does that wisdom arise?

original: ye shes skad cig ma ste /
analyzed: ye shes skad cig ma ste /
translated: The knowledge is momentary.

original: rgyun ni ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: rgyun ni ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: It is not a continuum.

original: phyogs bcur rab tu khyab pa ni phyogs bcur rab tu khyab pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcur rab tu khyab pa ni phyogs bcur rab tu khyab pa'o //
translated: It pervades the ten directions.

original: de gang @265a * //
analyzed: de gang @265a * //
translated: What is that?

original: las gsungs she na /
analyzed: las gsungs she na /
translated: From where is it stated?

original: dgongs pas bshad pa las gsungs she'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa las gsungs she'o //
translated: It is stated in the Elucidation of Intention.

original: de nyid mi shes nas dris pa /
analyzed: de nyid mi shes nas dris pa /
translated: Not knowing that, he asks,

original: ji ltar na ye shes skad cig mar 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ye shes skad cig mar 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is knowledge momentary?

original: zhes pa ni ye shes skad cig ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes skad cig ma yin pa ci'i phyir zhes pa ste /
translated: This means, why is knowledge momentary?

original: lan du / skad cig ces bya ba'i bar du ste go sla'o //
analyzed: lan du / skad cig ces bya ba'i bar du ste go sla'o //
translated: The answer is, up to the moment, which is easy to understand.

original: nam mkha' snang byed ces bya ba yang gang yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' snang byed ces bya ba yang gang yin /
translated: What is the illumination of space?

original: gang las log pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang las log pa yin zhe na /
translated: From what is it turned away?

original: nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, space, etc.

original: go 'byed pa'i don gyis ni nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: go 'byed pa'i don gyis ni nam mkha' ste /
translated: Space is the meaning of the opening.

original: gsal bar byed pa ni mthong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa ni mthong bar byed pa ste /
translated: Illumination is the act of seeing.

original: gang gis bsgribs par mi byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis bsgribs par mi byed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which does not obscure is so called.

original: de dang 'dra ba yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is similar to that?

original: shin tu gsal ba'i ye shes rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba'i ye shes rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The wisdom that is very clear is free from conceptualization.

original: srin bu me khyer ni ma yin no zhes pa ni ldog pa ste mar me lta bu dang / du ba yang ma yin zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: srin bu me khyer ni ma yin no zhes pa ni ldog pa ste mar me lta bu dang / du ba yang ma yin zhes sbyar ro //
translated: It is not like a firefly is the exclusion, which is to be applied to it is not like a lamp and it is not like smoke.

original: snang ba g-yo ba yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba g-yo ba yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the moving appearance?

original: khams phra ba ni rlung ste /
analyzed: khams phra ba ni rlung ste /
translated: The subtle element is wind.

original: de dang shes pa lhan cig tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dang shes pa lhan cig tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: It moves together with consciousness.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: sems dpa' med pa gang yin zhe na zhes pa ni sems dpa' med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes nas dris pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' med pa gang yin zhe na zhes pa ni sems dpa' med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes nas dris pa'o //
translated: What is the absence of a hero? is asking because the defining characteristic of the absence of a hero is not known.

original: ma rig pa ste zhes pa ni len te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ste zhes pa ni len te /
translated: It is ignorance is the answer.

original: gang gis gang gi rnam pa mi shes pa de ni ma rig pa'o /
analyzed: gang gis gang gi rnam pa mi shes pa de ni ma rig pa'o /
translated: Ignorance is that by which one does not know the aspects of something.

original: de las kyang ci 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de las kyang ci 'byung zhe na /
translated: What arises from that?

original: de rnams ma lus par 'byung ste /
analyzed: de rnams ma lus par 'byung ste /
translated: Everything arises from that.

original: rlung las rang bzhin rnams 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rlung las rang bzhin rnams 'byung bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the natures arise from wind.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The others are easy to understand.

original: mi 'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pas zhus pa'i mdo las zhes pa ni mdo dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'am ci'i rgyal po ljon pas zhus pa'i mdo las zhes pa ni mdo dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in the sutra requested by the king of the Kinnaras is for the purpose of not contradicting the sutra.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni mar me mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni mar me mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The perfect buddhas are Dipankara and so forth.

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pa ni mngon du gyur pa mchog gi ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pa ni mngon du gyur pa mchog gi ye shes dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing unobstructed wisdom vision means possessing manifest, supreme wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhes pa ni de nyid la the tshom du gyur nas dris pa'o //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhes pa ni de nyid la the tshom du gyur nas dris pa'o //
translated: Why is that? is asking out of doubt about that very thing.

original: de'i len du sems can thams cad kyi 'das pa'i sems rgyun zad pa ni log pa'i sems dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de'i len du sems can thams cad kyi 'das pa'i sems rgyun zad pa ni log pa'i sems dang bral ba'o //
translated: The answer is: The cessation of the past mind-streams of all sentient beings is freedom from the perverted mind.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / sems dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa de dag kyang gang gis rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dang / sems dang mi ldan pa la sogs pa de dag kyang gang gis rab tu shes she na /
translated: By what are those minds, mental factors, and things not associated with the mind known?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas shes te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas shes te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Tathagata knows them, because he possesses the three omnisciences.

original: de ltar shes @265b pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes @265b pa'i phyir thogs pa med pa'i ye shes dang ldan zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Because of knowing thus, he is endowed with unobstructed intuition is supplied.

original: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba yang sems can thams cad kyi sems dang de nyid sgyu ma tsam dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / chos kyi sku la sogs pa skad cig dang thang cig dang yung tsam dang / mig btsums pa la sogs pa tsam gyis shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba yang sems can thams cad kyi sems dang de nyid sgyu ma tsam dang / rang bzhin med pa dang / chos kyi sku la sogs pa skad cig dang thang cig dang yung tsam dang / mig btsums pa la sogs pa tsam gyis shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for unobstructed intuition, it is because he knows in a single moment, a single instant, a single brief second, a single twinkling of an eye, the minds of all sentient beings, and their mere illusion-like nature, their lack of intrinsic reality, their Dharma body, etc.

original: rig pa 'dis na zhes pa gtan tshig de'i phyir zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rig pa 'dis na zhes pa gtan tshig de'i phyir zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: By this reasoning, therefore means for that reason.

original: thugs kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni sems la dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: thugs kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni sems la dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: Abiding in the mind's meditative stabilization is the mind's object itself.

original: smon pa po ni bdag go //
analyzed: smon pa po ni bdag go //
translated: The aspirer is the self.

original: smon lam ni smon lam nyid do //
analyzed: smon lam ni smon lam nyid do //
translated: Aspiration is aspiration itself.

original: smon par bya ba ni 'bras bu mchog dang thun mong gi dngos grub po'o //
analyzed: smon par bya ba ni 'bras bu mchog dang thun mong gi dngos grub po'o //
translated: The aspired-for is the supreme and common spiritual powers.

original: de spong ba ni de thams cad sems kyi snang ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spong ba ni de thams cad sems kyi snang ba tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Abandoning that is because all of that is mere appearances of the mind.

original: de ltar sems la dmigs pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar sems la dmigs pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of observing the mind in this way?

original: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa la mngon par phyogs pa ste /🔽sgyu ma lta bu thob pa'am ma mngon du bya ba'am /
analyzed: bdag la byin gyis brlab pa la mngon par phyogs pa ste / sgyu ma lta bu thob pa'am ma mngon du bya ba'am /
translated: It is the approach to self-consecration.

original: bsgom par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom par 'dod pa'o //
translated: One should attain the illusion-like, or manifest the illusion-like, or desire to cultivate the illusion-like.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las zhes pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud ma yin pa'i nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las zhes pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud ma yin pa'i nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The words in the root tantra are meant to exclude the explanatory tantras.

original: mnyam par gzhag pas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pas so //🔽rang gi sems la so sor rtogs shing zhes pa ni rang gi sems la nan tan du gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pas so // rang gi sems la so sor rtogs shing zhes pa ni rang gi sems la nan tan du gyis shig pa ste /
translated: The words by one who is equipoised mean by one who is absorbed in contemplation.🔽The words observing one's own mind mean carefully observe your own mind.

original: rang gi sems dge ba'am /
analyzed: rang gi sems dge ba'am /
translated: You should investigate whether your mind is virtuous,

original: mi dge ba'am /
analyzed: mi dge ba'am /
translated: non-virtuous,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'am /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'am /
translated: indeterminate,

original: 'khor ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa'am /
translated: cyclic existence or nirvana,

original: blang bar bya ba'am dor bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: blang bar bya ba'am dor bar bya ba'am /
translated: something to be adopted or something to be rejected,

original: btang snyoms su bya ba 'am /🔽rdzas su yod pa'am /
analyzed: btang snyoms su bya ba 'am / rdzas su yod pa'am /
translated: something to be made indifferent,🔽something substantially existent,

original: rdzas su med pa'am zhes brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzas su med pa'am zhes brtag par bya'o //
translated: or something substantially non-existent.

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rgyud la brten pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud dang mi 'gal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rgyud la brten pa ni bshad pa'i rgyud dang mi 'gal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The basis of the explanation is the explanation of the tantra.

original: snang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba ni snang ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i rjes su 'brang ba ni snang ba la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Following appearances is the adherence to appearances.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: rang gi sems ji lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa ni sems kyi chos nyid mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems ji lta ba bzhin du ma rtogs pa ni sems kyi chos nyid mi shes pa'o //
translated: The non-understanding of one's own mind is the non-understanding of the reality of the mind.

original: las su smra ba ni las dang las kyi 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i sems can dag go //
analyzed: las su smra ba ni las dang las kyi 'bras bu yod par smra ba'i sems can dag go //
translated: The advocates of karma are those sentient beings who advocate the existence of karma and the results of karma.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i rang gi rtog pa las byung ba ni thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i bag chags kyis bsgribs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa'i rang gi rtog pa las byung ba ni thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i bag chags kyis bsgribs pa'o //
translated: The beginningless cycle of existence is arisen from one's own conceptualization, obscured by the latent tendencies accumulated since beginningless time.

original: cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: dar gyi srin bu bzhin du ste /
analyzed: dar gyi srin bu bzhin du ste /
translated: Like a silkworm.

original: rang gi 'ching bas bcings pa ni dar gyi srin bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi 'ching bas bcings pa ni dar gyi srin bu lta bu'o //
translated: The bound by one's own bondage is like a silkworm.

original: rang nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyis 'dir @266a * //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyis 'dir @266a * //
translated: One's own suffering is taught here.

original: gzhan las byung ba ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan las byung ba ma yin par bstan to //
translated: It does not arise from another.

original: sems la dmigs pas ni spong bar byed pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: sems la dmigs pas ni spong bar byed pa ste go sla'o //
translated: By observing the mind, one abandons it. It is easy to understand.

original: 'di dag gis ni sems la dmigs pa spros pa dang bcas pa ste bshad do //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni sems la dmigs pa spros pa dang bcas pa ste bshad do //
translated: These are said to be the mental objects with elaboration.

original: 'di dag kyang de nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi gang zag gi dbang du byas nas zla ba'i man ngag bshad do //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang de nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi gang zag gi dbang du byas nas zla ba'i man ngag bshad do //
translated: These are also explained in the Instructions of Candragomin, from the point of view of the person who has the aspect of that.

original: gzhan la rag las pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: gzhan la rag las pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: And from the point of view of dependence on another,

original: 'dir kun rdzob kyi bden pa la snyegs par byed do //
analyzed: 'dir kun rdzob kyi bden pa la snyegs par byed do //
translated: here one should pursue the conventional truth.

original: spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma'i don 'di nyid du sems la dmigs pa'i the tshom yongs su gcod pa ni 'dir sems kyi ngo bo dang rgyu dang las dang 'khrul pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa bsdus pa'i sgron ma'i don 'di nyid du sems la dmigs pa'i the tshom yongs su gcod pa ni 'dir sems kyi ngo bo dang rgyu dang las dang 'khrul pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In this very meaning of the Lamp for the Compendium of Practice, the determination of doubt about the mental object is here the nature of mind, its cause, its action, its error, and so forth.

original: spyod pa bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las le'u bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
analyzed: spyod pa bsdus pa'i 'grel pa las le'u bzhi pa'i bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of chapter 4 of the Commentary on the Lamp for the Compendium of Practice.

original: // / rdo rje slob mas gsol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba mtha' dag gi don shes par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: // / rdo rje slob mas gsol pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni sems dang sems las byung ba mtha' dag gi don shes par 'dod pa ste /
translated: The vajra student's request, and so forth, is the desire to understand the meaning of all of mind and mental factors.

original: rnam par shes pa sna tshogs ni rnam par shes pa mtha' dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa sna tshogs ni rnam par shes pa mtha' dag ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: The various consciousnesses are synonymous with all consciousnesses.

original: / rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin snang ba ni gzugs med pa zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: / rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rang bzhin snang ba ni gzugs med pa zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa gsum bstan du med cing thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The appearance of the nature of the three consciousnesses is formless. The three consciousnesses are taught to be imperceptible and unimpeded.

original: 'o na rlung gzugs can yin no snyam pa la /
analyzed: 'o na rlung gzugs can yin no snyam pa la /
translated: Now, if one thinks that wind is form,

original: rlung gi khams kyang gzugs med pa //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyang gzugs med pa // zhes pa ste /
translated: the wind element is also formless.

original: rlung yang kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung yang kha dog dang dbyibs dang rnam par rig byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wind is also formless because it has no color, shape, or indication.

original: 'o na / las gzugs can yin no snyam pa la las kyang gzugs med pa ste zhes pa ni dge ba dang sdig pa'i las la gzugs med do //
analyzed: 'o na / las gzugs can yin no snyam pa la las kyang gzugs med pa ste zhes pa ni dge ba dang sdig pa'i las la gzugs med do //
translated: Now, if one thinks that karma is form, karma is also formless. Virtue and nonvirtuous karma are formless.

original: gang gzugs med pa de la rnam par rig pa med //
analyzed: gang gzugs med pa de la rnam par rig pa med //
translated: That which is formless is imperceptible.

original: gang la rnam par rig pa med pa de la bstan du med cing thogs pa med do zhe'o //
analyzed: gang la rnam par rig pa med pa de la bstan du med cing thogs pa med do zhe'o //
translated: That which is imperceptible is imperceptible and unimpeded.

original: phan tshun shes pa med pa ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun shes pa med pa ni tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mutual absence of consciousness is because they are not different.

original: lung gi tshig las stong pa nyid du gsungs //
analyzed: lung gi tshig las stong pa nyid du gsungs //
translated: The words of scripture declare emptiness.

original: zhes pa ni bka' las rang bzhin med par yang bshad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bka' las rang bzhin med par yang bshad ces pa'i don to //
translated: This means that the scriptures also explain that there is no intrinsic reality.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The other sentences are easy to understand.

original: de la dang po kho nar zhes pa ni thog ma nyid du'o //
analyzed: de la dang po kho nar zhes pa ni thog ma nyid du'o //
translated: In this regard, “first of all” means at the very beginning.

original: dge ba dang mi dge bar ni spong ba dang 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge bar ni spong ba dang 'jug pa ste /
translated: “Virtuous and nonvirtuous” refers to the abandonment and the engagement.

original: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod par lta ba la thug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod par lta ba la thug gi bar du'o //
translated: [The virtuous are] from the abandonment of taking what is not given up to the abandonment of wrong views.

original: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni de'i rang bzhin rnam par gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni de'i rang bzhin rnam par gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: “Their own characteristics” are their intrinsic natures, which are to be established.

original: de nyid kyang rgyas par bshad pa dge ba bcu ni nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i mi dge ba spong ba @266b bcu'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang rgyas par bshad pa dge ba bcu ni nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i mi dge ba spong ba @266b bcu'o //
translated: Moreover, the ten virtues are the abandonment of the ten nonvirtues, which are produced by the afflictions.

original: de las bzlog pa ni spong ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni spong ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is not the abandonment.

original: dang du lan par byed ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dang du lan par byed ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means to acquiesce.

original: 'di dag kyang gang las 'byung zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang gang las 'byung zhe'o //
translated: From what do these arise?

original: lus dang ngag yid las kun du 'byung ba'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid las kun du 'byung ba'o zhes pa ste /
translated: They arise from the body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di ltar lus las ma byin par len par 'byung ba la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'di ltar lus las ma byin par len par 'byung ba la sogs pa 'og nas ston par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Thus, taking what is not given and so on arise from the body.

original: / de yang gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: / de yang gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what do they arise?

original: lus las 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus las 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: They arise from the body.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: de las lus kyi nyes par spyod pa ni gsum mo zhes pa ni ma byin par len pa dang / srog gcod pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de las lus kyi nyes par spyod pa ni gsum mo zhes pa ni ma byin par len pa dang / srog gcod pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: From that, there are three bodily misdeeds: taking what is not given, killing, and sexual misconduct.

original: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi ni tshig 'khyal pa dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / phra ma dang / brdzun no //
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi ni tshig 'khyal pa dang / ngag rtsub mo dang / phra ma dang / brdzun no //
translated: There are four verbal misdeeds: frivolous speech, harsh speech, divisive speech, and lying.

original: yid kyi gsum ni chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi gsum ni chags sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: There are three mental misdeeds: covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: de dag la yang ci'i phyir mi dge ba zhes bya ba zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la yang ci'i phyir mi dge ba zhes bya ba zhe na /
translated: Why are they called nonvirtuous?

original: 'bras bu sdug bsngal bskyed pa nyid dang / ngam pas smad pa nyid dang ; g-yeng ba sna tshogs bskyed pa nyid dang / bde ba'i skabs mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu sdug bsngal bskyed pa nyid dang / ngam pas smad pa nyid dang ; g-yeng ba sna tshogs bskyed pa nyid dang / bde ba'i skabs mi phyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it produces the result of suffering, because it is despised by the wise, because it produces various distractions, and because it does not provide an opportunity for happiness.

original: de bas na 'dis mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa bskyed pa de yang mi dge ba las byung la de yang rab 'bring gi bye brag gis sdug bsngal gyi bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa bskyed pa de yang mi dge ba las byung la de yang rab 'bring gi bye brag gis sdug bsngal gyi bye brag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the suffering of the Avici hell and so on, which is produced by this, arises from the unwholesome. And because there is a distinction of suffering due to the distinction of the unwholesome as strong or weak,

original: de bas na 'dis ni bde ba'i skabs su dbye ba med cing sdug bsngal myong ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dis ni bde ba'i skabs su dbye ba med cing sdug bsngal myong ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: therefore, it is said that there is no opportunity for happiness in that state of suffering, in which there is the experience of suffering.

original: de dag gi dbye ba yang du zhig ce na /
analyzed: de dag gi dbye ba yang du zhig ce na /
translated: How many kinds of unwholesome action are there?

original: nyes par spyod pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of unwholesome action:

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: tha mal ba ni thams cad kyi thams cad du dge ba dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: tha mal ba ni thams cad kyi thams cad du dge ba dang bral ba'o //
translated: The ordinary is that which is completely devoid of the wholesome.

original: lci ba ni gang gis tshogs pa'i nyon mongs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: lci ba ni gang gis tshogs pa'i nyon mongs pa byed pa'o //
translated: The heavy is that which produces the afflictions of the aggregates.

original: lci ba zhes bya ba de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: lci ba zhes bya ba de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “heavy”?

original: pha ma ni rang gi lus bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: pha ma ni rang gi lus bskyed pa'o //
translated: One’s parents are heavy because they have given birth to one’s body.

original: bla ma ni dbang bskur zhing man ngag ston pa ste /
analyzed: bla ma ni dbang bskur zhing man ngag ston pa ste /
translated: One’s guru is heavy because he has conferred initiation and taught the esoteric instructions.

original: bla ma khyad par can no //🔽de gsod pa ni mtshams med pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma khyad par can no // de gsod pa ni mtshams med pa'o //
translated: He is a special guru.🔽To kill them is a heinous act.

original: rdeg pa ni nye ba'i las so //
analyzed: rdeg pa ni nye ba'i las so //
translated: To beat them is a subsidiary act.

original: de las gzhan pa'i srog gcod pa dang ; ma byin par len pa la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha mal pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i srog gcod pa dang ; ma byin par len pa la sogs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha mal pa'o //
translated: Other killing, stealing, etc., are ordinary because they are causes of suffering and are not grave sins.

original: gzhan go sla'o //
analyzed: gzhan go sla'o //
translated: The rest are easy to understand.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa dbye ba dang bcas pa bshad nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi gang zag kyang yin zhe na /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par 'dor @267a * //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa dbye ba dang bcas pa bshad nas nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi gang zag kyang yin zhe na / pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam par 'dor @267a * //
translated: Thus, having explained the afflictions together with their divisions, the author now explains the person who is the basis of the afflictions.

original: ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang du mi len cing mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang du mi len cing mi spyod pa'o //
translated: “He who rejects the six perfections” is one who does not accept and practice the six perfections.

original: yid shin tu rmongs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang de kho na nyid mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: yid shin tu rmongs pa ni rgyu dang 'bras bu dang de kho na nyid mi shes pa'o //
translated: “He who is very confused” is one who does not know cause and effect and reality.

original: de dang gang ldan pa de las nyon mongs pa 'byung bas 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi gang zag go //
analyzed: de dang gang ldan pa de las nyon mongs pa 'byung bas 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi gang zag go //
translated: The person who possesses that is the person who is the basis of the afflictions, because the afflictions arise from that.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'bras bu yang gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the result of the afflictions?

original: ngan 'gror mchog tu gzhol ba ni ngan 'gro la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: ngan 'gror mchog tu gzhol ba ni ngan 'gro la dga' ba ste /
translated: The supreme inclination toward bad destinies is the delight in bad destinies.

original: des 'bras bu mnar med pa la sogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: des 'bras bu mnar med pa la sogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: By that, one obtains the result of the Avīci hell and so on.

original: des na 'dis ni 'khor ba'i chos dang rgyu dang thabs dang 'bras bu bstan te nyon mongs pa sa bon dang bcas pa'i gang zag ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: des na 'dis ni 'khor ba'i chos dang rgyu dang thabs dang 'bras bu bstan te nyon mongs pa sa bon dang bcas pa'i gang zag ni rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, this teaches the phenomena of saṃsāra, their cause, method, and result. The person with the seed of the afflictions is the cause.

original: ma byin par yin pa la sogs pa ni thabs so //
analyzed: ma byin par yin pa la sogs pa ni thabs so //
translated: Stealing and so on are the method.

original: des ngan song gsum por skye ba 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: des ngan song gsum por skye ba 'di ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The birth in the three bad destinies by that is the result.

original: des dge ba'i chos spong ba 'di ni las su dgongs te /
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos spong ba 'di ni las su dgongs te /
translated: The abandonment of virtuous dharmas by that is considered the action.

original: de ltar sems ma rtogs pas 'khor ba'i chos su gyur pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sems ma rtogs pas 'khor ba'i chos su gyur pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the phenomena of saṃsāra through not realizing the mind,

original: da ni sems dben pa zhes mya ngan las 'das pa shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sems dben pa zhes mya ngan las 'das pa shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach nirvāṇa, which is called “the isolation of the mind,”

original: rang bzhin snang ba'i rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang bzhin snang ba'i rim gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse begins, “By the stages of the appearance of the nature…”

original: rang bzhin ni 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature is the nature of error.

original: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ni snang ba ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin dang bral ba ni snang ba ste /
translated: The appearance is the freedom from the nature of error.

original: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni snang ba thob pa la thub pa'o //
analyzed: rim gyis zhes bya ba ni snang ba thob pa la thub pa'o //
translated: The stages is the attainment of the appearance.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: sems rnam par dben pa ni sems rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sems rnam par dben pa ni sems rtog pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: The mind is isolated, that is, the mind is free from conceptuality.

original: gang gi nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba'i sems gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba'i sems gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The mind that is free from afflictions is called that.

original: sems dben pa zhes bya ba la yang ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: sems dben pa zhes bya ba la yang ji lta bu yin /
translated: What is the mind that is isolated?

original: ci dge ba'am mi dge ba la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: ci dge ba'am mi dge ba la dmigs pa'am /
translated: Is it the observation of virtue or nonvirtue?

original: de'i rnam pa can zhig yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can zhig yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is it the aspect of that?

original: ma yin pa'i phyir lus dang ngag yid kyi leg  par spyod pa ni dge ba bcu po ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa'i phyir lus dang ngag yid kyi leg  par spyod pa ni dge ba bcu po ste /
translated: It is not that. The good conduct of body, speech, and mind is the ten virtues.

original: ma byin par len pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of taking what is not given and so on.

original: de la yang mi dmigs shing de'i rnam pa dang bral zhe'o //
analyzed: de la yang mi dmigs shing de'i rnam pa dang bral zhe'o //
translated: It is also the nonobservation of that and the freedom from the aspect of that.

original: 'o na nyes par spyod pa la rtog gam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na nyes par spyod pa la rtog gam zhe na /
translated: But do they not think about evil conduct?

original: nyes bar spyod pa ni mi dge ba bcu ste /
analyzed: nyes bar spyod pa ni mi dge ba bcu ste /
translated: Evil conduct is the ten nonvirtues,

original: ma byin par len pa dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa la mi sems mi rtog go //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / srog gcod pa la sogs pa la mi sems mi rtog go //
translated: such as taking what is not given and killing.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na zhes pa ni sems rnam par dben pa dag ba dang mi dge ba la mi rtog pa de nyid ci'i phyir zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na zhes pa ni sems rnam par dben pa dag ba dang mi dge ba la mi rtog pa de nyid ci'i phyir zhes pa'o //
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i lan du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin ni de'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i lan du dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rang bzhin ni de'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The answer is: The nature of virtue and nonvirtue is their characteristic.

original: de gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what do they arise?

original: stong pa gsum las byung ste snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba @267b thob pa gsum las byung ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa gsum las byung ste snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang / snang ba @267b thob pa gsum las byung ba'o //
translated: They arise from the three voids, from the three lights: the light, the increase of light, and the culmination of light.

original: gang gi stobs kyis ji ltar byung zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis ji ltar byung zhe na /
translated: By whose power do they arise?

original: rlung gis bzhon pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: rlung gis bzhon pa'i dbang gis te /
translated: By the power of the vāyu.

original: shes pa rlung la zhon zhing rlung lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa rlung la zhon zhing rlung lhan cig tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Consciousness rides on the vāyu and arises simultaneously with the vāyu.

original: de yang dus ci tsam du 'byung zhe na skad cig la ste /
analyzed: de yang dus ci tsam du 'byung zhe na skad cig la ste /
translated: For how long does that arise? It arises for an instant.

original: mig btsums pa la sogs pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig btsums pa la sogs pa'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the closing of the eyes.

original: byung nas kyang ci byed ce na /
analyzed: byung nas kyang ci byed ce na /
translated: And what does it do after it has arisen?

original: yul rnams rjes su myong nas te gzugs la sogs pa dmigs shing tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul rnams rjes su myong nas te gzugs la sogs pa dmigs shing tshor ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It experiences the objects, i.e., it perceives form, etc., and it experiences sensation.

original: de nas gar 'gro zhe na /
analyzed: de nas gar 'gro zhe na /
translated: And where does it go after that?

original: yang dang yang du 'od gsal bar 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'od gsal bar 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: It enters into clear light again and again.

original: dus thams cad du 'od gsal ba rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes pa 'dis shes pa rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal bar bstan to //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'od gsal ba rang bzhin gyis dag pa'o zhes pa 'dis shes pa rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that consciousness is clear light by nature.

original: de ltar shes nas lam gyi snang ba gsum la blo gtad pas dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od gsal ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar shes nas lam gyi snang ba gsum la blo gtad pas dri ma dang bral ba'i 'od gsal ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having understood it in this way, one should direct the mind to the three appearances of the path, and one will attain clear light free from defilement.

original: de bas na dge ba'i rten can gyis ni rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na dge ba'i rten can gyis ni rgyu bstan to //
translated: Thus, the cause is shown to be the one which has virtue as its basis.
